loans.name: Armando Edelmiro

texts.es:
Armando es un hombre trabajador, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Huancavelica con su familia.
Su mayor motivación es su familia, es por ellos que trabaja arduamente para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Desde hace más de 3 años trabaja en Construcción Civil como obrero y le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, 
trabajador y con muchos deseos de superación.
Armando está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar una cocina para su casa y una cama, de esta manera mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá esforzándose para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Armando is a hardworking man. He is 22 years old, single, and lives with his family in Huancavelica. His family is his primary motivation, so he works hard in order to provide a better future for them. For the past three years, he has worked in the construction sector as a laborer. He is doing very well because he is responsible, hardworking, and has the drive to succeed.

Armando is grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the support they have provided. He will be able to buy a stove for his house and a bed. This will improve his family’s quality of life and he continues his efforts to move forward.

loans.use: to buy a stove and a bed.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Isabel se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de limpieza, la socia vende jabones, cepillos entre otros, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender los productos de limpieza. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar jabones, cepillos y detergentes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Isabel has a business in which she sells cleaning products such as soap, scrub brushes, and other items. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. Isabel has been in this business for eight years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell cleaning products. She is requesting a loan in order to buy soap, scrub brushes, and detergents.

Isabel is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy soap, scrub brushes, and detergents.

loans.name: Chrisline

texts.en:
Chrisline is 41 years old and is married with four children. She earns a living from her pig fattening business. Chrisline has been fattening pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Chrisline is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a 58-year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Leonida has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines, and has been in this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.

In the future, Leonida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Cantibura

texts.en:
Cantibura works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years now. 

Cantibura requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Jesus Group

texts.es: Dúo Jesus La encargada de este grupo es la señora Aura Estela quien tiene una venta de pan desde hace 12 años, también se dedica a la venta de pasteles y pastelitos, cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo.  Tiene varios pedidos de pasteles pero la cámara fría de pasteles que tiene es muy pequeña y no les puede ofrecer a sus clientes las variedades  y tamaños de pasteles por el espacio tan pequeño.  Por tal motivo ella necesita un crédito para poder comprar una cámara fría de pasteles más grande.  Su sueño sigue siendo cada día crecer y darles lo mejor a sus dos hijas que aun están pequeñas.
texts.en:
Jesus Group

The leader of this group is Sra. Aura Estela, who has been selling bread for 12 years. She also sells cakes and pastries. Aura has the unconditional support of her husband.

She has several cake orders, but her chilling cabinet is very small, which means that she is not able to offer much variety and different sizes to her customers because there is not much space. For this reason, Aura needs a loan so that she can buy a larger chilling cabinet. Her dream is to keep growing each day so that she can provide the best for her two young daughters.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerated display case for storing cakes.

loans.name: J. Noe

texts.es: El señor J.  Noé, tiene 44 años de edad, esta casado tiene 4 hijos y vive con su esposa e hijos en la aldea la Flecha, Santa Bárbara. El siempre se ha dedicado a realizar trabajos de jornal y agricultura. En busca de obtener mejores ingresos decidió con su esposa establecer su propio negocio. Vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, frijoles, Maíz, carnes, embutidos, manteca, condimentos, huevos, refrescos, churros, dulces etc. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para surtir su negocio con productos de granos básicos, carnes, refrescos, huevos, azúcar, pan, manteca, y golosinas. Su propósito es ampliar el negocio para obtener ganancias y mejorar su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. J. Noe is 44 years old, married, and has four children. He lives with his wife and children in the neighborhood of La Flecha, Santa Bárbara.

J. Noe has always worked in agriculture or as a day laborer. In order to generate more income, he and his wife decided to establish their own business. They sell basic household products such as rice, beans, corn, cured meats, lard, condiments, eggs, soft drinks, snack foods, candy, and other items. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that he can restock his business with products such as basic grains, meats, soft drinks, eggs, sugar, bread, lard, and snack foods. His goal is to expand the business so that he can generate revenue and improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meats, soft drinks, eggs, sugar, bread, lard, and snack foods.

loans.name: María Isidora

texts.es: Isidora  es una señora casada con hijo a su cargo al que le brinda su apoyo para su desarrollo, y se desempeña como conserje  en el Mined de la comunidad donde vive con 10 años de laborar. Esta señora hoy en día  atraviesa la necesidad de obtener su titulo de Lic. Maestra de educación primaria producto del gran esfuerzo realizado para alcanzar tan deseado sueño, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión sabia de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para realizar el pago de trámite de Titulo,  el que le beneficiara aun mas en su centro laboral.
texts.en:
Isidora is a married woman with a dependent child for whom she provides support so that he can develop. She has worked as a caretaker the past 10 years for the Ministry of Education in the community where she lives.

Today she needs to obtain her degree in Elementary Education, the result of a great amount of effort in order to achieve her dream. Isidora decided to visit CEPRODEL so that she could request a loan in order to pay the processing fees for her degree. In the end, she will benefit greatly in her workplace.

loans.use: to pay the processing fees for her degree.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKADI II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MASSAMAKANA, commune de KEBILA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec RAMATOU SINALY  1ère personne accroupie  à droite sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2 hectares. La production est vendue au niveau du village  et à  KEBILA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle envidage réaliser un bénéfice de 175.000FCFA qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Members of the Benkadi II group are married women who on average are 39 years old with five children, all living in polygamous families in Massamakana, part of the Kebila commune in the Kolondieba circle, one of the prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution, and all past loans have been fully repaid.

The crops cultivated are rice and groundnuts featuring Ramatou Sinaly, the first person squatting on the right in the photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs, seeds and pay for plowing to cultivate two hectares (about 5 acres). After harvest the crop is sold in the village and in Kebila to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to attain profits of 175,000 CFA francs, enabling her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy inputs, seeds and pay plowing costs for the crop year.

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKADI III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  37 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MASSAMAKANA, commune de KEBILA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec MINATA  2ème personne debout sur la photo de la gauche à la droite. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  0,5 hectare. La production est vendue au niveau du village,  et à  KEBILA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle envisage faire un bénéfice de 40.000FCFA qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Members of the Benkadi III group are married women who on average are 37 years old with five children, all living in polygamous families in Massamakana, part of the Kebila commune in the Kolondieba circle, one of the prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and all past loans have been fully repaid.

The crops cultivated are rice and groundnuts featuring Minata, the second person standing from left to right in the photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs, seeds and pay for plowing to cultivate 0.5 hectares (about 1.24 acres). After harvest the crop is sold in the village and in Kebila to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to attain profits of 40,000 CFA francs, enabling her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy inputs, seeds, and pay plowing costs for the crop year.

loans.name: Jeanra

texts.en:
Jeanra is 43 years old and is married with six children.

Jeanra works hard to provide for her family, and runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening and selling fruit and vegetables. Jeanra has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Jeanra aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for twenty years now. 

Lucena requested a loan of PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling nipa roofing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now. 

Nicolasa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more nipa roofing to sell to her customers.

In the future, Nicolasa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more nipa roofing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fenika

texts.en:
Fenika is a 49-year-old divorced woman with five children. She makes and sells fish and chips in her community to earn a living. She has six years of experience with this business. 

Fenika needs a loan to buy a sack of potatoes, a large gas burner, a large strainer, a bucket of cooking oil, salt, mayonnaise, tomato sauce, chicken leg quarters and sausages. 

She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Fenika has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy equipment and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Tuamasaga

texts.en:
Tuamasaga is a 54-year-old married woman with eight children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has nine years of experience with this business. 

Tuamasaga needs a loan to buy sandwiches, donuts, pies, snacks, soft drinks, scones, a small display fridge and a mini chest freezer. She plans to use her profits to help with her families weekly expenses. Tuamasaga has been a member of SPBD since 2005.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, donuts, pies, snacks, soft drinks, scones, a small display fridge and a mini chest freezer.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”REYNITA DE BELEN DE CCORAO;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Sabina; La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de artesanía, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como persnales, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan en las distintas ferias que se realizan por la zona, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mantas entre otros.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sabina belongs to the "Reynita de Belen de Ccorao" communal bank, located in the Ccorao District of Calca Province, in the Cusco Region. 

Sabina continues to buy and sell handicrafts. She has run this business for several years and it has brought her much economic and personal satisfaction.  She sells her goods to customers at the different fairs in the area, and wants to continue working so she can support her family.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase blankets and other items for her business. Sabina is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments on-time.

loans.use: To buy blankets and other items.

loans.name: Kotognogontala I Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  KOTOGNOGONTALA I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  38 ans, 4enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BELLA, commune de KEBILA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec SITAN  1ère personne debout à gauche sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter :0,5 hectare. La production est vendue au niveau du village, et à  KEBILA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. SITAN compte avoir un bénéfice de 42.000FCFA qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Members of the Kotognogontala I group are married women who on average are 38 years old with four children, all living in polygamous families in Bella, part of the Kebila commune in the Kolondieba circle, one of the prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and all past loans have been fully repaid.

The crops cultivated are rice and groundnuts featuring Sitan, the first person standing on the left in the photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs, seeds and pay for plowing to cultivate 0.5 hectares (about 1.24 acres). After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Kebila, to a clientele composed of men and women.

Sitan hopes to attain profits of 42,000 CFA francs, enabling her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses

loans.use: buy inputs, seeds, and pay plowing costs for the crop year

loans.name: Kotognogontala Ii Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  KOTOGNOGONTALA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BELLA, commune de KEBILA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le riz  avec SARAN  1ère personne debout à droite sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  0,5 hectare. La production est vendue au niveau du village et à  KEBILA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. SARAN espère réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA qui sera utiliser pour payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Members of the Kotognogontala II group are married women who on average are 35 years old with four children, all living in polygamous families in Bella, part of the Kebila commune in the Kolondieba circle, one of the prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and all past loans have been fully repaid.

The crops cultivated are groundnuts and rice featuring Saran, the first person standing on the right in the photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs, seeds and pay for plowing to cultivate 0.5 hectares (about 1.24 acres). After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Kebila, to a clientele composed of men and women.

Sitan hopes to attain profits of 50,000 CFA francs, enabling her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy inputs, seeds, and pay plowing costs for the crop year

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 56 years old and is married with six children.

Ruth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock, such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, coffee, sugar, juice, cereals, etc. to sell.

Ruth has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling fish.

Ruth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, coffee, sugar, juice, cereals, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Cerelita

texts.en:
Cerelita is a 54-year-old married woman with seven children, one of whom is still in school.

Cerelita is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been fattening pigs for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWFT to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cerelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ladimir Edith

texts.es:
Ladimir esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya ue gracias al apoyo brindado ella podrá comprar materiales para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda, como refacción de paredes, mejoras de techo, piso, entre otros con lo cual podrá mejorar su condición de vida, sobre todo porque es madre de un pequeño al cual quiere mucho y por quien da la vida para poder brindarle un mejor futuro.

Ladimir trabaja en su pequeño negocio de confección y compostura de prendas de vestir desde hace 10 años, lo cual le ha permitido tener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y poder salir adelante, sobre todo porque su gran sueño es :” implementar su negocio con maquinas de coser nuevas y poder darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Ladimir is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to your support she will be able to buy materials to renovate her house.  She wants to repair the walls, and improve the roof and floor to improve her living conditions, especially because she has a little boy who she adores and for whom she wants to provide a better future.

Ladimir has a small sewing business which she has been running for ten years.  This has allowed her to earn enough to cover household expenses and get ahead.  Her greatest goal is to buy new sewing machines and give her son a professional education.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Lelabeth

texts.en:
Lelabeth is a 39-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lelabeth has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Lelabeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is single and has an egg vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years now.

Evelyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more eggs to sell to her customers.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is a 39-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lyn has a weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. Lyn requested a loan of PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more materials for her weaving business.

In the future, Lyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Sapela

texts.en:
Sapela is 49 years old and is married with four children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages and cucumbers that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. 

Sapela needs a loan to buy fertilizer, insect poison, weed killer, a new wheelbarrow, gloves, new overalls and a machete. She has been a member of SPBD for four years. Sapela will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and equipment for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Edward Robert

texts.es:
Edward es un joven emprendedor, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Actualmente está estudiando la carrera de Computación e Informática en un Instituto porque es una persona con muchos deseos de superación.
Desde hace algún tiempo trabaja ofreciendo servicios de tipeo en un puesto que tiene en una Galería, le va muy bien porque siempre trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Edward está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprarse una latpop para poder realizar los trabajos de la Universidad y pueda obtener mejores calificaciones, de esta manera más adelante podrá convertirse en un profesional exitoso.
texts.en:
Edward, 21, is a young entrepreneur who is single and lives in Ica with his family.  He currently is studying toward a Computer and Information Technology degree because he has a great desire to get ahead.

For some time he has been offering typing services at a stall in a shopping center.  Business is going very well for him because he always works with much effort and dedication.

Edward is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to your support he will be able to buy a laptop computer for his university work which will allow him to get better grades and become a successful professional.

loans.use: To buy a laptop computer.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia is 54 years old and is married with four children. Anatalia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, toothpaste, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, etc. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Anatalia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Yolbis

texts.es:
Yolbis es un joven emprendedor, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y vive en San Martin junto a su familia.
Desde hace algunos años se dedica a la Agricultura, teniendo como principal producto el Cacao y siendo uno de los productos más solicitados por los clientes. Tiene mucha experiencia en este sector por lo cual sus productos son de excelente calidad.
Yolbis está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar insumos como fertilizantes para poder realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos y así en la etapa de cosecha pueda obtener productos de excelente calidad y pueda ofertarlos a un precio competitivo en el mercado. De esta manera seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder: "Convertirse en un líder en la producción de cacao".
texts.en:
Yolbis, 24, is a young entrepreneur who is single and lives in San Martin with his family.  He has worked in agriculture from a very young age and mainly produces cocoa which is one of the most popular products requested by customers.  He has a lot of experience in the sector and he produces excellent quality crops.

Yolbis is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to your support he will be able to buy supplies such as fertilizers for the maintenance of his crops.  This means he will have an excellent crop at harvest time and will be able to sell his produce at a competitive market price.  This will allow him to continue working hard to get ahead and "Become a leading cocoa producer."

loans.use: To buy supplies such as fertilizers to improve his crops.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Iii Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  KOTOGNOGONTALA III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BELLA, commune de KEBILA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec FATOUMATA  1ère personne accroupie à gauche sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  0,5 hectare. La production est vendue au niveau du village et à  KEBILA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle envisage  avoir un bénéfice de 55.000FCFA qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kotognogontala III Group are married women with an average age of 35 and an average of five children each. They all live within polygamous family frameworks in Bella, in Kebila Commune, Kolondieba Cercle, one of the prefectures found in the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can see through their agricultural activities during the winter period. This is their sixth loan with Soro Yiriwaso, with whom their previous loans were paid back in full. The group's main produce is rice and peanuts.

The group's representative is Fatoumata, the woman squatting to the left at the end of the front row in the photo. With this loan, she is planning on purchasing farming inputs and seeds, as well as paying for the labour costs to maintain half a hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and throughout Kebila to a customer base made up of both men and woman. She is planning on making a profit of 55,000 FCFA, which will allow her to pay off the loan and help her husband with their family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, seeds and farming inputs during the agricultural season

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 31 años de edad, es licenciado en computación,esta acompañado, su compañera de vida  trabaja en el hospital nacional,tienen un hijo de tres años,viven junto a sus suegros.


Carlos es empleado trabaja en una escuela cercana,esta por contrato ya tiene dos años, el trabajo le queda lejos de su hogar, el horario de entrada al trabajo es de 7:00 AM  a 4:00 PM.

 Carlos necesita el préstamo para comprar unas medicinas a su hijo,puesto que es un tratamiento por tiempo indefinido,y de esa forma lograra salir adelante para que su hijo siga adelante y se recupere.

El sueño de Carlos junto a la madre de su hijo, es que su hijo siempre tenga sus medicamentos a tiempo puesto que les nació de seis meses y de esa forma trabajaran duro para  darle lo que necesita.
texts.en:
Carlos is 31 years old. He has a degree in computing, and lives with his partner. His life partner works in the national hospital. The couple and their 3-year-old son all live with her parents.

Carlos works at a near-by school. He has had an employment contract there for two years. His place of work is far from his house. He starts work at 7:00 AM and finishes at 4:00 PM.

Carlos needs a loan to buy medication for his son, because he needs a treatment for an indefinite period of time. This way he will be able to carry on and to support his son and have his get well.

Carlos’s and his partner’s dream is for their son to always have his medication in time, since he was prematurely born at six months. They will work hard to give him what he needs.

loans.use: to buy medication for his son.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia Fortunata se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras y tambien sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia lleva a diferentes lugares, la socia vende cebollas, tomates y zapallos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras como cebollas, zanahorias y tomates. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Fortunata continues working selling vegetables and also continues with her business raising animals, which she brings to different places.  She sells onions, tomatoes and squash. She has worked for a number of years in this business and it is going well for her. Her dream is to have a retail space where she can sell her vegetables. She asks for this loan to purchase vegetables such as onions, carrots and tomatoes.

She is happy to have the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as onions, carrots and tomatoes.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 59 años de edad, es soltera y vive en San Vicente junto a su familia.
Tiene una hija a quien tuvo que sacar adelante sola porque se separó de su pareja en aquel tiempo. Pero eso no fue un impedimento para ella, luchó día a día para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Desde hace 2 años trabaja en un restaurante, le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajadora, siempre atendiendo con mucho respeto y amabilidad a sus clientes.
Victoria está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un armario para que pueda tener sus ropas en mayor orden. De esta manera mejorará su calidad de vida y seguirá esforzándose para más adelante cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener su propio restaurante".
texts.en:
Victoria is an enterprising woman, she is 59 years old, single, and lives in San Vicente with her family.

She has a daughter who she had to get ahead on her own since she separated from her partner at that time. But this was not an impediment for her. She fought day after day to improve her family's quality of life.

For the past 2 years, she has worked in a restaurant. It is going very well for her because she is very responsible, hard-working, and always serves the customers with great respect and friendliness.

Victoria is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the support they have offered her, she will be able to purchase a wardrobe so that she can have her clothing more organized. In this way she will improve her quality of life and continue to work hard to get ahead and realize her biggest dream - to have her own restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase a wardrobe.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia Cirila se sigue dedicando al negocio de criaza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Cirila continues her business raising small animals such as guinea pigs and hens. She fattens and raises them, then sells them in various fairs and markets. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.  She has been working in this business for four years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a retail space where she can sell the animals. She asks for this loan to purchase guinea pigs and hens.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: El señor Jorge  labora como Director en un colegio del municipio en el turno matutino, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 18  años además de esto por las tardes labora en su casa de habitación  haciendo levantado de texto y revisa monografías por medio de esto obtiene otros ingresos a mas de su salario para sobre vivir, es casado  con un hijo al que le  brinda su apoyo para su desarrollo. El señor Jorge actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de un computador, por este motivo  se acerco a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar dicho financiamiento.
texts.en: Jorge works as the director of a municipal school in the morning shift.  He has worked in this field for the past 18 years, in addition to this, during the afternoons he works at home transcribing and editing texts. From this, he earns additional income, more than his salary, with which to live.  He is married with one child for whose development he offers his support. Jorge is currently asking for a loan to purchase a computer, and for this reason he approached the Ceprodel office to ask for this funding.

loans.use: to purchase a desktop computer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, a 23-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines, has been operating her transportation business for five years, and she makes a good income from this. She is married and the couple is determined to work hard to provide their children with a better education than they currently have. Having a big family requires a lot of effort to provide for everyone’s needs.

Mary Ann and her husband have a tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community members. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 every day.

Mary Ann is taking out PHP 19,000 loan to continue operating here business. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and also to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

In the future, she wants to help provide for the needs of the family and she dreams of a prosperous life for them.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Djekabara Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJEKABARA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BANANZOLE, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le riz et le mil avec   OUMOU, 3ème personne  debout de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de DIALAKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can see through their agricultural activities during the winter period. This is their fourth farming loan with Soro Yiriwaso, with whom their previous loans were paid back in full.

Oumou, the woman standing third from the right in the back row of the photo, grows peanuts, rice and millet. With this loan, she is planning on purchasing farming inputs and seeds, as well as paying for the labour costs to maintain two hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in Dialakoroba to a customer base made up of resellers and consumers. She is planning on making a profit of 195,000 FCFA with each harvest, which will allow her to pay off the loan and help her husband with their family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, seeds and farming inputs

loans.name: Nang

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Nang is 44 years old and married. She has four children. To make a living, she has been farming rice for 26 years. Her current business earns her about 36,000 KHR per day. 

Nang has been with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to produce more crops so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Naomi Onosai

texts.en:
Naomi is 38 years old, married and has 11 children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Naomi needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, a spade, a machete, new gum boots and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. 

Naomi will use the profits from her sales to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, a spade, a machete, new gum boots and crops.

loans.name: Tiburcio Antonio

texts.es: Tiburcio tiene 53 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida quien se dedica a las tareas del hogar. Tiburcio es jornalero y agricultor por lo que de esta forma se gana la vida y mantiene la economía de su familia. Tiburcio habita en condiciones muy humildes y desea reparar el techo de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, pines para lámina, etc. para reparar el techo de la vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Tiburcio, 53, lives in his own house with his life companion, a homemaker.  Tiburcio earns his living and supports his family budget as a day laborer and a farmer.

Tiburcio lives in very modest conditions and wants to repair the roof of his house, so he's asking FUSAI for a loan.  He's going to invest in buying galvanized metal, wood, bolts for the metal sheeting, and other materials to repair the roof of his house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal, wood, bolts, and other materials

loans.name: Jean Mary

texts.en:
Jean Mary works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner, and she has a general store business in the Philippines. Jean Mary has been in this business for three years now.

Jean Mary requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Jean Mary would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Yonn

texts.en:
Originally from a village in the Prey Chhor district where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Yunn is a 52-year-old mother of six children who are under school age. 

Yunn and her husband farm rice and raise pigs as the main source of the family’s income; they have been doing this for 34 years. This is the first microloan for Yunn with VisionFund.  

Now she is asking for a new loan to renovate her old house. 

She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Jhonalyn

texts.en:
Jhonalyn is 21 years old and married.  She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Jhonalyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Jhonalyn has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 61 years old, and married with three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 14 years. 

Ana needs a loan to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, gloves, a tiller, a crowbar, new overalls, sprayers and a machete. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2000. 

Ana will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, gloves, a tiller, a crowbar, new overalls, sprayers and a machete

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is a 35-year-old married woman with three children. 

She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Akenese needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, chicken leg quarters, sausages, lamb chops, tomato sauce, foil, Chinese onions and a new barbeque set. 

She plans to use her profits to expand her business and pay for her children's education. Akenese has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, chicken leg quarters, sausages, lamb chops, tomato sauce, foil, chinese onions and a new barbeque set.

loans.name: Leodigario

texts.en:
Leodigario is a hardworking entrepreneur from Silang Cavite, Philippines.  He is 56 years old, married to Veronica, and they have three children.  

He sells fresh fish to provide for the everyday needs and expenditures of the family.

Leodigario buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. He buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer his products since they are assured of freshness and cleanliness. His store is located in a temporary fish market. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

Leodigario is taking out PHP 19,000 loan to continue operations of his business. He will be using the loan to buy more fish, which are necessary to increase his inventory.

In the future, he wants to have his own fish stall in the market. He hopes for his income to boost and that his business will continue to help him to improve their general living condition. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God he studies.

 *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fish to be sold at the market.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Aged 56 and with eight children, Mom is a resident of the Moung Russey district located in Battambang province.  

She strives to make a living from one and half hectare of cassava and three hectares of rice cropping. She has engaged in agribusiness for about 40 years already. Her previous loan was the first loan for Mom with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid her past loan with success and it enabled her to uplift her lifestyle in a gradual pace. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan.  

Her entire group requests a loan of 3,400,000 KHR, which Mom owns a portion of 1,200,000 KHR. 

As the leader, she plans to use the share of loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fee. 

She hopes that the loan will allow her to get a higher yield from the farm so that she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fee

loans.name: Cheoun's Group

texts.en:
Chheoun and her family are living in the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is 49 years old and has six children. 

For her family, rice farming has been the primary source of income for about 29 years already. She also works for a local resident to earn extra income to support her family. 

This is the first loan for Chhoeurn and her co-borrower in a group of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

As the leader, she plans to use her share of loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer, rice seed and pesticide. 

She hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a new business in order to enhance the life of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed and pesticide

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Thhy's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Kampong Cham province, Thhy is a 50-year-old married woman with two children. She is a farmer who does rice farming in order to earn a living for the family. She has engaged in agribusiness for about 25 years already. Thhy also works for local resident to earn extra income to support her family. The average income for the family is only 23,600 KHR per day.  

This is the second loan for Thhy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has repaid her past loan completely. In a group of four members, Thhy is the group leader. 

The group requests a loan of 1,400,000 KHR which Thhy will own a portion of 400,000 KHR. 

Thhy will use her portion of the loan to support her rice farming business as she needs to rent a machine to harvest the yield. 

She hopes that the loan will push her family to better living conditions.

loans.use: to rent a machine to harvest the yield

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Iloa

texts.en:
Iloa is a 42-year-old woman who is married with six children. She has a small taxi service business to earn a living; she has six years with this business.

She needs a loan to buy new tires, a taxi sign indicator, new seat covers, air fresheners, a new gear box, and shocks. 

She will use her profits to help with the renovation of her house, and pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Iloa joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tires, a taxi sign indicator, new seat covers, air fresheners, a new gear box and shocks

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta is a 64-year-old woman who is married with five children. She has a small flea market business to earn a living. She has 32 years with this business. 

Mareta needs a loan to buy cava bowls, samoan tapa, samoan bangles, slippers, samoan shirts, samoan shorts, wooden carved designs and a large glass dispenser. 

She will use her profits to expand her business and help with her family's weekly expenses. 

Mareta joined SPBD in 2003 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cava bowls, samoan tapa, samoan bangles, slippers, samoan shirts, samoan shorts, wooden carved designs and a large glass dispenser

loans.name: New Lamka Gck Group

texts.en:
Determined and hardworking Chingngaihniang leads a group of 12 women from a locality in the hill town of Manipur. She is 44 years old, smart and talented. She works hard to support her family even though she is still single. 

In order to support herself and reduce the family’s financial worries, she took the initiative to open a garment shop in the main town market on rent. In her shop she keeps items like shirts, shoes, gowns, hand-woven bags, etc. She gets some of the supplies from the capital state and for some she uses her own expertise and designs them. Her hand-made items are well known in the locality and people love her creations.

Chingngaihniang says she has been doing this business for the past eight years. She is very happy with the turnover she gets from the business. She wants to expand the shop and increase her inventory. The sales are high during the holidays, occasions and festive season. 

Chingngaihniang says the business is special to her because it makes her happy; her favorite part about being in this business is giving customer service and getting profits. She use the income to manage the family's affairs and she saves what is left in the bank.

Most of the time, however, the poor power supply in the area hampers her work. It is difficult to work past sunset due to poor power supply. Since she does not have any alternate source of power supply to rely on, she wants to avail a Kiva solar loan to buy 45-watt solar lighting systems, each having four bulbs. Once the system is installed in her store, she will be able to open the shop past sunset or even at night hassle-free, and this will bring her more income and the ability to afford better living standards.

The rest of the group members also need solar loans for their income-generating activities. The other members are engaged in weaving, variety store, second-hand business and the like. Also, some of the group members have children, and they will be able to study in the evenings by the light of these solar systems.

loans.use: To buy 45-watt mini solar home lighting to install in her garment shop to open the store for longer hours after sunset.

loans.name: Sylivia's Group

texts.en:
Sylvia's Group is comprised of hardworking women. Sylvia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 3 years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, sewing clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy material and threads and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and increase capital. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to advance in her business. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for receiving life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy material and threads.

loans.name: Eva's Group

texts.en:
Eva's Group is comprised of hardworking women. Eva is 17 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Eva has been working hard to manage her hotel business, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food items and will help Eva to generate greater profits and increase on her business. Eve hopes that in the future she will be able to divert to a clothing business. 

Eva is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum to receive life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more food items.

loans.name: Puao

texts.en:
Puao is 35 years old, married, and has four children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Puao needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a spade, a machete, a crowbar, barbed wire and iron poles. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. 

Puao will use the profits from her sales to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a spade, a machete, a crowbar, barbed wire and iron poles.

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina is 49 years old, married, and has five children. 

She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Katerina needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a tiller, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, gloves, gum boots, a machete, a rake and a new watering hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. 

Katerina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a tiller, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, gloves, gum boots, a machete, a rake and a new watering hose.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a purified drinking water business in the Philippines. Maxima has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from a welding shop.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell for her selling purified drinking water business.

Maxima has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph is a new client of UGAFODE. He is a young man, aged 30 years. He is businessman and resident of the city outskirts. He is web designer dealing in printing, and supplies pointed materials to organizations and individuals. However, he has a challenge of not having a modern printer, which is crucial in promoting his business to another level. This also brings to him a challenge of increased operating costs, as he has to pay for printing services from other firms or people, which in turn reduces his profitability and hinders his development. 

Therefore, in a bid to compete well, he approached UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. (MDI) for a loan so as to be able to acquire his own digital printer to ease his work, cut operating costs and thus, increase his profitability, leading to increased working capital and standards of living. He is grateful to UGAFODE for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy a printer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, soap, pure water, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Diaz

texts.en:
Diaz is a repeat client, aged 30 years. He is a married man with two children, and is a resident of the rural outskirts. He has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings to buy a motorcycle for transport. He does farming and rides a motorcycle to increase his income. 

The income from motorcycle riding helps him to meet his family needs and pay tuition for the children. He hopes with a second motorcycle his profits will increase, and soon, his standards of living will be elevated.

He thanks Kiva lenders for the heart to help people alleviate poverty. Pictured is Diaz with his wife (she signed the borrower waiver form).

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Zaina's Group

texts.en:
Zaina's Group is comprised of hardworking women. Zaina is 21 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 2 years, Zaina has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, posho, cooking oil, and soap. 

To help expand her business, Zaina has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more rice, posho, cooking oil, and soap and will help Zaina to generate greater profits and add more plots and buildings. Zaina hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Zaina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for receiving life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, posho, cooking oil, and soap.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine's Group is comprised of hardworking women. Christine is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 2 years, Christine has been working hard to manage her food stall business, which sells ground nut paste. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more groundnuts and will help Christine to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to begin construction of her house. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for receiving life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more groundnuts.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with three of them currently in school. For the past five years, Ibrahim has been working hard to manage his hardware business, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Ibrahim has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts like tires, rings, wheels and spanners, and will help Ibrahim to generate greater profits and earn money to pay school fees. 

Ibrahim hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts like tires, rings, wheels and spanners

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Milly has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap, utensils, blue band, sodas and plastic containers. 

To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap, utensils, blue band, sodas and plastic containers, and will help Milly to generate greater profits and improve her standards of living. 

Milly hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap, utensils, blue band, sodas and plastic containers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy candy to stock his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a generator, sewing machine and embroidery machine.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 38 years old and married. Norma works very hard to provide for her family.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines. Norma has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, cooking oil, sanitary pads, soft drinks, beers, biscuits, etc.  

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo, cooking oil, sanitary pads, soft drinks, beers, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Norma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like shampoo, cooking oil, sanitary pads, soft drinks, beers, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Amina has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, flasks, cooking oil, bread and eggs. 

To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stock of sugar, flasks, cooking oil, bread and eggs, and will help Amina to generate greater profits and improve her standards of living. 

Amina hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, flasks, cooking oil, bread and eggs

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 36 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Fatuma has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells bread, eggs, sugar, juice, rice and posho (corn meal). 

To help expand her business, Fatuma has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more  bread, eggs, sugar, juice, rice and posho, and will help Fatuma to generate greater profits and earn more. 

Fatuma hopes that in the future, she will be able to purchase more stock.

loans.use: to buy more bread, eggs, sugar, juice, rice and posho

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 41 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Getrude has been working hard to manage her agro-business, which sells fertilizers, sprays, and weed moister. 

To help expand her business, Getrude has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fertilizers, and will help Getrude to generate greater profits, and increased profits will have family benefits. 

Getrude hopes that in the future, she will be able to purchase more stock.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers

loans.name: Zenhang A Group

texts.en:
The featured member with her hand raised is Hatneitling and she belongs to Zenhang (A) group. All the group members live in the same vicinity. 

Hatneitling says she has always been interested in weaving since childhood. She used to weave before her marriage and continued this profession after marriage. She weaves traditional shawls and ladies' wrap-around skirts and sells them for 2,500 to 3,000 INR. She says that these items are in high demand at the market and have no risk of expiration. Demand for Hatneitling products is high during holidays and festive seasons, which in Manipur fall in the months of March, October, November and December. They are used as gifts on occasions like weddings, childbirths, send-off ceremonies,  Ningol Chakkouba (married daughters’ home visit) and house-warmings. She cannot meet customer demand on time due to shortage of her products, so she wants to continue her weaving even after sunset to speed up her work and also to increase her inventory. 

The power supply in her area is a big hurdle to her income generating activity, however. The solar loan will help her to buy a 45-watt solar home lighting system, which will light up four light bulbs for 12 hours a day. Since it has a 90-meter-long wire, it can be installed in any room in the house for one’s convenience. She believes that this solar lighting will serve her purpose in meeting her customers' demands and can raise her income since she can work extra hours after sunset. 

Likewise, the rest of the group members need solar loans for their respective income-generating activities. The other member’s activities are weaving, grocery store, pan shop, etc.

loans.use: To buy a 45-watt mini solar home lighting system to use for weaving after sunset.

loans.name: Djekabara Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJEKABARA III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BANANZOLE, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le riz et le mil avec   BINTA, 1ère personne  assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau de DIALAKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Djekabara III Group are married women with an average age of 36 and an average of four children each. They all live within polygamous family frameworks in Bananzole, one of the villages found in Ouélessébougou in Koulikoro Region, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can see through their agricultural activities during the winter period. This is their fourth farming loan with Soro Yiriwaso, with whom their previous loans were paid back in full.

Binta, the woman squatting at the end of the front row to the left-hand side of the photo, grows peanuts, rice and millet. With this loan, she is planning on purchasing farming inputs and seeds, as well as paying for the labour costs to maintain one-and-a-half hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in Dialakoroba to a customer base made up of resellers and consumers. She is planning on making a profit of 195,000 FCFA with each harvest, which will allow her to pay off the loan and help her husband with their family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, seeds and farming inputs

loans.name: Khaem's Group

texts.en: Khaem is residing in Thmor Kor district of Battambang province. She is a 58-year-old and the single mother of 7 children. She survives her big family through cassava and corn farming. She also earns extra money by working for others for a fee. This current business earns her about 32,200 KHR per day. Neither in her first nor second loan cycle, Khaem requests her new loan as a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is the leader of a group of two members. Her group requests for a loan of 2,800,000 KHR which contributes to an equal share of 1,400,000 KHR each. She will use the loan to renovate her home in the hope of having a decent shelter like the other villagers.

loans.use: to renovate her home in the hope of having a decent shelter.

loans.name: Kantiguiya Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  KANTIGUIYA III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DIALAKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et le mil avec   WESSE, 1ère personne  debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de DIALAKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group KANTIGUIYA III are married women, who average 48 years of age and two children each, all living in polygamous families in DIALAKOROBA, 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their sixth farm loan with the institution. 

The crops grown are rice and millet, as is the case with WESSE, who is the first person standing at the right in the photo. With this loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing to maintain 2 hectares.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of retailers and consumers in DIALAKOROBA. She plans on making an average profit of 195,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan, as well as to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay the cost of plowing and to purchase farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en: Battambang province is the home of Han and her family. She is 50 years old and the married mother of 3 children. The main source of income for her family comes from their rice farm which she has occupied for about 30 years already. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is in her sixth cycle loan whereas her co-borrowers are on their second loan. She has repaid back her past loans completely and they enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now, she is the leader of a group consisting of three borrowers including her. Her entire group has requested for a loan of 3,800,000 KHR of which 1,400,000 KHR of the loan belongs to Han and the other two members own a share of 1,200,000 KHR each. Han plans to use her loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her agribusiness. She hopes that she will be able to improve her farming business and her living conditions through the help of the loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her agribusiness.

loans.name: Sidira

texts.en:
Sidira is a hardworking woman. Sidira is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 2 years, Sidira has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sidira has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Sidira to generate greater profits and provide for the family. Sidira hopes that in the future she will be able to build a commercial house. 

Sidira is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for receiving life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is 40 years old and lives in the town of Masaka in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which sells clothes and garments. 

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy items like suits, children's clothes, and african fabric material and will help Faridah to generate greater profits and expand on the business. Faridah hopes that in the future she will be able to become a well-known trader.

loans.use: to buy items like suits, children's clothes, and african fabric material.

loans.name: Djekabara Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJEKABARA IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BANANZOLE, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le riz avec   NAGNOUMA, 3ème personne  debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau de DIALAKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of Djekabara IV Group are married women who average 36 years of age and four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bananzole, a village in Ouelessebougou, second administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their fourth farming loan from the MFI.

The crops they grow are peanut and rice, just like Nagnouma, third woman standing from the left in the photograph. With this loan, she intends to buy fertilizers and seeds, and cover plowing costs to exploit 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold in Dialakoroba, to a clientele comprising both resellers and consumers. Nagnouma intends to turn an average profit of XOF 95'000 per planting, which will enable her to repay the loan, and also to help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and cover plowing costs to exploit 1 hectare

Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kinono in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Fatuma has been working hard to manage her wholesale retail shop, which sells cooking oil, sugar, salt, and soap. 

To help expand her business, Fatuma has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy posho, salt and other items and will help Fatuma to generate greater profits. Fatuma hopes that in the future she will be able to achieve her targeted goals.

loans.use: to buy posho, salt and other items.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kinono in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her bakery, which sells bread, cakes, and doughnuts. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items like soda and beer and will help Juliet to generate greater profits. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to achieve her targeted goals.

loans.use: to buy more items like soda and beer.
