loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
Matia is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Matia has been working hard to manage his hardware businesss, which sells hardware materials like cement, padlocks, paint, and spanners. 

To help expand his business, Matia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hardware materials like cement, padlocks, paint, and spanners and will help Matia to generate greater profits and earn money for school fees and home maintenance. Matia hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more hardware materials like cement, padlocks, paint, and spanners.

loans.name: Damir

texts.ru:
Дамир молодой жизнерадостный молодой человек. Он любит свою работу. Изделия из дерева пользуются неизменно высоким спросом даже с учетом того, что их стоимость намного выше аналогичных изделий из пластика и других материалов.По словам Дамира высокая цена связана с тем что натуральностью используемого материала, а также сложностью его обработки. Деревянная мебель создает уют в любом помещении, деревянные рамы и двери считаются более экологичными, а некоторые вещи просто невозможно изготовить из другого материала, кроме древесины. Он посчитается, что для его столярного бизнеса требуются относительно небольшие затраты. Правда, прибыль при этом тоже не очень велика .Он понимает что от нескольких факторов, главными из которых являются: ассортимент его предприятия, качество продукции и способы продвижения. Он делает все  своими силами, без рекламы. Изготавливает разную мебель, национальные сундуки. 
Дамир планирует приобрести сырье для изготовления мебели .  Надеется, что его бизнес поддержат и на полученный кредит он  купит древесины, для увеличения своего производства.
texts.en:
Damir is a cheerful young man who loves his work. His woodwork is always in high demand even though his pieces cost more than similar ones made of plastic and other materials. According to Damir, his higher prices are due to the cost of the natural materials he uses and the complexity of the process. Wooden furniture can make any room more inviting and wooden frames and doors are considered to be more environmentally friendly. Some things just cannot be made from a material other than wood. He feels that his carpentry business needs a relatively small investment, though it is true that the profits are also fairly small. He understands that this is due to a few factors, the most important being the range of his business activities, the quality of his products, and his methods of marketing. He does everything on his own without any advertising and makes a variety of furniture, including traditional chests. 

Damir is planning to purchase the materials to make furniture. He hopes that it will help his business to take a loan to buy lumber and increase his production.

loans.use: to purchase lumber

loans.name: Djekabara V Group

texts.fr:
Les  8 membres du groupe  DJEKABARA V  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BANANZOLE, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le riz et le mil avec   AMINATA, 1ère personne  assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de DIALAKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of the group DJEKABARA V are married women, who average 37 years of age and five children each, all living in polygamous families in BANANZOLE, a village in OUELESSEBOUGOU 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth farm loan with the institution. 

The crops grown are peanuts, rice, and millet, as is the case with AMINATA, who is the first person sitting from  the left in the photo. With this loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 2 hectares.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of retailers and consumers in DIALAKOROBA. She plans on making an average profit of 195,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan, as well as to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Benkadi  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  6 membres du groupe  BENKADI IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N’TENA, un des villages de KELEYA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  SITAN, 2ème  personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de KELEYA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the BENKADI IV group are married women and they are, on average, 33 years old with five children each.  They all live in polygamous families in N'Tena, a village located in the commune of Keleya (third administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth farming loan with the institution, and their previous loans have been duly repaid.

Sitan, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is in the standing row, second from the left. She is planning to use her loan to buy some farm inputs, some seeds, and to  cover the cost of plowing on 0.25 hectare of land. After the harvest, she sells her crops in Keleya to both resellers and consumers. She is expecting to make an average profit of 25,000 CFA francs per planting season. Sitan will use her profit to repay her loan and to help her husband with the family's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing, and to buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Mayra Edixia

texts.es: Mayra Edixia, mayor de edad,madre soltera de cuatro hijos de los cuales dos de ellos están aun bajo su responsabilidad estudiantes de secundaria, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora, responsable con sus compromisos, con su trabajo y esfuerzos ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, Mayra es una microempresaria que se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización venta de tortillas y frijoles cocidos, los que elabora desde muy temprano en su casa de habitación, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano empezando por niquezar el maíz, para luego palmearlas y poner los frijoles a coser tanto rojos como blancos, negocio el cual lo tiene ubicado en uno de los mercados de esta localidad, tambien vende en su casa de habitación. tambien entrega a fritangas y comiderias de este municipio sus productos,sus compras son al contado en casa distribuidoras sus ventas son al contado, inicia su negocio como un medio para salir adelante con sus hijos al verse sola, este negocio lo aprende a los 12 años por la necesidad de salir adelante ya que sus padres son muy humildes pero bien luchadores lo que le transmitieron a ella para superarse con sus hijos, hoy en día su negocio tiene ya 20 años de dedicarse a este oficio,por las tardes ella se dirige con su negocio hacia el mercado donde tiene sus clientes , uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su negocio y terminar de construir su casa, también su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y se preparen y sean profesionales, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de insumo y materiales para la elaboración de las tortillas y frijoles cocidos: leña, maíz, frijoles rojo y blanco, sal, ajos entre otros
texts.en:
Mayra Edixia is a single mother to four children, two of whom are high school pupils still under her care. Mayra is originally from the Chinandega municipality in the west of Nicaragua, and is an enterprising and hard-working woman who is responsible with her commitments. Through her work and with effort, Mayra has managed to help her children to move forward. 

Mayra has a small business where she sells tortillas and cooked beans, which she prepares from very early in the morning in her home. Mayra starts her day very early, starting with the first preparations of the beans before patting and cooking both the red and white beans. Mayra runs this business out of one of the local markets. She also sells the goods at her home, as well as offering snacks and fried foods. 

Mayra buys her supplies in cash at local wholesalers; she also sells retail. Mayra started her business as a way to prosper with her children alone. She learned this trade when she was twelve years old because she needed to get ahead. Her parents are poor, but are very plucky, a quality they passed on to their children. Mayra has been doing this work for 20 years. She goes out in the afternoons to look after her business in the market, where she finds her customers.

Mayra's dreams are to improve her business and finish building her home. She also wants her children to study and to have a profession. This loan will be used to invest in working capital - buying supplies for preparing tortillas and beans: firewood, corn, read and white beans, salt, and more.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as corn, firewood, lime, red beans, white beans and more.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BALIMAYA ont en moyenne  27ans, 2  enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO II l’un des quartiers de la ville de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits, des boissons et des produits divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BALIMAYA sont à leur 2 ème  prêt solidaire .ASSA, 1ère femme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 robes, 3 pièces de Wax et 15 mètres de tissus léger. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 16 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group BALIMAYA average 27 years of age and two children, all living in traditional extended families in SANTORO II, a district in SAN/SEGOU City (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they have businesses buying and selling clothing, beverages, and general goods. 

After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group BALIMAYA are on now on their second solidarity loan. ASSA, the first woman standing at the right in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 15 dresses, 3 lengths of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa), and 15 meters of sheer fabric. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers. Her sales are made to men and women customers paying with cash and often credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 16,000 francs CFA that will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products and fresh fish.

loans.name: Borey's Group

texts.en: Borey, 20, is a resident of Battambang province where she grows rice. She is the mother of one little child who is still too young for schooling. Besides working on her one and half hectares of rice crop, she spends her spare time working for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in her current business for two years, earning about 20,000 KHR per day to cover the necessary needs in her household. Having never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, she has teamed up in a group of two to get a new loan of 500,000 KHR per member. As the leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay her land plowing fees. She believes that the loan will help her to get a higher yield than in previous years so that her family will be able to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay her land plowing fees.

loans.name: Reynaldo Antonio

texts.es: Reynaldo Antonio mayor de edad casado con tres hijos todos mayores de edad originario del municipio de chinandega, zona donde predomina el comercio, turismo, es un microempresario que se dedica a prestar el servicio de transporte al pueblo en su triciclo y venta de frutas y verduras en su casa de habitación, tiene cliente fijos y eventuales que son los comerciantes que se trasladan desde muy temprano a sus negocios y personas que se dirigen a realizar sus compras en los mercados y supermercados de esta localidad, con muchos esfuerzos y superación el logra que sus hijos terminen sus carreras algo que lo llena de alegría porque el no logro terminar sus estudios, por falta de recursos económicos en su hogar venia de una familia con muy pocos recursos económicos y una de sus metas era que cuando el tuviera su familia no pasara las necesidades que el paso en su vida, cuando hay temporada de sandia el sale en su triciclo a vender por los barrios y comarcas de esta localidad obteniendo un poco mas de ingresos en su hogar, Reynaldo esta solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de llantas y cambiar unos tubos de su triciclo dice él para mantener en muy buen estado su machete de trabajo el cual es su triciclo el inicio alquilando triciclo ahora ya es dueño de un triciclo, con el financiamiento  le  dará  mantenimiento a su triciclo y así brindara  un mejor servicio a sus clientes,y obtener un poco mas de ingresos en su hogar, Reynaldo agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Reynaldo Antronio, an older married man with three adult children, is a native of the town of Chinandega. This is an area where trade and tourism predominate. He is a small businessman who provides transportation services to people in his bike taxi. He also sells fruits and vegetables from his home. He has both regular and occasional passengers who are merchants traveling to their businesses very early as well as people who shop in the markets and supermarkets of the area.

With a great deal of hard work and effort he successfully helped his children finish their education, something that fills him with happiness because he was not able to finish his studies due to a lack of resources. He came from a family of scarce means and one of his goals was that when he had his own family, it would not experience the same deprivation that he faced in his life.

During the watermelon season he goes on his pedicab to sell them throughout different neighborhoods and regions in the area and is able to earn a little more income for his household.

Reynaldo is requesting funding to purchase tires and to replace some tubes on his pedicab so he can keep his work tool, which is his pedicab, in very good condition. He started out by renting a pedicab and now he owns one. He will use the loan to do maintenance on his pedicab and thus provide better service to his passengers and earn a bit more income for his home. Reynaldo is very grateful for the support the Kiva lenders offer to people of scarce financial resources.

loans.use: to purchase fixed assets: tires and tubes and do maintenance on his pedicab.

loans.name: Aipopo

texts.en: Aipopo is 33 years old and single with no children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Aipopo needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a crowbar, a tiller, a new wheelbarrow, a spade, a machete and crops. She became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2014. Aipopo will use the profit from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a crowbar, a tiller, a new wheelbarrow, a spade, a machete and crops.

loans.name: Shaka Group

texts.fr:
Jean  fait partie du groupe  Shaka  et  habite à Gitega. Il a 52 ans et est marié à Francine, une  commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants âgés de 6 à 17 ans, dont 5 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  planches  depuis 25 ans.  

Il est à son quatrième crédit   à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup  de planches à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Jean is part of the group Shaka and lives in Gitega. He is 52 years old and married to Francine, a merchant. Together they have eight children, from 6 to 17 years old, of whom five are students.

Jean has been doing commerce in lumber for 25 years. 

He is on his fourth Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a large quantity of lumber to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of lumber to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase local beverages and staple foods

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 20-year-old single young man from Jabalia. His family has a grocery store in the city. He works in it to help them. It is a good business and the demand for consumption products is high. Kamal would like to improve his store and expand it in the future. 

Kamal took a loan of 1,000 USD from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products for his store especially for Ramadan. This will improve his store and increase his sales. 

Kamal appears in the photo in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for his store especially for Ramadan.

loans.name: Osmar Vicente

texts.es: Osmar Vicente mayor de edad casado con tres hijos todos independientes originario del municipio de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, turística, es un microempresario el cual se dedica a la comercialización de golosinas, meneitos, galletas, gaseosas, jugos, pan(galletas simples, bolillos, picos tostados, maletas, prisioneros entre otros) y bisutería en general, negocio el cual lo tiene ubicado en uno de los parques de esta localidad y de forma ambulante, sus compras las realiza al contado en distribuidoras y mercados de esta localidad, sus ventas son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales inicia su jornada diarias desde muy temprano para aprovechar la entrada de clases de estudiantes y trabajadores que siempre le compran cuando pasan su negocio, gracias a su espíritu y ganas de salir adelante logra que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y ser todos unos profesionales ya que el no logro terminar sus estudios porque se vio en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad,uno de sus sueños es poder incrementar su capital de trabajo y de mejorar su vivienda,con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logro que su familia dentro de sus posibilidades salieran adelante, por las mañana el sale a vender pan con su carretón es bien conocido y querido por sus clientes,su deseo es tener un vida tranquila y sentirse muy satisfecho de su trabajo el cual realiza con mucho amor y dedicación,  el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo e invertir en la compra de golosinas, bisuterías y todo tipo y estilo de pan para cumplir con varios pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, Osmar agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Osmar Vicente is a married adult who has three children, all independent. He is a native of Chinandega in the west of the country. It is an area of commercial development and tourism. He has a micro business that sells candies, snacks, cookies, soft drinks, juices, assorted pastries (bolillos, picos, tostadas. maletas, etc.) and jewellery. His business is located in front of one of the local parks. His sales are in cash to regular customers and other people going by. He starts his day very early to take advantage of the children going to school and workers who always buy from his business.

Thanks to his spirit and his desire to get ahead he managed to have his children complete their studies and become professionals. He could not complete his studies since he had to work at a young age. One of his dreams is to increase his working capital and improve his house. With a lot of effort and dedication, within the frame of what is possible, he has manged to get his family ahead

He sets out in the morning to sell bread with his cart which is well known and loved by his clients. His wish is to have a quiet life and he feels satisfied with the work he has done with much love and dedication. The object of this new loan is to invest in working capital buying sweets, jewellery and all kinds of pastries to fill the different orders he has from his clients. Osmar is grateful to the lenders at Kiva who offer support to people of low economic resources.

loans.use: to invest in working capital buying sweets. different breads, soft drinks, juices, etc.

loans.name: Twungurane Ubwenge Group

texts.fr:
Josélyne  fait partie du groupe  Twunguranubwenge et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 34 ans et est mariée à Jean une chauffer. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  âgés de  9 mois à 10 ans dont 3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce des habits   depuis  7 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit   à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup d' habits  à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, elle voudrait construire une maison et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Josélyne is a member of the Twungurane Ubwenge group and she lives in Bujumbura.  She is 34 years old and married to Jean, who works as a driver.   Josélyne and her husband have four children whose ages range between 10 years and 9 months.  Three of them are in school. 

Josélyne has been selling clothes for the past seven years.  This is her first loan with Kiva's partner, Turame Community Finance.  With this Kiva-financed loan, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of clothes for resale, which will allow her to increase her income.  In the coming years, she would like to build a house and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lamrana

texts.en: This is 31 year-old Lamrana.  She is widowed, and has one child aged 11 years. Lamrana owns a provision business. She earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Lamrana has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy mayonnaise, milk, ovaltine, juice and crates of soft drinks. With Lamrana's previous loan, she was able to buy some building materials and due to that there is greater improvement in her business. This current loan will help her generate income. Frequent changes in prices are her major challenge. She is very responsible and hard working. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mayonnaise, milk, ovaltine, juice and crates of soft drinks.

loans.name: Sreav's Group

texts.en: Sreav lives in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She is 39 years old and is a married woman with four children - two of whom are in school. She has been making a living by farming rice for about 20 years now. She also earns extra money by working for local residents for a fee. Sreav leads this first time borrower group of two members in requesting for a loan of 600,000 KHR each from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Sreav plans to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees in the hope of getting a higher yield than last year. She believes that the loan will unlock a way for her family to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Tania Cecilia

texts.es:
Tania Cecilia tiene 35 años de edad, con una hija quien estudia en colegio de Zaña, una comunidad de clima caluroso cercana al valle del río Jequetepeque, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia e Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos y gallos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y ofrecerlos a sus clientes a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Tania Cecilia is 35 years old, and she has a daughter who goes to school in Zaña.  She lives in a community with a warm climate that is close the Jequetepeque river valley.  Its population works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northen coast of Peru.

She raises and sells small animals like ducks and roosters.  Her business is located in the area behind her house.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 3,000 soles to buy balanced feed to fatten the animals and to offer them to her customers at a better price.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten the animals.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Buscando El Triunfo Group

texts.es: Doña Xinia es una mujer con  tiene 30 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos, todos menores de edad,3 de ellos cursan la primaria, vive en unión libre con el padre de sus hijos, quien trabaja como ayudante de construcción devengando un salario mínimo. Viven en una comunidad rural Talamanca. Doña Xinia cuenta con un pequeño terreno donde desarrolla diferentes actividades productivas como lo es la cria de pollos y la siembra de plátano. Ella misma es quien prepara la tierra, cultiva y cuida de su cosecha y sus animales, en ocasiones cuenta con el apoyo de su companero en su negocio cuando éste tiene tiempo libre. Este es el segundo préstamo que solicita y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento.  Ella tiene muchos deseos de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y aumentar su patrimonio, mejorando la producción de sus cultivos, debido a ésta situación ella cria animales para poder hacer frente a sus pagos del préstamo, ya que el ciclo productivo del plátano no es mensual y asi genera más ingresos y ayuda a su hogar. Junto a Doña Xinia integran el grupo seis socias más que van a invertir en actividades comerciales y agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Xinia is a 30 year old woman who is mother to four children, all minors. Three of them attend primary school. She lives in a common-law relationship with the father of her children who works as a construction assistant earning a minimum salary. They live in a rural community in Talalmanca. Xinia has a small plot of land where she undertakes different commercial activities like raising chickens and growing plantains. She prepares the land herself grows and cares for her crops. Occasionally she has the help of her partner when he has free time.

This is the second loan she has requested and she will invest it in buying chickens and feed. She has much desire to improve her living conditions and increase her inheritance and improving the productivity of her crops. Given this situation she is raising animals to be able to pay the installments of her loan as banana production does not follow a monthly schedule. Doing this she will generate more income and help her household. Together with Xinia is her group of six other members who will invest in their business and farming activities.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad tranquila, su población es alegre y trabajadora se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales menores como patos, gallinas y pavos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, adicionalmente tiene sembrado caña de azúcar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores para engorde y posteriormente ofrecerlo a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Magdalena is 51 years old. She lives with her children in the Cayaltí district, a quiet community with a happy, hard working population that sustains itself through farming, commerce and raising livestock. It is located in the Chiclayo province belonging to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. 
She makes a living by raising and selling small animals like ducks, hens and turkeys. Her business is located behind her house, additionally she also has a plot of sugar cane.
She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,500 Nuevos Soles to purchase small animals to fatten and eventually offer them to her clients, generating increased incomes for her family.

loans.use: purchase small animals to fatten and offer to her clients.

loans.name: Zenhang Group

texts.en:
Lawmching (pictured with a raised hand) leads a group of 12 women from a locality in Hill town, Manipur. She is married and blessed with three children. 

Lawmching is a weaver by profession. She usually weaves 3 to 4 traditional shawls and wrap-around skirts in a month. She takes the finished products twice a week to the town market. She transports them by auto, or sometimes she has to carry them all by herself to sell them for more profits. She works hard to support her family and to generate more income. She wants to continue weaving even after sunset to increase her productivity, but most of the time, the poor power supply in the area hampers her work. 

The other 12 members of her group experience the same difficulty in working past sunset due to the poor power supply. They take care of their families and chores all day, so most of their spare time that could be used to weave or work extra hours is past sunset.

Since they do not have any alternate source of power supply to rely on, they have decided to help themselves, and seek a solar loan of 45-watt solar lighting systems, each having four bulbs. Once the system is installed in their homes, they will be able to work even at night hassle-free and this will bring their families more income and the ability to afford better living standards. Also, some of the group members have children, and they will be able to study in the evenings by the light of these solar systems.

loans.use: To buy a 45-watt mini solar home lighting system to allow her to weave past sunset.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: María tiene 57 años de edad y habita junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia. Desde hace 10 años María se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos. Ella lava y plancha ajeno y es así como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. María desea construir un pequeño cuarto para proteger el área de pila para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, pines para lámina, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así proceder a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Maria is 57 year old and lives with her husband and two children in their own home. She has been doing housework for the past 10 years. She washes and irons others' clothes and in this way sustains the home. 
Maria hopes to build a small room to protect the sink area for which she requested this credit from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheet, wood, sheet pins, etc. She hopes to be able to have this financing and proceed to start construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: purchase galvanized sheet, wood, sheet pins, etc. for the construction of a room for the laundry area

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new items to sell in his shoe store.

loans.name: Alimamy

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Alimamy. He is married, and has 2 children aged six and two years. One of them is a school-going child. Alimamy owns a business. He earns about 2,000,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Alimamy has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy mobile phone accessories. Alimamy was unable to open a shop or build a house because of financial constraints and domestic problems. He is a family person and also hardworking. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Lamin

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Lamin. He is married and has three children, aged 10, 8 and 4 years. Two of them are school-going children.  

Lamin owns a business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,750,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Lamin has already received and successfully repaid six loans and now requires a new loan in order to purchase bales of used clothing.  

Lamin's previous plan was partly successful by acquiring a piece of land and he opened another outlet, but was unable to open a shop. This loan will help to generate more income.  

His main challenge is that, sometimes, some bales will not be of good quality.  He is a committed and ambitious businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for bales of assorted used clothing.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón 50 años de edad, cliente vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su conyugue y sus 2 menores hijos de17 y 7 años de edad en el Caserío de Lishinas, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso que se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en una bodeguita ubicada en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo A Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ramón is 50 years old and lives in his own house constructed of rustic materials with his wife and two children, aged 7 and 17 years old. They live in the village of Lishinas in a rural area of Pucará District, located in Jaén Province which belongs to Cajamarca Region in the North Andes of Peru. The people in this community with a hot climate work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

Ramón works selling groceries in a store located in his house. He has requested a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a greater quantity of groceries to stock his business and in this way generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock his business.

loans.name: Gabriel De Jesus

texts.es:
Gabriel inicio un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas y licores hace aproximadamente 6 meses en el municipio de La Ceja, Antioquia; aunque es un negocio muy nuevo en el municipio, ha podido tener un buen nivel de ventas.
El señor desea ofrecer un mejor servicio en su local y atender a sus clientes de una mejor manera buscando su fidelizacion y reconocimiento, por esos requiere de un préstamo para la compra de un televisor que instalara en su local, adicionalmente comprara insumos de trabajo e ingredientes para sus comidas.
Todos estos elementos le permitirán seguir evolucionando como empresario y crecerá de una manera efectiva.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener una mejor calidad de vida sin su esposa y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gabriel started a business selling fast food and liquors approximately 6 months ago in the La Ceja municipality of Antioquia. Although it is a very new business in the municipality he has been able to maintain a good level of sales. He wishes to offer better service in his locale and better attend to his clients seeking their loyalty and recognition. These goals are the reason he requires a loan for the purchase of a television which he will install in his locale while additionally purchasing work supplies and ingredients for his food. 
All these elements will allow him to continue evolving as a businessman and growing in an effective manner. His biggest dream is to enjoy a better quality of life in the absence of his wife and his kids.

loans.use: purchase a television to install in his business and purchase supplies for work.

loans.name: Limhi Franco

texts.es: Limhi es un joven muy competitivo de 20 años de edad estudia la carrera de Técnico Administrativo. el se siente muy contento por encontrarse  desempeñando su profesión. El crédito lo invertirá en los trámites para su titulación. Su mayor deseo es estudiar una carrera universitaria y tener un buen empleo para el bienestar de sus seres queridos. Limhi agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Limhi,who is 20 years old, is a competitive young man. He is studying a course in technical management and is very happy to be working in his profession.

He will use the loan to pay administration costs for his qualification.

His main dream is to do a university degree and have a good job in order to ensure the wellbeing of his loved ones. Limhi thanks the Kiva lenders for providing the loan.

loans.use: to pay administration costs for his qualification.

loans.name: Albeiro De Jesus

texts.es:
Albeiro trabajaba en la venta de mangos de manera ambulante en un pequeña carretilla diseñada para este fin, a raíz de sus pocas ventas y lo agotador de trabajar ambulantemente decidió cambiar su método de trabajo y se estableció en un lugar fijo en el municipio de Medellín; desde allí realiza la venta no solo de mangos sino también de otra variedad de frutas. Fue tal el éxito de su negocio, que se vio obligado a cambiar su carretilla por una más grande y de mejor calidad, hoy en día es un feliz vendedor de frutas que trabaja tranquilo y no rinde cuentas a nadie.
El desea aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su surtido, por esta razón solicita dinero para la compra de frutas que le permitan mejorar su oferta y aumentar su inventario, además de poder aumentar su capital de trabajo.
El es un hombre luchador y muy constante, siempre dispuesto a atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera posible ofreciendo productos de calidad.
texts.en:
Albeiro was working selling mangoes as a street vendor from a small cart designed for this purpose. Because of lack of sales and how tiring it was to work as a street vendor, he decided to change his way of working and set up a fixed location in Medellín municipality. From there he sells not just mangoes, but also other varieties of fruit. 

His success in this business was such that he felt obliged to exchange his cart for a larger, better quality one. Now he is a happy fruit seller who works with no worries and is beholden to no one.

He wishes to increases sales and improve his selection. For this reason, he is requesting money to buy fruit, which will allow him to increase his working capital. He is a determined and very persevering man, who is always ready to serve clients in the best way possible, offering quality products.

loans.use: To buy a supply of fruit for his business.

loans.name: Tarry

texts.en:
Tarry is 26 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Tarry has been working hard to manage her accommodation business, which operates rental units. 

To help expand her business, Tarry has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to furnish her rentals and add stock to her shop, and will help Tarry to generate greater profits, earn income and cater for all basic needs. Tarry hopes that in the future she will be able to construct more rentals.

loans.use: furnish her rentals and add stock to her shop

loans.name: Momagul

texts.ru:
Момагул 42-летняя женщина проживающая в районе Восеъ вместе со свекровью, мужем, сыном и двумя дочерьми. Момагул хороший в общении человек, еще она хорошая домохозяйка. Момагул более девяти лет занимается разведением крупнорогатого и мелко-рогатого скота. Ее муж работает в городе Душанбе в качестве электрика. 
Момагул хочет увеличить количество скота, развести и продать осенью. Для этого ей необходимо сейчас купить крупнорогатый скот.
texts.en: Momagul is a 42-year-old woman, living in the Vose district together with her mother-in-law, husband, son and two daughters. Momagul is a good communicator and a good homemaker. Momagul has been involved in raising cattle and small livestock for over nine years. Her husband works in the city of Dishanbe as an electrician. Momagul wants to increase the quantity of livestock, fatten it up and sell in the autumn. She needs to buy cattle now to achieve this goal.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Olga Zuleyma

texts.es:
Olga es una joven trabajadora, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en San Vicente junto a su familia.
Tiene una pequeña hija, es madre soltera pero eso no es un impedimento para ella. Siempre ha luchado y trabajado arduamente para poder sacar adelante a su hija porque quiere darle un futuro mejor.
Actualmente trabaja en los campos agrícolas como obrera y le va muy bien, porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta y siempre da lo mejor se sí misma para obtener resultados favorables.
Olga está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una cama para amoblar la habitación de hija y de esta manera ella pueda vivir de manera más cómoda, con la tranquilidad de saber que su hija está bien. Así seguirá esforzándose para más adelante: "Estudiar una carrera profesional".
texts.en:
Olga is a young worker, 21 years of age, unmarried, and lives with her family. She has a small daughter. Olga is a single mother but this isn't an impediment for her. She has always strived and worked very hard to be able to bring up her child well because she wants to give her a better future.

At this time, Olga is working in agricultural fields as a laborer and it is going well for her, because she is a very responsible, hardworking and honest person and she always give the best of herself to obtain favorable results.

Olga is grateful for Kiva loans because with the help they have provided her, she will be able to buy a bed to furnish the bedroom of her little girl and she will be able to live more comfortably, with the peace of mind of knowing that her daughter is all right. She will continue pushing herself to make progress, [eventually] to study in a professional field.

loans.use: to buy a bed to furnish her dwelling

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad tranquila que se dedican a la labor de crianza de animales menores, agricultura y comercio, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero, su esposa le apoya en el ordeño para posteriormente ofrecer la leche fresca y la elaboración de quesos frescos a sus vecinos y moradores de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de 01 vaca lechera, la cual le generara mayor ingreso a su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Wilder is 31 years old and lives with his wife and children in Lagunas district, located in Chiclayo province, which is part of the Lambayeque region on Peru's north coast. It is a peaceful community where people raise small animals, engage in agriculture and run businesses.

He raises dairy cattle. His wife helps him with the milking so that he can later sell fresh milk and make fresh cheeses for his neighbors and people who live in his district. 

He has requested a loan of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, in order to purchase a dairy cow, which will generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase quintals of corn.

loans.name: Nafisatu

texts.en:
This is 53-year-old Nafisatu. She is widowed, and has four children aged 13, 15, 17 and 18, who all are school-going children. She has two additional dependents who live with her to attend school and assist with the business and at home.  

In 1972, Nafisatu established Raw Fish business. She began her business because she did not attain any formal education because traditions did not allow a girl child to go to school in those days. She started assisting her mother in her business as a teenager. The commissions she gathered were used to start her own business. She later got married and still continued her fish business.  

Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about 2,320,000 SLL every month from this business. Her major challenges are increases in fish prices, delays in payment from creditors and that sometimes fish bought from the cold room are not in good order.

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Nafisatu requires a loan in order to purchase cartons of crocros fish, kunnie fish, snapper fish, shine-nose fish and kutah fish. 

 In the future, Nafisatu plans to open a fishing business or cold room for her children, build another house on her remaining land and provide quality education for her children. She is hardworking, devoted, peaceful and a reliable business woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of crocros fish, kunnie fish, snapper fish, shine-nose fish and kutah fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an air-conditioner, a sewing machine, and an iron

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en:
Waleed is a 20 year old single man from Jabalia. He lives with his family in a small simple house. He is a university student in his third year. Waleed works giving private lessons to school students. He helps them to understand their lessons and writing their home works.

Waleed took a USD loan form FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a laptop for his work. By taking this loan, Waleed will be able to organize his learning material and present it to his students in an easy way. 

Waleed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his work

loans.name: Maria Xenia

texts.es: María  de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar integrado por  su esposo y sus nietos,  ella se dedica al cultivo del maíz desde hace varios años y adicional a eso también posee una tienda en su casa, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, con lo que gana de sus ventas ayuda  solventar  algunas necesidades de sus hogar, Maria solicita un crédito para la compra semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para seguir con el cultivo de maíz, y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 58 years old and lives in her own home with her family, which is made up of her husband and their grandchildren. She has been growing corn for several years and in addition to that also has a store in her home.  

When the harvest is ready, she stores it in the bins shown in the photo.  What she earns from her sales helps her to pay for some of her household's needs. 

Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest-control agents, herbicides etc. This is so that she can continue growing corn and be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest-control agents, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 58 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada de material rústico, en el distrito de Pucará, que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la compra de abarrotes al por mayor para luego distribuirlo en las bodeguitas de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 58 years old and lives in a rented house built with rustic materials in the Pucará district. Pedro has water and electricity in his home. Pucará is in the Jaén province of the Cajarmarca region of Peru's northern coast. Here the climate is warm and the people make a living in farming, trade and cattle-raising.

Pedro himself makes a living buying groceries in bulk to later sell in his shops in Pucara. Pedro has applied for a loan of 500 Nuevo Soles from "Edpyme Alternativa" in order to buy a larger quantity of groceries to stock up his business. With these items, Pedro can earn a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock up his business.

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en:
Sopheak is living in Sangke district of Battambang province. She is a married woman who has 4 children living dependent on her. In order to earn a living for the family, Sopheak does rice farming and raise chickens for sale. She is able to earn only 32,500 KHR per day to cover expenses for the whole family. Now, she is in sixth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

The positive impact of her past loan allowed her to improve her living conditions at a gradual pace. Now, Sopheak leads a group of three members to apply for a loan of 4,500,000 KHR. Each member will use a portion of 1,500,000 KHR . As the group leader, she plans to use the loan to expand her chicken raising business. She will use the loan to buy more chickens and chicken feed. She hopes that the loan will allow her to expand her business successfully.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Choem's Group

texts.en: Choem is a villager from Battambang province. She is 46 years old and a married mother blessed with seven children, one of whom is in school. She struggles to raise her big family via vegetable selling as a single source of income.  She has been involved in the current business for 24 years. This is the first loan for Choem with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy more vegetables for resale. She highly hopes that she can make more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Theara

texts.en:
Living in the Kampong Cham province’s Kampong Siem district, Theara is 43 years old and is married with three children. For the last four years, her husband has been farming rice to support the family. To supplement the income, Theara has been selling rice. With the current business, she can earn about $25 US per day. 

Theara is with VisionFund and is applying for a loan to buy more rice to sell. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobile phones for himself and his workers so they can communicate easily when they are working outside

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural que la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, cerdos, desde hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is 58 years old, married, and lives Oyotún district, located in Chiclayo province, which is part of the Lambayeque region on Peru's north coast. It is a rural area where people farm, run businesses, and raise livestock.

For several years he has been raising and selling animals such as ducks, chickens and pigs. His business is located in the area behind his home. 

He has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, in order to purchase balanced feed for fattening his animals and this way generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for fattening his animals.

loans.name: Phanna

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Kampong Siem district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Phanna is 20 years old and married. As a mother, she has struggled to feed her two baby children by farming rice and growing bananas for two years. Her current business earns her about 38,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Phanna is with VisionFund and is applying for a loan. She wants to use this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Chho's Group

texts.en: A resident from Battambang province, Chho is a 45-year-old farmer and a single mother of three dependent children. The main source of income for her family comes from a vegetable farm. As a single mother struggling to make a future for her children, Chho earns extra income as a butcher. Chho has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past four cycles with successful repayment history. Now, she is the leader of a group of five members. The group requests a loan of 7,500,000 KHR of which Chho will use the amount of 500,000 KHR. She plans to use her loan portion for her vegetable farm as she needs to buy fertilizer and seeds for the farm. She hopes that she will be able to earn a higher income through the yield of the farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for the farm

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 64-year-old married man from Ibb, Yemen and the father of 13 children. The eldest child is 27 years old.  Though he is uneducated, he was aware of the importance of education and enrolled all the members of his family in schools and universities.

Mohammed is a symbol of industry and hardwork. Since he was young, he was responsible for himself. His story started when he immigrated to Saudi Arabia to work, but his journey ended after some years when he was forced to come back to Yemen during the Gulf War in 1990. This was a critical point in his life. Mohammed didn’t surrender and decided to cultivate his own piece of land in the village and secure a decent life for himself and his big family. Year after year, he was able to accumulate a good amount of money to purchase his own house and dump truck to diversify his income sources. He uses this truck to transport loose materials such as sand and gravel to construction sites. This business is profitable, especially because there are not many dump trucks in the city to cover the increasing demand; Therefore Mohammed decided to buy another dump truck. The problem is that he doesn’t have enough money, so he applied for a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. Mohammed is sure that purchasing another truck will increase his income and he will be able to successfully repay the loan and pay for his children's marriages in the near future.

Mohammed looks forwards to purchasing another bigger and better dump truck and will encourage his children to work on the other two trucks to cover their expenses and become independent.

loans.use: to purchase a dump truck to transport sand and gravel to construction sites

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la venta de sandalias, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado en un lugar muy céntrico, por esa razón posee mucha clientela,  con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar algunas de las necesidad que se le presentan en su hogar, Oscar solicita un crédito para la compra de mas sandalias por mayor y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar is 33 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and their daughter. He makes a living by selling sandals. His business is located in a market in a very well-trafficked location, so he has many customers.

With the money that he earns, he is able to pay for some of the household necessities. Oscar requests a loan to purchase more sandals in bulk so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more sandals in bulk.

loans.name: Ana Alicia

texts.es: Ana de 44 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, ella se dedica a trabajar en su propio molino, procesando todo tipo de alimentos, como maiz, frijoles, hárinas, salsas, entre otros. Tiene ya algún tiempo con el negocio y posee amplia experiencia que le ayuda a generar muy buenas ganancias, se ha hecho de mucha clientela ya que el servicio es inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, se siente satisfecha y muy cómoda con su negocio, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda por el servicio y sus dos molinos ya no le dan abasto por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar un molino nuevo de trabajo. Tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, se compromete a cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevará seguridad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old and lives with her family in her own home. She has her own milling business, processing all types of foods such as corn, beans, flours, sauces and other products. 

She has been in this business for some time already and has broad experience, which helps her to generate very good earnings. She has acquired a large clientele, as the service is unequaled and she is always there for her customers. She feels satisfied and very comfortable with her business. 

In recent weeks demand for the service has increased and her two mills can no longer handle the work. That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow her to buy a new mill for her business. 

She has good payment references and is responsible. She promises to pay off her debt, and at the same time has faith that she will bring financial security to her family.

loans.use: To buy a new mill for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 25 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida en casa de un  familiar, ella se dedica al cultivo del maíz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que gana de sus ventas ayuda a solventar algunas de las necesidades de su hogar,  La clienta solicita un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para seguir con el cultivo de maíz, y poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This borrower is 25 years old and lives with her partner at a relative's house. The borrower makes a living growing corn. Once the harvest is ready she stores it in a granary - as shown in the photograph - before later going out to sell it in the surrounding area. The income from sales helps the borrower to cover some household costs. The borrower is applying for this loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments and more. With these items she can continue growing corn and will be able to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments and more.

loans.name: Jeanneth Esmeralda

texts.es: Jeanneth de 33 años de edad tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas ayuda a solventar algunas de las necesidades de su hogar, vive en casa de un familiar con su madre y sus dos hijos, Jeanneth solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor para seguir con la elaboración de tortillas  y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jeanneth is 33 years old and has a business selling tortillas at her home. Money from sales helps Jeanneth to cover some household costs. Jeanneth lives in a relative's house with her mother and two children. Jeanneth is applying for a loan in order to buy corn in bulk to continue making tortillas. This work will allow Jeanneth to give her family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela tiene 31 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad tranquila que se dedican a la agricultura especialmente de los cultivos de banano, maíz y frejol, comercio y ganadería como sustento principal, ubicado en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y pollo en su bodega, cuenta con clientes que son sus vecinos y moradores del distrito, es conocida por el buen servicio que brinda, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Marcela is 31 years old. She lives in her parents' home in the district of La Matanza, a tranquil community whose residents grow banana, corn, and beans, and also work in commerce and ranching. It is located in the Morropon province in the Piura region on Perú's northern coast.

She makes a living by selling groceries and chicken in her bodega. Her customers are her neighbors and residents of the district. She is known for the good service that she provides.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 4,000 nuevos soles to purchase a greater quantity of groceries to stock her business so that she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to stock her business.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.es:
Arnulfo tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el Caserío de Chorrillos, una zona rural del Distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad de clima frio que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, adicionalmente brinda servicios como jornalero agrícola, Arnulfo se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Arnulfo is 29 years old and lives in Chorrillos village, a rural area in the Callayuc district of the Cutervo province. Cutervo is part of the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern highlands. Here in Chorrillos the climate is cold and the people make a living in farming, trade and cattle raising.

Arnulfo himself makes a living growing coffee and also works as a farming labourer. Arnulfo puts in a lot of effort at his work. He has applied for a loan of 3000 Nuevo Soles from "Edpyme Alternativa" in order to buy manure to look after his coffee crops. With this loan, Arnulfo can earn a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure to look after his coffee crops.

loans.name: Equiteria

texts.es:
Equiteria tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en el Distrito Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos, cuyes, patos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales como alambre, malla entre otros para el corral de sus animales y de esta manera tener un mejor distribución de los mismos.
texts.en:
Equiteria is 26 years old and lives with her daughter in the Zaña district of the Chiclayo province. Chiclayo is part of the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast. Here the people make a living in farming, trade and cattle raising.

Equiteria herself makes a living raising and selling young animals, such as pigs, guinea pigs and ducks. She runs the business at the back of her house. Equiteria has applied for a loan of 2000 Nuevo Soles from "Edpyme Alternativa" in order to buy materials, such as wire and mesh, in order to fix the animals' pen. With this work done, Equiteria can sell the animals more easily.

loans.use: to buy materials to fix pens for young animals.

loans.name: Lot's Group

texts.en:
Kampong Cham province is a home to Lot and where her rice farm is located. She is 52 years old and a farmer who is blessed with 7 children, three of whom are living dependent on her as two are too young for schooling and one is in school. The primary source of income comes from a rice farm, and her supplemental income is generated through cassava farming and pig raising. She has been engaged in these businesses for about 27 years.  

Lot is the leader of a group of four members. This is the second cycle for Lot and another member, and the first cycle for the other two members. They are requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Visionfund of 4,700,000 KHR of which 1,500,000 KHR is her loan portion. As a leader, Lot will use her share of the loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her rice farm. She believes that she will be able to get a higher yield out of the farm and hopes to buy a cow to use on her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en:
Bayan is a 19-year-old single lady from Jericho. She lives with her family in a small house. Bayan works in a studio as a photographer. She has good experience in this field. Bayan would like to start her own business, which is a store for selling cosmetics and gifts.

Bayan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy cosmetics and gifts to start her new business. By taking this loan, Bayan will be able to start her own business and improve her income and the family's living conditions.

Bayan appears in the photo in her store

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and gifts to start her new business

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Juan es hombre emprendedor y visionario, casado con una hija a su cargo. Este señor labora como guarda de seguridad en el centro de salud en la comunidad donde vive con 22  años de prestar dicho servicio en este centro.
Juan hoy en día está presentando una de sus dificultades es que el techo  de su vivienda se encuentra en mal estado ya que estamos en el periodo lluvioso por tal motivo se acerco a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar el financiamiento nº 6  de los cuales ha ido mejorando  sus condiciones de vida.
Dicho financiamiento lo utilizara para el cambio de techo de su  vivienda comprando  materiales de construcción tales como zinc , perlines, cemento y pago de mano de obra
texts.en:
Juan is someone who is enterprising and visionary and he is married with one daughter under his responsibility. He works as a security guard in the community health centre where he lives and has been providing this service in the health centre for 22 years. 

Today Juan has presented one of his difficulties, which is that the roof of his home is in a poor condition. Since it is the rainy season he approached the Ceprodel office to ask for his 6th loan. He has been using the loans to improve his quality of life.

He will use the loan to replace the roof of his home, buying construction materials such as zinc, beams and cement and paying for labour.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as zinc, beams and cement and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, compost, pest controls, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Kimsrey

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Prey Chor district where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Kimsrey is a 37-year-old mother of three. Rice farming and mango planting is the main source of the family’s income, which she and her husband have been doing for ten years. The current business earns her about 9 USD per day.

This is the third microloan for Kimsrey with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy pesticides for her mango growing. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her mango growing

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Adama. She is married and has two children aged 8 and 4 years, both of whom go to school. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she lost her mother. 

In 2012, Adama established her store where she sells Ovaltine, baby food, milk, batteries, Nescafe, etc. She began her business because she dropped out of school at form two due to rebel war intervention. She travelled to the city as a displaced person and assisted her mother in her business. Her elder sister gave her some money to start her own business after she had gained some experience working with their mother.  Working seven days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about 3,644,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Adama requires this loan in order to buy assorted crates of drinks, cartons of baby food, Ovaltine, mayonnaise, luncheon meat and batteries. In the future, Adama plans to educate her children to a higher level and reinvest in the business. The loan will help her increase the profits of her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy crates of drinks, cartons of baby food, Ovaltine, mayonnaise, luncheon meat and batteries.

loans.name: Det's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Moung Russey district, Det is 37 years old and married. He has two children. He is a rice farmer of one hectare of farmland. Having been in this business for almost 14 years, he currently can earn about 28,000 KHR per day. 

This is the microloan for Det’s group of two and he is a fourth cycle client. The past loans have helped him better support his family. Now he is leading his group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his family’s income to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Kamary's Group

texts.en:
53 years old Kamary is a married mother of two children living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Rice and pineapple farming are the main sources of the family’s income. She can earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Kamary's group consists of three members who are all female living in the same village. She is a fifth cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she completely repaid the past loans, which have enabled her to better support her family and have some money. Now leading her group of three to apply for a loan, Kamary, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice healthfully and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Sorn is aged 54 years and widowed with five children. The main source of her family’s income is from pineapples. She has been in this business for 11 years. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day.

Sorn is a first cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy engineering tools for his work.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David es un hombre de 38 años de edad soltero y padre de tres hijos.
Desde muy joven la vida le enseñó a trabajar para ayudar a su familia y aprendió el oficio de chapa y pintura para vehículos, trabajo que viene realizando desde hace más de 20 años.
David se encarga de su hijos y los tres estudian en la escuela primaria, ellos son muy felices al lado de su padre porque él se esfuerza mucho por su bienestar y sus estudios.
En el trabajo algunos materiales como la pintura son imprescindibles y muchas veces la falta de material es un problema constante que le hace perder clientela, tiempo y dinero.
El sueño de David es mejorar la situación de sus hijos, lograr la finalización de sus estudios y volverlos profesionales. También desea un negocio próspero y algún día contar con un taller propio.
Es por esos motivos que David solicita un préstamo para comprar pintura y con los beneficios pagar el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
David is a 36 year old unmarried man, the father of three children. From an early age, life has taught him to work to help his family and he learned the trade of body work and painting for vehicles, a field of work that he has carried out for more than 20 years. David takes care of his children and the three of them are studying in primary school. They are very happy living with their father because he works hard for their welfare and their studies. 

Certain materials, such as paint, are essential in his work, and many times, the lack of material is a constant problem that causes him to lose clientele, time and money. David's dream is to better the situation of his children, achieve the culmination of their schooling and see them become professionals. He also wants a prosperous business and some day to have his own repair shop. It is for these reasons that David is asking for a loan to buy paint and, with his earnings, pay for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy paint and with his earnings pay for his children's schooling

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Foday.  He is married and has two children, aged 6 years and 3 months old. One child goes to school. In 2006, Foday established his business selling provisions and drinks, including sugar, milk, and pure water.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Foday has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase cartons of Ovaltine, mayonnaise, milk, bags of sugar and crates of soft drinks. Foday did not encounter major problems in repaying his first loan. Sales were slow but he was able to recover through his additional income. His wife contributes greatly in the running of the business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase Ovaltine, mayonnaise, milk, bags of sugar, and crates of soft drinks.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María de 37 años de edad se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, perfumes, cremas, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar más productos por mayor ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles, con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna
texts.en:
María is 37 years old and makes a living selling all kinds of personal products such as lotions, deodorants, perfumes, creams etc. She runs her business in her home and with the profits she makes from her sales and the help of her husband she manages to cover the household expenses. She lives in her own house with her husband and their four children.

María wants to expand her business and so she is asking for a loan which will enable her to buy more products wholesale. She already has lots of customers because she offers her products at affordable prices. With the help of the loan she will be able to make better profits and so continue to give her family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy lotions, deodorants, perfumes, creams etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Al-Yas Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Yas. It consists of six women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.

Fatima is the leader of the group. She is a 33-year-old married woman and mother of two children. Her oldest child is five years old and the youngest one is two years old. Fatima decided to help her husband with the family's expenses, and for this reason, she decided to work as a beautician. She started this business seven years ago in her house. In order to increase her business, Fatima applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more cosmetics, make-up, and accessories.

In the future, Fatima looks forward to opening a beauty parlor to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, make up, and accessories in order to improve her business

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
