Mohammed is 42 years old and a married man with three children. His oldest child is 19 years old and the youngest one is only one year old. He lives with his family in his own house in Dhamar, Yemen. 

Mohammed works as a beekeeper, raising beehives in his village. He is a very hardworking and dynamic man. His honey is very delicious and excellent. Due to that, Mohammed has a large amount of customers. He earns good profits from this business. 

For further expansion in his business, Mohammed applied for a loan of 335,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more beehives to raise bees and sell their honey. Mohammed looks forward to having a large amount of beehives.

loans.use: to purchase more beehives to raise bees and sell their honey.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dresses, robes, fabric, and raw materials to provide her customers with a wider selection and better quality product.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and an embroidery machine

loans.name: Ahmmed

texts.en:
Ahmmed is a 46-year-old married man with three children. His oldest child is 16 years old and the youngest one is two years old. He has a university certificate. Ahmmed lives with his family in his own house in Dhamar, Yemen. His house lacks many home appliances and furniture. 

He is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to cover all the family's expenses. Ahmmed works hard to improve the living conditions of his family. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, Ahmmed applied for a loan of 400,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase furniture for his house.

Ahmmed looks forward to improving the living condition of his family. He hopes to have a large and comfortable house.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house.

loans.name: Mahbob

texts.en:
Mahbob is a 33-year-old married man with six children. His oldest child is 12 years old and the youngest one is 4 years old. He has a university education and is an employee in a public sector. 

Mahbob lives with his family in his own house in Dhamar, Yemen. His house lacks many home appliances and furniture. He is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Mahbob wants to furnish his house; unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, Mahbob applied for a loan of 395,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase furniture for the house.

Mahbob looks forward to improving conditions for his family. He hopes to furnish his house with all home appliances.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for the house.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Kish Alaglöwa Group

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer con 28 años de edad, soltera y madre de tres hijos menores de edad. Vive en unión libre con su compañero, dos de sus hijos estan cursando la primaria. La comunidad en la que viven es rural y para llegar a ella hay que cruzar un río grande. Ella es trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación. Su esposo es agricultor por lo que no tiene un salario fijo y es mínimo, ya que es una población pobre. Debido a ésto Marta abrió hace dos años una pulpería, la cual vió la opción de generar ingresos y ayudar a su hogar sin descuidar a su familia. Su esperanza es crecer y fortalecer su negocio, para mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de ella y la de su familia. Se enteró de los servicios de la Fundación por medio de una socia de otro grupo y le pareció la idea de formar y pertenecer al programa de banco mujer, para ayudarse entre sí en su comunidad, debido a que no cuentan con ninguna otra organización que les pueda brindar el apoyo que necesitan. 
El préstamo lo va invertir en comprar abarrotes para reforzar su negocio.
Junto con Marta hay seis socias más, las cuales invertiran en actividades comerciales y de agricultura. Ellas escogen el nombre para su grupo "Kish Alaglowa", ésto en idioma cabecar, porque les gusta el significado, el cual es mujeres guerreras, debido a que luchan hasta alcanzar sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Marta is a woman of 28, single, and the mother of three minor children. She is in a common-law relationship and two of her children attend primary school. The community where they live is rural, and to get to it it is necessary to cross a large river. She is hard-working and has a great desire to succeed. 

Her husband is a farmer so is income is limited and minimal, as it is a poor village. For this reason Marta opened a small general store two years ago, which she saw as a way to generate income and help her household without neglecting her family. Her hope is to expand and strengthen her business in order to little by little improve living conditions for her and her family.

She found out about the services of the Foundation through a member of another group, and thought of forming a group and belonging to the women's communal bank program so that people in her community could help one another, because they have no other organization that can offer them the help they need. 

She is going to use the loan to buy groceries for building up her business. 

Along with Marta there are six other members, who invest in small businesses and in farming. They have chosen "Kish Alaglowa" as the name for their group– this in the Cabecar language, because they like the meaning, which is "warrior women", due to the fact that they are striving until they attain their objectives.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her store.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор с раннего утра занимается фермерскими работами. Она трудится с раннего утра упорно для того, чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь и прокормить своих 2 детей. Гулбахор единственная кормилица своих 2 детей, так как она разведена и обеспечивает своих детей сама. Она более 2 лет занимается скотоводством. Она в основном откармливает коров и продает местном жителям молоко. Гулбахор уже несколько лет хочет отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом в плохом состоянии. Она не имеет достаточно денег для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulbahor is involved in farming work since early in the morning. She works hard from an early morning in order to earn a living and feed her 2 children. Gulbahor is the sole breadwinner for her 2 children because she is divorced and provides for her children by herself. She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 2 years. She primarily fattens up cows and sells milk to local residents. Gulbahor has been wanting to repair her house for many years because her house is in a bad condition. She does not have enough money for this. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to purchase construction materials. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and repair her house

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor de 58 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace varios años, adicional a eso también se dedica a la además a la crianza de cerdos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar,  Vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Victor está solicitando  un crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como:  semillas, controles de plagas, herbicidas, abonos, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y así obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Víctor is 58 years old and has specialized in harvesting corn for several years, in addition to this, he also specializes in raising pigs. What he obtains from his sales allows him to address some of the expenses that he faces at home; he lives in his own house with his family. 

Victor is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as: seeds, pest controls, herbicides, compost, etc. and to improve the land that shown in the photograph, that way he can obtain a better income and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pest controls, herbicides, compost, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура молодая трудолюбивая женщина. У нее 2 сына которым 6 и 4 года. Манзура живет со свекровью, так как муж находиться в России. Манзура шьет на дому национальные платки для свадеб и других мероприятий. Она покупает на базаре ткань  и вышивает на нем различные красивые узоры в ручную. У нее много покупателей среди соседей и магазинов. Также она шьет национальные женские платья. Сейчас очень модно делать компьютерные  вышивки с различными узорами по усмотрению клиентов. Ручная вышивка очень долгая и усердная работа и поэтому  дорого стоит, Сейчас в моде современные узоры, и больше заказов на этот тип узоров. Манзура долгое время ходила делать компьютерную вышивку знакомой это ей обходилось дорого так как она за эту услугу она доплачивала. Поэтому она хочет купить компьютерную швейную машинку от которого она планирует получать больше доходов.
texts.en: Manzura is a young, hardworking woman. She has 2 sons, who are 6 and 4 years old. Manzura lives with her mother-in-law because her husband is in Russia. At home, Manzura sews national shawls for weddings and other events. She buys fabric at a market and embroiders various, beautiful designs by hand. She has many customers among neighbors and stores. She also sews women's national dresses. It is very popular now to make computer embroideries with various decorations according to customer requests. Hand-made embroidery is a very long and labor-intensive work, and this is why it is expensive. Current decorations are in style now, and there are more orders for these types of decorations. Manzura has been going to her friend to make computerized embroidery, and this has been costing her more because she had to pay for this service. This is why she wants to purchase a computerized sewing machine from which she plans to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and accessories for retail

loans.name: New Lamka G Group

texts.en:
Nialbiakkim, the featured profile member with her hand raised, and 11 other women residing in various rural areas around Churachandpur, Manipur in the northeastern part of India have come together to seek a loan to buy solar home lighting systems. Devoid of continuous access to grid based power, they depend on other alternative lighting devices such as kerosene lamps, candles and petromax to light their homes and shops for a significant period of time after dark every day. Their families are forced to divert a considerable share of their means towards the purchase of kerosene, as it is an expensive fuel.  Besides, the lamps are putting the health of the family members at risk as they emit lethal gases while burning kerosene. So, the women want to purchase solar lighting devices, which are a cleaner alternative. However, these women cannot afford them as they entail finances out of their reach. So, they are looking for support in the form of a loan of 146,076 INR to buy solar lighting devices, each costing 12,173 INR. Your help will not only bring an end to their daily ordeal with the noxious fumes but also engender additional savings to live a better life. These women need mini solar home lighting systems for their income-generating activities such as weaving, variety store, pan shop etc. Also, they want to install them n their homes for their children’s studies and to do their household chores with hassle-free work at night.

They thank and appreciate Kiva for the wonderful opportunity given to them.

loans.use: To buy a solar home lighting system to install in her pan shop

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis lives in Hoima Uganda. He is 34-years-old, married, and has 4 children aged between 7 and 12, and three of them attend school. He deals in produce selling, mainly beans, and gets addition income from a retail shop and farming. 

He began his business to have several sources of income. Price fluctuation is a challenge to his business. Denis is acquiring a loan to buy more beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell

loans.name: Estela Marilyn

texts.es: Estela de 40 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo quien trabaja como albañil, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de totopostes (panes tostados hechos de maíz) desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia también vende de forma ambulante, tiene mucha cliente pues sus productos son muy buenos y aprecios accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Estela esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los ingredientes necesarios para seguir elaborando los totopostes como: maíz, huevos, manteca, azúcar, etc. por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Estela is 40 years old and lives with her two children and her husband, who works as a bricklayer. She works in the sale and production of totopostes (a kind of toasted bread made of corn). For some years she has had her business in their place of residence and she also sells on the street.  She has many clients because her products are very good and reasonably priced. With her profits, she is able to cover some of the household expenses.

Estela is asking for a loan to be able to buy the ingredients needed to continue making her totopostes, such as corn, eggs, lard, sugar and so on, at wholesale prices to be able to continue with her business, since this is her only line of work. In this way, she will be able to give her family what it needs without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy corn, eggs, lard, sugar and so forth at wholesale

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson raises livestock and runs a maize mill to earn a living. He earns an additional income from selling milk and growing crops. He cites seasonal changes as being the primary challenge to his business, as these lead to reduced sales in all areas of his business.

Johnson lives with his wife and their six children in Hoima. Five of the children attend school. 

He is requesting a loan in order to buy cows so that he can increase his milk production and sales.

His goal is to earn enough money from his business activities to build a permanent house for the family.

loans.use: to buy cows so that he can increase his milk production and sales

loans.name: Corina

texts.es: Corina de 34 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y conocida en la zona, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, su negocio lo tiene en su lugar de residencia, con lo que ella trabaja logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su hijas y dos sobrinos, Corina está  solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: quesillo, maíz, frijoles, chicharrón, tomates, etc.para poder obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Corina, age 34, is a very hard-working person who is well-known in the area.  She sells 'pupusas' [stuffed tortillas].  Her business is at her house.  With what she gets from working she manages to pay for some of the household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her daughters and two nephews.

Corina is requesting a loan to buy raw material like soft cheese, corn, beans, fried pork rinds, and tomatoes, etc.  She will do this to be able to get better income and to give her family a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy soft cheese, corn, beans, fried pork rinds, and tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Katooke Saving & Lend Group

texts.en:
Harriet is a hard working married woman with two children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a member of a village bank group whereby members guarantee one another for a loan. 

She sells sodas, sugar beers, Mukomboti (a local beverage), and spirits. She obtains additional income from growing maize, beans, and bananas. She experiences low turn out of customers and bad debts which limit her business’ competitive edge. 

Her vision is to be economically okay from the proceeds of her business. Harriet needs the loan to buy spirits, soda, and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy spirits, soda, and beer to sell.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson, who used the previous loan to buy rice and beans to sell, resides in Hoima, Uganda. He is married and has four children, three of which attend school. 

He deals in produce buying and selling, especially maize, rice, and beans. He also earns additional income from farming and goat slaughtering (butchery). 

Weather changes hinder his sales.   

In the future, he desires to build a residential house.

Johnson is acquiring a loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Betesi

texts.en:
Betesi is a twenty eight-year-old single woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a boutique as her main source of income, although she practices tailoring as her side income business. It is from these businesses that she has been able to sustain herself. High rental and license fees are a problem, but she has hopes of expanding her business into a big tailoring school in Kamwenge Town. 

Betesi is requesting a loan to buy fabrics and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and clothes to sell

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal aged 29 runs a bar in Hoima, Uganda. He supplements his income with a produce business and boda boda (motorcycle) transport business.  He is married and has two children aged five and two, and one attends school. 

Due to high competition, he has few customers and this reduces his sales. He hopes to expand the business into a fully stocked renowned bar around his town.

He will use the loan to buy more soft drinks and beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks and beers to sell

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive, age 45, runs a retail shop in Hoima to earn a living. She earns additional income from farming. She initially started her shop business in order to earn enough money to ensure the education of her six children, who are now between the ages of 19 and 30. Three of them still attend school. 

Her dream is to grow the business into a large-scale supply shop, but she is hindered by limited capital and high transportation costs.

Olive will use her loan funds to buy soft drinks,eggs, and sandals to offer for sale in her shop.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks,eggs, and sandals to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald deals in spare parts in addition to farming in Hoima, Uganda. He is 43-years-old, married, and has nine children, four of which attend school. He hopes to build a residential house and educate his children up to a high level of learning, since he never acquired the same education, due to lack of money for school fees. Limited capital limits his business stock and consequently his sales.

He is acquiring this loan to buy more bicycle and motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bicycle and motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Lerato

texts.en:
lERATO is applying for a third loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the first loan:

“My studies have been extremely well for the past two years of being on Kiva. I don't have transport challenges any more!  I am currently enjoying all the academic courses which I have enrolled for.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Possible Jayagadh Health Clinic

texts.en:
Possible Jayagadh Health Clinic is a nonprofit organization focused on providing high-quality, low-cost or free healthcare to the world's poor. Possible is providing support to Jayagadh Health Clinic as part of their partnership with the government of Nepal.

The loan will be used to install a solar energy system at Jayagadh Health Clinic in the remote far-Western region of Nepal. The solar energy system will be 1.6 kW in size, and will include a battery back-up system to ensure that lights and medical equipment can be run in the evenings. The loan will pay for the upfront costs of the solar energy and battery storage system.

Reliable energy is a critical part of delivering high quality health care.  Because of an existing lack of reliable energy at Jayagadh Health Clinic:  
    - Midwives have to hold flashlights with their mouths to deliver babies at night - and over 120 babies are born at Jayagadh each year.  Solar energy will provide adequate lighting.
    
    - The clinic is unable to procure a vaccine refrigerator due to poor electricity supply. With solar energy, they will be able to power a vaccine refrigerator and provide essential vaccines after birth.
    
    - Other simple medical equipment such as oxygen machine and suction machine can prevent complications during childbirth, but without reliable energy, this equipment cannot be used.
    
    - Snakes are sometimes an issue during the rainy season, and without lighting the patients and staff are afraid to go to the clinic at night. Solar powered light will help ensure that people feel safe going to the clinic.

Avishek (pictured), SunFarmer's Director of Engineering - Nepal, has been deeply involved in this project and brings years of experience in providing reliable energy to health clinics, schools, and communities throughout rural Nepal.  He will be overseeing ongoing maintenance of the system and loan repayment.

Possible is a leading nonprofit organization, which was named a "Top 1%" charity by Givewell in 2011. Possible is a highly visible and well-known organization in Nepal, where it employees over 160 Nepalis and runs Bayalpata Hospital, a large community hospital that treats over 4,000 patients each month. Possible has operated Bayalpata Hospital since 2007 and has managed to attract support from the local community as well as government stakeholders.

Jayagadh Health Clinic is located in a very remote and hilly area of Nepal. Grid electricity is unavailable for 12 to 20 hours a day, and when it does arrive is often very low voltage. Alternatives such as diesel are highly polluting, expensive, and are often not delivered to such remote areas. Solar is the most cost effective and reliable energy solution for health clinics like Jayagadh.

loans.use: to pay for solar equipment that will provide reliable energy at their health clinic

loans.name: Iasinta

texts.en:
Iasinta is 63-years-old, married, and the mother of seven children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Iasinta needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a sprayer, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, and a machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. 

Iasinta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a sprayer, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, and a machete

loans.name: Lita Tuiga

texts.en:
Lita is 36 years old, married, and has four children. She has a small vegetable garden and grows cabbages and tomatoes that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Lita needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a tiller, a rake, a watering hose, a farming fork, gloves, weed killer chemicals, and a wheelbarrow. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. 

Lita will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a tiller, a rake, a watering hose, a farming fork, gloves, weed killer chemicals, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Faifua

texts.en:
Faifua, age 43, is a taro farmer. She grows and harvests taro on a small plantation, and sells the produce in her community or at market. She has been engaged in this business for 12 years.

She and her husband have five children.

Faifua has been a member of SPBD since 2002. She has requested a loan in order to buy a tiller, a wheelbarrow, a machete, fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, barbed wire, iron poles, a spade, and new rubber boots. 
 
She will use the profits from her increased sales to cover her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a tiller, a wheelbarrow, a machete, fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, barbed wire, iron poles, a spade, and new rubber boots

loans.name: Silia

texts.en: Silia is a 73-year-old widow with six children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has nine years of experience with this business. Silia needs a loan to buy a large canoe, new flippers, new goggles, a spear, a new fishing net, new rods and hooks. She plans to save her profits in case of an emergency. Silia has been a member of SPBD since 2005.

loans.use: to buy a large canoe, new flippers, new goggles, a spear, a new fishing net, new rods and hooks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Gagay Group

texts.en:
Modesta is the featured representative of the Gagay group. She and the other group members are best friends who left their home country, the Philippines, to search for better work opportunities in Lebanon. They are very devoted to each other, which is why they got together to acquire a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua.

Modesta is a 56-year-old married mother of four. She struggled to provide for her children back home, so she decided to move abroad to increase her income, through working as a housekeeper. She misses her children a lot and hopes to join them again one day. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to send some money to her family to pay for her children's school tuition fees. Modesta is the second lady standing on the far left side, Gemma is the first from the left, Imelda is the second from the right with the red top and Darlina is the first on the right.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey, age 34, sells maize, beans, and groundnuts to earn a living. He has been engaged in this business since 2006. He earns an additional income by keeping poultry. He lives with his wife and their three children in Kasese. Two of the children attend school.

Godfrey began his business to generate income to support his family, and his dream is to expand the business further. He works hard to make his business thrive, despite the challenges of drought and other seasonality factors, as well as delinquent payments from his customers.

He requested a loan in order to buy beans, groundnuts, and maize to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy beans, groundnuts, and maize to offer for sale

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred sells rice, beans, cassava and maize flour in Hoima, Uganda. She is a hardworking woman with one child who is two years old. She started business to take care of her basic necessities. She dreams of expanding her business. However, price fluctuations hinder her business. She will use the money to buy more rice, beans, cassava and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans, cassava and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Yosamu

texts.en:
Yosamu lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a 61-year-old hardworking married man and father of one child aged 15, who attends school. 

He started his business 20 years ago, dealing in produce mainly of maize, nuts, and coffee farming. Yosamu earns additional income from a pension. He started his business to supplement his income. 

He hopes to expand his farm acreage and his biggest challenge is weather changes. 

He needs a loan to pay for land title processing.

loans.use: to purchase a title for his land

loans.name: Nestor Jaime

texts.es:
Néstor ha vivido grandes experiencias en su vida, tanto así que ha adquirido gran destreza en diferentes ares.
Trabajo en construcción durante varios años realizando trabajos pesados todos los días, un día se canso de este trabajo y comenzó a buscar un actividad que le permitiera obtener sus propios ingresos y que el trabajo no fuera tan pesado, fue así como inicio con la venta de mercancía, más exactamente medias en el centro de Medellín. Esta actividad la aprendió de manera empírica; pero al principio las cosas no fueron fáciles ya que no encontraba un lugar fijo para trabajar y las autoridades públicas lo desplazaban de varios lugares donde se acomodaba.
Hoy en día tiene su negocio muy bien ubicado y realiza ventas diarias trabajando de 7:00 am a 7:00 pm todos los días.
Con este trabajo ha podido sacar adelante a su hijo de 5 años y a su esposa.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de medias y realizar unas mejores ventas, adicionalmente desea realizar algunos arreglar al carro donde exhibe su mercancía.
Con este préstamo podrá continuar trabajando y mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nestor has had great experiences throughout his life; this has allowed him to acquire great skills in different areas. He worked in the construction sector for several years doing hard work every day. One day he grew tired and began looking for a job that would allow him to earn his own income and that would not be as exhaustive, that is how he began selling merchandise, more specifically, socks, in downtown Medellin. He learned this empirically; at first things were not easy as there was no fixed place where he could work and the public authorities would remove him from several spots where he had settled. Nowadays he manages a business that has a good location and he has sales from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm every day. This job has allowed him to support his 5-year old son and his wife. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase an assortment of socks and to improve his sales, additionally he seeks to perform some fixes to the vehicle were he displays his merchandise. With this loan he will be able to continue working and improve his wellbeing and the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of socks and to fix his display vehicle.

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en:
Lesina, age 36, is a taro farmer. She grows and harvests taro on a small plantation, and she offers the produce for sale in her community or at the market. She has been engaged in this business for four years.

She and her husband have two children.

Lesina has been a member of SPBD since 2010. She requested a loan in order to buy seedlings, fertilizer, chemicals, a sprayer, a tiller, a crowbar, a machete, and a new wheelbarrow. 

She will use the profits from her increased sales to cover her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, chemicals, a sprayer, a tiller, a crowbar, a machete, and a new wheelbarrow

loans.name: Faalua

texts.en:
Faalua is 39 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She owns and operates a small store selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

Faalua needs a loan to buy a large chest freezer, a new hanging scale, a sack of rice, onions, potatoes, salt, sugar, and a wide display fridge. 

She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and help cover her family's daily expenses. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2010, to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a large chest freezer, a new hanging scale, a sack of rice, onions, potatoes, salt, sugar, and a wide display fridge

loans.name: Nuulua

texts.en:
Nuulua is 18 years old, single, and has no children. She has a small coconut oil business where she uses a large brick oven to roast the coconuts for oil. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Nuulua needs a loan to buy bricks, cement, coconuts, empty bottles, strainer, gloves, and fire wood. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. 

Nuulua will use the profits from her sales to contribute money for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, coconuts, empty bottles, strainer, gloves, and fire wood

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala is 50 years old, unmarried, and has five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

Kalala needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a tiller, new gloves, new boots, overalls, a rake, a machete, and a sprayer. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. 

Kalala will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a tiller, new gloves, new boots, overalls, a rake, a machete, and a sprayer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, scones, donuts, soft drinks, coffee, and foam cups

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en:
Faafetai is a 58-year-old married woman with 6 children. She makes and sells donuts, pies, and scones in her community to earn a living. She has 8 years of experience with this business. 

Faafetai needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, custard powder, and large plastic basins, trays, and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Faafetai has been a member of SPBD since 2006.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, custard powder, and large plastic basins, trays, and plastic bags

loans.name: Polini

texts.en: Polini is 34 years old and single with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. Polini needs a loan to buy crops, a wheelbarrow, a machete, chemicals, fertilizer, new gumboots, a sprayer and new overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Polini will use the profits from her sales to pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy crops, a wheelbarrow, a machete, chemicals, fertilizer, new gumboots, a sprayer and new overalls

loans.name: Faasamata

texts.en:
Faasamata, age 20, earns a living by growing cabbages, cucumbers, carrots, and pumpkins on her small plantation. She has been engaged in this business for more than six years. She is unmarried and has no children.  

Faasamata has been a member of SBPD since 2013. She has requested a loan in order to buy farming supplies such as a spade, a rake, a wheelbarrow, and fertilizers. 

With the profits from her increased sales, Faasamata hopes to expand her business so that she can help support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as a spade, a rake, a wheelbarrow, and fertilizers

loans.name: Friendship1 Group

texts.en:
Doller is the featured representative of the Friendship1 group. She and the other group members are best friends who left their home country, Philippines, to seek better work opportunities in Lebanon. They help each other in every difficulty they face. Therefore, they got together to acquire a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to improve their living conditions.

Doller is a 39-year-old, single mother of one. She has a university degree, yet she struggles to cover her family's expenses. She is an ambitious woman who works as a chef, and always seeks the best for her daughter. She's acquiring a loan from Al Majmoua, to settle her daughter's school tuition fees. She hopes she will be able to join her again one day, in order to provide her with the care she needs from her mother. Doller is the sweet woman standing on the right side. Christele is in the middle, while Nida is on the left side.

loans.use: To settle her daughter's school tuition fees

loans.name: Elizaberth

texts.en:
Elizaberth is 20 years old, single, and has one child. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Elizaberth needs a loan to buy chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, fertilizer, a crowbar, a tiller, and gloves. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. 

Elizaberth will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, fertilizer, a crowbar, a tiller, and gloves

loans.name: Meleseke

texts.en:
Meleseke is a 32-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She runs a business of sewing clothes in her community. She has more than 10 years of experience with this business. 

Meleseke has requested a loan to buy an electric sewing machine, threads, paints, needles, etc. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine, threads, needles, paint, etc.

loans.name: Kadijatu

texts.en:
This is 53 year-old Kadijatu.  She is widowed, and has 5 children aged 34, 32, 30, 28 and 21 years, One is attending school. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because of schooling and helps in domestic work.  

In 2012, Kadijatu established her provision business. Kadijatu sells mainly baby milk, butter, sardines, mayonnaise, juice, pure water, and soft drinks. She began her business because she did not get any formal education, due to lack of support, so she got married when she was a teenager. During of the rebel war, she travelled to the capital city, where her sister and daughter gave her some money to start her business.  She started selling local products and she rented a shop from the profits she accumulated.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,900,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy baby milk, butter, sardines, mayonnaise, juice, pure water, and soft drinks. 

In the future, Kadijatu plans to expand the business and purchase land. The loan will help maximize her profits. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy baby milk, butter, sardines, mayonnaise, juice, pure water, and soft drinks

loans.name: Bahriddin

texts.ru: Бахриддин молодой и перспективный молодой человек. Ему 19 лет. Бахриддин является студентом 2 курса Таджикского Национального Университета. Он учится в факультете Экономика. Бахриддин учится на хорошие и отличны оценки. В свободное время от занятий он играет футбол. Бахриддин мечтает в будущем стать хорошим специалистом. Бахриддин запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bahriddin is a promising young man of 19 and a second-year student in the Faculty of Economics at Tajik National University. He earns good grades and plays soccer in his free time. In the future, he dreams of becoming an expert in his field. Bahriddin is requesting a loan to pay his tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Fanolua

texts.en:
Fanolua, age 41, earns her living by preparing and selling pancakes and ice cake in her community. She has been engaged in this business for two years. 

She and her husband have five children.

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her small business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as flour, cooking oil, sugar, a fry pan, and plastic cups.  

With the her increased earnings, Fanolua will support her family's needs. She also intends to build savings for unexpected emergencies

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, cooking oil, sugar, a fry pan, and plastic cups

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en:
Ioana, age 35, designs and sells clothing items in her community to earn an income. She has three years of experience in this business. 

She and her husband have five children. 

Ioana joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services. She has requested a loan in order to buy a design board, paints, material, scissors, and a sewing machine. 

She plans to use her increased profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a design board, paints, material, scissors, and a sewing machine

loans.name: Toeaso

texts.en: Toeaso is a 43-year-old woman who is unwed with four children. She has a small canteen business. To earn extra income, she also runs a cafeteria. Toeaso needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, butter, cases of eggs, icing sugar, a can of coffee, a coffee maker, foam cups, plates, a small display fridge, snacks and a large chest freezer. She will use her profits to expand her business and help pay for her family's weekly expenses. Toeaso joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and equipment for her food production business

loans.name: Tiana

texts.en:
Tiana, age 45, makes furniture to earn a living. She has more than 10 years of experience in this business. She makes and sells such items as dining tables, dressing tables, and chairs.

She and her husband have one child.

Tiana joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services. She requested a loan in order to buy such items as plywood, varnish, paints, and nails. 

She will use her increased profits to expand her business as well as to support her child's education.

loans.use: to buy such items as plywood, varnish, paints, and nails

loans.name: Ivan Andres

texts.es:
Iván realiza una d las labores más nobles y lindas que se pueden encontrar en el mundo, y es una labor veterinaria que viene ejerciendo desde hace mucho tiempo luego de haber terminado sus estudios universitarios.
El es un hombre estudioso y muy aplicado, que presta sus servicios en el municipio de La Dorada especialmente trabajando con ganado bovino en las áreas de cría y reproducción además del cuidado y protección de estos animales.
Se gana la vida de una manera digna y de labor muy humanitaria.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de un ecógrafo veterinario portátil, elemento que le permite examinar y determinar la gestación del ganado y realizar un correcto control del parto y la cría.
texts.en:
Iván participates in one of the most noble and beautiful jobs that can be found in the world -- that of veterinary work. He has been a practicing veterinarian ever since he finished his university studies many years ago.

Iván is a very diligent and studious man, offering his services in the municipality of La Dorada. He works especially with raising cattle in the areas of breeding and reproduction, in addition to the care and protection of these animals.

He earns his living in a dignified and very humanitarian manner.

Iván is seeking this loan to purchase a portable veterinary ultrasound machine, which is elemental in allowing examination and determination of the gestation of cattle, and in properly controlling calving and breeding.

loans.use: to purchase an ultrasound machine to continue his work.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera, age 30, grows and harvests taro, bananas, and taamu on her small plantation to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for four years. 

She and her husband have four children.

Sera has been a member of SBPD since 2011. She has requested a loan in order to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knives, chemicals, a weed-sprayer, and a bag of fertilizer.

With her increased profits, Sera hopes to better support her family financially and to save more for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knives, chemicals, a weed-sprayer, and a bag of fertilizer

loans.name: Chernor Iye

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Chernor Iye.  She is married, and has 6 children aged 24, 21, 16, 13, 11 and 8 years, four are school going children. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to attend school and help in domestic work.  

In 2011, Chernor Iye established her provisions business, selling mainly soft drinks, luncheon meat, pure water, sardines, and biscuits. She began her business because she had only Arabic education, as tradition does not allow a girl child to attend any formal school.  She helped her father in his business and later got married at a young age; her husband gave her some money to start her own business. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about 5,415,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL in order to buy soft drinks, luncheon meat, pure water, sardines, and biscuits.  

In the future, Chernor Iye plans to build a dwelling house and educate her children. 

The loan will help maximize her profits. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, luncheon meat, pure water, sardines, and biscuits

loans.name: Mesepi

texts.en:
Mesepi, age 32, runs a small business preparing and selling banana chips in her community to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for three years.

She and her husband have five children.

Mesepi joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. She has requested a loan to buy a fryer, a gas oven, vegetable oil, and baking powder. 

With her increased earnings, Mesepi will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fryer, a gas oven, vegetable oil, and baking powder

loans.name: Yesenia Maribel

texts.es: Yesenia tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre y dos hermanos. Yesenia se dedica  a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace tres años. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora quien se esfuerza mucho por sacar adelante a su familia. Yesenia solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda y para encementar el piso y pintar las paredes de la vivienda. Con el monto comprará cemento, arena, grava, lámina galvanizada, polines, etc.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 27 and lives with her mother and two siblings in their own house. Yesenia has been working in the provision of domestic services for three years.  She is a very strong woman who works hard to get her family further ahead.  

Yesenia is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the repair of the roof of their home, and also to put in a cement floor and paint the walls of their house.  With this amount, she will buy cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheet metal, and roof support poles.

loans.use: to purchase: Cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheet metal, roof support poles, etc.. to repair the roof, floor, and walls of her house.

loans.name: Fiapito

texts.en:
Fiapito, age 36, operates a small store business to earn an income. She sells flour, rice, sugar, chicken legs, and a number of daily consumption goods in her store, which she has been running for five years.

She and her husband have two children.

Fiapito became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a freezer for her store, as well as to purchase bags of flour, sugar, and rice to offer for sale. 

She will use her profits to expand her business, and hopes to save money toward her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for her store, as well as to purchase bags of flour, sugar, and rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is a 64-year-old married woman with seven children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has six years of experience with this business. 

Sina needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil, a gas oven, and a frying pan. 

She plans to use her profits to improve her business and to support her family financially. Sina has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil, a gas oven, and a frying pan.

loans.name: Punitia

texts.en:
Punitia is 33 years old and a married woman with four children. She runs a small business, selling banana chips in her community. She has been doing this for three years. 

Punitia has requested a loan to buy oil, bananas, plastic bags, tongs, a frying pan, a gas oven, etc. for her business. 

She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Punitia will extend her business and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy oil, bananas, plastic bags, tongs, a frying pan, gas oven, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a wise woman who knows how to manage well the finances she has. Every time she is given a chance to have a loan, she invests it immediately in her sari-sari store business. Lydia has managed her retail store business for almost three years. 

She is married to a farmer who grows rice on their farm. Through her profit from her retailing business, she is able to provide their daily food and invest in their farm. Lydia wishes to run a hog raising business soon for another source of income. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more grocery items to sell in their village. She believes she will also increase her income, and that will enable her to start another source of income, which is a hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell in their village.

loans.name: Santiago Jose

texts.es:
Santiago es un hombre emprendedor, tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Ucayali junto a su familia.
Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando principalmente el cacao, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y sobre todo porque ofrece excelentes productos a un precio competitivo.
Santiago está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una moto furgon para que pueda trasladar sus productos hasta los puntos de venta. Con esto ella podrá obtener mayores ingresos y así más adelante podrá sembrar más cacao y seguir apoyando a su familia en todo lo que pueda.
texts.en:
Santiago is an enterprising man, 45 years old, unmarried, living in Ucayali together with his family.

For eight years, he has worked in agriculture, principally cultivating cacao. He is doing very well because he is a highly responsible person, a hard-worker, and above all because he offers excellent products at competitive prices.  

Santiago is grateful for Kiva lenders because with the support they offer, he hopes to be able to purchase a moto-wagon (motorcycle+wagon vehicle) to transport his products to the points of sale.  

With this, Santiago will be able to increase his income and thus plant more cacao, and continue to support his family in every way that he can.

loans.use: to purchase a moto-wagon (motorcycle + wagon vehicle)

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 53 years old, married, and has three children she is sending to school. Elena’s husband is a farmer who grows rice in their field. Due to the minimal land area they have, Elena wants to help her husband to provide for their children's needs. She has hired herself out as a baby sitter for their relatives. While taking care of the baby, Elena also is engaged in a hog-raising business. With the help of her husband, she is able to manage the business well.

Elena would like a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy feed for her hogs. She says that her earnings are not enough to provide enough feed for her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, age 30 and widowed with two children, runs a general store business to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for five years and also earns an additional income from farming rice. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Analiza has borrowed and successfully repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more grocery items to sell in her store.

Her goal is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie gained experience in cooking pizza pie for her relatives. With her desire to have her own business, Rosie saved some of her salary from when she was working and mastered well the pizza pie recipe. 

Now, Rosie makes and sells pizza in their village and in school. She also accepts orders for occasions to have additional income. 

Rosie wants to borrow a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy raw ingredients for pizza, such as flour, cheese, yeast, sugar and many more items. 

Rosie hopes to have more customers to serve a pie to, and to have more profit as well. She will prioritize her family needs with the income she will earn.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for pizza, such as flour, cheese, yeast, sugar and many more items.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 38 years of age, married, and has five children. Of her children, four are attending school. They are in the middle of college, high school, and elementary levels of education. According to Lucia, no matter how difficult life is, she and her husband do their best to provide a better future for their children.

Lucia is engaged in a tailoring business, while her husband grows rice on their farm. Due to financial constraints, Lucia sometimes rejects some of her costumers' orders because she doesn’t have enough materials. As a result, Lucia wants to take a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy fabrics, threads, and yarn. Having this loan helps Lucia to meet and respond immediately to her costumers' desires.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, and yarn to fulfill her customers' orders in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Tulipe

texts.en:
Tulipe is a 55-year-old woman who is married and has six children. She has a stable flea market business, selling soft drinks and a variety of food. To earn extra income, she also has a small plantation where she grows taro.

Tulipe needs a loan to buy a second-hand pick-up for her plantation, as well as cases of soft drinks, a weed sprayer, chemicals, and plastic bags. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and to help with the expansion of her business. Tulipe joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand pick-up for the plantation, as well as cases of soft drinks, a weed sprayer, chemicals, and plastic bags

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne  37ans, 2enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO II l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 2ème  prêt solidaire. AWA,          1ère femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de sucre, 2 cartons de boîtes de lait concentré,20 Litres d’huile alimentaires et 1 carton de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 56 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Benkadi Group, on average, are 37 years old, have two children, and all live in traditional extended families in Santoro II, one of the neighborhoods of San/Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through family ties and buy and sell various goods.

Having properly repaid their previous [loan], the women of Benkadi Group are on their second group loan. Awa, the first woman standing from left to right in the photo, plans to use her loan to purchase three sacks of sugar, two boxes of containers of condensed milk, 20 liters of cooking oils, and one box of Maggi [bouillon] cubes. Awa gets her supplies on site from the wholesalers. Her sales are made to a group of customers made up of men and women, for cash and often credit.

Awa expects to see an average monthly profit of 56,000 CFA francs, which will be used for expenses related to health, food, clothing, and school fees, and the rest will be reinvested in the businesses.

loans.use: To purchase various goods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy local beverages.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is 32 years old, married, and had a child. He is a tricycle driver and provides motorcycle transport services to the people in his village. 

Fernando wants to improve his transport service business and is asking for a loan to invest in his business. He is asking for PHP 4,000 to buy gasoline and to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle. This will help him ensure safe travel for all his passengers and save funds for his family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en: At his age of 60, Alfredo still has the passion to work and succeed. He is still doing some field work in order to lessen his labor costs. Alfredo manages his two hectares of farmland. He plants and harvests rice in the field. Due to costly farm inputs, Alfredo’s budget is not enough to provide all his farm needs. For this reason, Alfredo is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his farm. He considers the loan to be a big help in growing his crops quickly and avoiding pests and diseases by applying enough farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his farm.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is married and has three children attending college. Rodolfo’s wife is a government teacher in their village. He manages their farming business in their village. He inherited his one hectare of farmland from his parents. With his desire to further sustain their children's necessities, Rodolfo invested in another one hectare of farmland. Now, Rodolfo runs a two-hectare rice farm.
 
Due to the ongoing needs of their children in their studies, Rodolfo’s budget for his farm has a shortage. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and fuel. He will do his best to see his children as professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and fuel.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Annie works hard to support her family. She has a business selling snack food in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming rice.

Annie is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy more snack foods to sell at her food stall. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. Annie hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne  26ans, 1  enfant et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à HAMDALLAYE l’un des quartiers de la ville de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits et des céréales.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur 16ème  prêt solidaire. ASSETOU ,2èmefemme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter10 chemises,10 robes, 15 jupes et 5 pantalons. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 27 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Danaya Group, on average, are 26 years old, have one child, and all live in traditional extended families in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods of the town of San/Ségou (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). These women met through family ties and buy and sell clothing and cereals.

Having properly repaid their previous loans, the women of Danaya Group are on their 16th group loan. Assetou, the second woman from left to right in the photo, plans to use her loan to purchase 10 blouses, 10 dresses, 15 skirts, and 5 pairs of pants. She gets her supplies on site from the wholesalers. Assetou sells to a group of customers made up of men and women, for cash and often credit.

Assetou expects to see an average monthly profit of 27,000 CFA francs, which will be used for expenses related to health, food, clothing, and school fees, and the remainder will be reinvested in the businesses.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
While managing her retail business, which is a sari-sari store, Sonia also does some field work like planting. Sometimes they hire her as a laborer on a farm. She is married and has one kid. Working as a laborer on a farm was her sideline. 

With regards to her retail business, Sonia wants to extend the business she has to her customers. She is asking for a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy shampoo, soap, sugar, powdered milk and coffee, and many more items. 

At her age of 54, she believes that she can still improve the business and earn a higher income that will enable her to provide all their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, sugar, powdered milk and coffee, and many more items.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El Señor Juan vive y trabaja en Colomi; con 55 años de edad, de estado civil casado hace más de 35 años, económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 35 años,siembra en terreno propio de 2 Has. en el mismo lugar produce papa, papaliza, oca y haba; tiene experiencia en manejo de estos cultivos, empezando desde la siembra. Cuenta con cabezas de ganado 3 de engorde y 1 lechera. Ahora requiere un crédito para la compra de abono orgánico(gallinaza) semillas agrícolas para la siembra porque se acerca esa época y quiere proveerse de estos insumos ademas tambien desea mejorar su producción agrícola, lo cual le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos económicos y por tanto las condiciónes de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan lives and works in Colomi. He is 55 years old and has been married for 35 years. He is independent financially, and has been farming for 35 years. He farms on his own 2 hectare plot of land. Here he produces potatoes, oca and papalisa (types of edible tubers), as well as lima beans. He has experience managing these crops, beginning with planting. He has three head of cattle for fattening, and one dairy cow. 

Now he requires a loan in order to purchase organic fertilizer (chicken manure), seeds and agricultural supplies for planting, because the season is approaching and he wants to provide himself with these supplies and also wishes to improve his agricultural output, which will allow him to improve his income and therefore his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer (chicken manure).

loans.name: Daniel Armando

texts.es:
Daniel es un hombre trabajador, tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Tiene un hijo por quien día a día trabaja para poder brindarle un futuro mejor. A pesar de no estar con la madre de su hijo él mantiene la responsabilidad sobre los gastos del pequeño.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte con un taxi que alquila y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, siempre tratando con mucha amabilidad y respeto a los clientes y respetando las leyes de tránsito.
Daniel está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un carro para que pueda obtener más ingresos como chofer y no tener que pagar por el alquiler, de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá esforzándose para darle una educación de calidad a su hija.
texts.en:
Daniel is a hard working person. He is 28 years old, single and lives in Ica with his family. 

He has a son. He works every day in order to bring a better future for him. Even though he is no longer with the mother of his son, he is still responsible for all the expenses for the little one. 

For the past 5 years he has worked as a taxi driver. He rents the taxi and it has gone very well for him because he is a hard working, responsible person who always treats his clients with respect and kindness and respects the traffic laws. 

Daniel is thankful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the support they have given he will be able to buy a car and  increase his income as a driver and not have to pay for the rental. 

This way he will be able to improve the quality of life for his family and to keep working hard to give his son a good quality education.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for work

loans.name: Soran

texts.en:
Soran is 23 years old and a single man.  He is a junior student at a private university in Phnom Penh. Soran, who comes from Prasat Bakong District, Siem Reap Province. Soran is considered an outstanding student at his university. Having chosen English Literature as his major academic program, Soran wants to become a Professor of English in the future. He believes that being involved in the field of education is an important role in developing his country.

Unfortunately, the budget that Soran gets regularly from his parents to pay the university fees is now insufficient. Thus, he is requesting a loan to pay his university fees for the last year of his academic program. Soran would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support, which can change his whole life.

loans.use: to pay for university fees

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 35 years old, and both of her children are in school.

Jenelyn has a bamboo retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more bamboo to offer for sale.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to offer for sale.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio es un joven muy emprendedor y con miras de progreso desde que era un niño.
El trabajo durante un tiempo en distintos almacenes de ropa como vendedor en el municipio de Itagüí, allí adquirió cierta experiencia en este campo y fue así como decidió independizarse y comenzar a vender su propia mercancía en compañía de su hermano.
Hoy en día tiene un negocio de venta de ropa para dama y caballero bien establecido, sus principales clientes son amigos familiares y compañeros de trabajo de su hermano.
El pide un préstamo para la compra de surtido de ropa para aprovechar las temporadas altas de comercio.
Esto le permitirá capitalizar su negocio y generar unos ingresos más estables.
El sueña con poder tener un almacén grande con el que pueda sostener a sus padres.
texts.en:
Mauricio is a very enterprising youth, with a view toward progressing forward since he was a child.

Mauricio worked as a salesperson in various clothing shops in the municipality of Itagui for a while, thereby acquiring solid experience, and that was how he decided to become independent and start selling his own merchandise in partnership with his brother.

Today he has a well-established business selling women's and men's clothing. Their principal clients are family friends and his brother's coworkers.

Mauricio is seeking this loan to purchase an assortment of clothing items to sell and to make the most of the high season for sales. This will allow him to capitalize on his business and generate a more stable income.

Mauricio's dream is to have a large store with which he can support his parents.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of goods for his business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old and married with 11 children.

She earns a living by running a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Erlinda has been in pig fattening for 20 years and earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 63 years old and widowed with three children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase  canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Evelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nelia works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle repair business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from clothing sales.

Nelia is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her motorcycle repair shop. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. Nelia hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her motorcycle repair shop.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 43 years old and single with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, beer, snack foods, noodles, eggs, etc. to sell.

Liza has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, beer, snack foods, noodles, eggs, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, beer, snack foods, noodles, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Pio

texts.en: Pio is 37 years old and single with no children. He owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. He has been doing this for three years. Pio needs a loan to buy a new display refrigerator, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, and sacks of onions and potatoes. He hopes to use his profits to pay for the renovation of his house and help pay for his family's weekly expenses. He became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for his business.

loans.use: to buy a new display refrigerator, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, and sacks of onions and potatoes

loans.name: Tegal Sari Group

texts.en:
The Tegal Sari group has made their payment. During the loan period, they have managed their businesses well. They maintain sows and the sows can give birth to up to 12 piglets. But not all of them do - some also give birth to 6–8 piglets, depending on the type of the sow. The superior sow can give birth to more piglets than the local sow.

Ni Ketut is very happy because her sow gave birth to 11 healthy piglets and she sold all of them. She kept them for two months and then sold them to the other breeders in her village. She used all the profits as capital for her pig business. Given this success with her sows, Ni Ketut continues her business as a piglet seller. Her piglets are of good quality because she keeps them well and gives them nutritious feed and vitamins. She has also become an example to other breeders, not only in her group, but also in her village. With another loan of the same size, Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase superior quality feed and to renovate her pigs' cage. She hopes her plan will go smoothly.

Two of the members of this group decided to resign after they earned enough profits from their pig businesses and were able to continue their businesses with their own money. They are very grateful and thankful to lenders, Kiva, and MUK for their support.

loans.use: to purchase superior quality feed and renovate her pigs' cage

loans.name: Faavae Mona

texts.en: Faavae Mona is a 46-year-old married mother of three children. She has a small vegetable market business. To earn extra income, she also makes and sells chips in her community. Faavae Mona needs a loan to buy a two-sided cabinet, fertilizer, a tiller, chemicals, bananas, taro, a barrel of vegetable oil, seasonings and plastic bags. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. Faavae Mona joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a two-sided cabinet, fertilizer, a tiller, chemicals, bananas, taro, a barrel of vegetable oil, seasonings and plastic bags

loans.name: Goretti Bella

texts.en: Goretti Bella is a 49-year-old married mother of two children. She has a small landscaping business. To earn extra income, she runs a lawn-mowing business. Goretti Bella needs a loan to buy five steel weed cutters, road cones, a mini tractor, safety boots, indicator vests, picks, shovels and rakes. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help expand her business. Goretti Bella joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy five steel weed cutters, road cones, a mini tractor, safety boots, indicator vests, picks, shovels and rakes

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer manages a hog raising and farming business. He grows rice in their field while his wife is taking care of their children. Elmer’s four children are attending school. Rain or shine, Elmer visits his crops in the field to make sure they are in good condition. Elmer's goal is to produce good crops and higher yields for an outcome of greater income as well. Most of the time, Elmer's income from the business goes to his children's education. He always prioritizes his children's education because he believes that it is the best treasure he can give to his children. Elmer is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides for his farming business. He hopes to see his children soon have a better way of living as they finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides for his farming business.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is a married woman with five children, one of whom is currently in school. She is 41 years old and is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Charito has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Charito requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 44 years old and has nine children. She is married, and five of her children are currently in school.

Emelie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Emelie has been in pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Emelie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 70 years old and married with seven children.

Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase  shampoo, sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries.

Emma has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Emma aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Vineta

texts.en: Vineta is 51 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for six years. Vineta needs a loan to buy a new display refrigerator, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, and sacks of onions and potatoes. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display refrigerator, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, and sacks of onions and potatoes

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependents. 
Evelyn has managed a sari-sari store that sales groceries and other consumable products for 15 years and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month from her business. She has requested a loan to buy groceries and other consumable goods for resale.
Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: To buy groceries and other consumable goods

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 30 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children, both in school. 
Melody has run a hog-fattening business for almost three years. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month from her business. She has requested a loan to buy four sacks of booster and grower feeds for her hog-fattening business. 
Melody has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Melody hopes to expand her hog-fattening business.

loans.use: To buy four sacks of booster and grower feeds

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married with five children.  She is 54 years old and lives in Bagalupa.  Jocelyn sells a variety of snacks like puto, hot cakes and banana que  to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy ingredients for her snack vending. 

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for one years.  In the future, Jocelyn hopes to become snack distributor in their place.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her snack vending.

location.town: Pagadian - Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 54 years old, married and a resident of Sto Nino,Mahayag,Zamboang Del Sur, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have two children, both in school.  Starting with an investment of 10,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member in April 2008 and has taken out three loans.
