Now, she is applying for 50,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El Señor Ramiro, vive y trabaja en Corani; con 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 3 años. Siembra en terreno propio de 3 Has. en el mismo lugar produce papa, locoto y zapallo; tiene experiencia en manejo de estos cultivos, empezando desde la siembra. Ahora requiere un crédito para la compra de abono y semillas agrícolas para la siembra porque se acerca esa época en el lugar y quiere proveerse de estos insumos, de esta forma quiere mejorar su producción agrícola, lo cual le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos económicos y mejorar su nivel de vida en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Ramiro lives and works in Corani. He is 20 years old, single and economically independent. He has worked as a farmer for the past 3 years. 

He cultivates his own 3 hectar plot of land. He grows potatoes, pumpkin and hot peppers. He has experience in 
taking care of the crops starting from the sowing stage. 
 
He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds as the sowing season is approaching and he wants to have these supplies. 

This way he can improve his harvest which will allow him to increase his income and improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Angelyn

texts.en:
Angelyn is 44 years old and a married mother of one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Angelyn has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Angelyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy blankets, curtains and towels to sell to customers.

Angelyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Angelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy blankets, curtains and towels to sell to customers.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Don Agustín, tiene 61 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de San Marcos, Santa Barbara. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura realizando trabajos de jornal a otros agricultores, y hace 10 años decidió tener  sus propios cultivos, produce maíz, frijoles y hortalizas como repollo, tomate, chile y otras. De esta producción obtiene ingresos para su familia. Ha solicitado el cuarto ciclo de préstamo que es por 6,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar insumos y compra de semillas para cultivar maíz, frijol y hortalizas. Su objetivo es aumentar la cosecha, en un futuro piensa comprar más terreno para sembrar y darle a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Agustín, 61, lives with his wife, has two children and lives in a village in the municipality of San Marcos, Santa Barbara. 

He has always worked in agriculture doing day labor for other farmers and 10 years ago he decided to grow his own crops. He grows corn, beans and vegetables such as lettuce, tomatoes, peppers etc. 

With these crops he gets income for his family. 

He has requested his fourth loan cycle which is for 6,000 Lempiras [$325] with which he will buy supplies and seeds to grow corn, beans and vegetables. 

His goal is to increase his harvest. In the future he plans to buy more land to cultivate and give it to his children.

loans.use: to buy supplies and seeds to grow corn, beans and vegetables.

loans.name: Viia

texts.en: Viia is a 58-year-old widow with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Viia has requested a loan to buy spades, a weed sprayer, planting sticks, wheelbarrow, chemicals etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Viia hopes to use her profits to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy spades, a weed sprayer, planting sticks, wheelbarrow, chemicals etc.

loans.name: Seleni

texts.en: Seleni is 34 years old and married with three children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as salt, sugar, flour, and rice. She has been doing this for five years. Seleni needs a loan to buy sacks of rice, flour and sugar, salt, and boxes of noodles. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and to pay for  her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, sacks of flour and rice, salt, and boxes of noodles.

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is 63 years old, married, and has two children. She is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her family in Mahayag. She is a farmer who plants corn and palay.

Concordia wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seed, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seed, compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies and add improvements to her workplace

loans.name: Vaolotu

texts.en: Vaolotu is a 43-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Vaolotu has requested a loan to buy weed spray, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, and fertilizer. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Vaolotu hopes to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, a wheelbarrow, chemicals,  fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 48 years old from Molave. She is a farmer who grows corn and palay.  Evelyn wants to increase sales.  She has requested a loan that will enable her to pay for land preparation and labor, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation and labor.

loans.name: Maynard

texts.en:
Maynard is 66 years old  married and a resident of Caluya, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. He and his wife have four children, two in school.  Starting with an investment of 3,000 PHP, he opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, he was able to generate savings and enjoy the benefits given by the co-op. He became a member last 2007 and has taken out three loans. 

Now he is applying for a 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocs for his sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, Maynard wants to open another store outlet at the market for added income.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for his sari-sari (general) store, particularly basic commodities

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 39 years old and lives with her family in Mahayag. Paulina works with her husband in their field that grows palay.
Paulina wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to pay for the farm inputs and labor so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to pay for the farm inputs and labor.

loans.name: Aivey

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Aivey works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from rice retailing.  Aivey is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more charcoal to sell for her retail business.

Aivey has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bekhal

texts.en:
Bekhal is a true model of a persistent, self-made Iraqi woman. A 48 year old mother, she took over the prime responsibility of raising her teenage son after her divorce 15 years ago. Following her divorce Bekhal’s work as school clerk did not provide enough income to cover her and her son’s expenses. To supplement her income, she worked in the evenings for almost three years, making handicrafts and knitting wool to provide an extra income. When she realized that this extra income would not cover the increasing expenses of her growing son, she decided to build on her old hobby of hair dressing and open her own beauty salon.

Although she was faced with many difficult challenges, including a lack of capital, Bekhal refused to give up. She worked in a salon for two years learning her trade and saving money. Over time, she saved enough to attend professional training in Turkey and finally opened her own salon in 2004. Though she remembers the difficult times she faced, Bekhal is proud of her achievements and has become a strong entrepreneur who has been able to prove her worth to her family and her society.

Through the creation of her salon, Bekhal was able to create two job opportunities for other community members and expects to increase her number of employees as her business develops. Her growing business and willingness to cultivate her occupational skills qualified her to participate in the WLIFT program and take an SME loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 12,000 USD. With this money, Bekhal hopes to expand her business by purchasing additional equipment that will improve her clients’ experience, including massage chairs; manicure and pedicure tools and equipment; and furniture.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional equipment that will improve her clients’ experience, including massage chairs; manicure and pedicure tools and equipment; and furniture.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta is 61 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a small business selling taro and banana chips in her community and she has been doing this for 4 years. Elisapeta has requested a loan to buy a frying pan, oil, gas oven, containers, and plastic bags. She joined SPBD in June 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Elisapeta hopes to save for unexpected emergencies and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a frying pan, oil, and cooking gas for her business

loans.name: Juana Noemy

texts.es:
Juana de 25 años de edad,  estudio hasta tercer año de bachillerato.  Ella es madre soltera de un niño de 5 años que asiste al jardín de niños. Comenta que la vida no le ha sido fácil,  su madre con mucho esfuerzo le dio el estudio hasta bachillerato. 

Juana trabaja en una repostería, la mama le cuida al niño y lo  lleva al jardín de niños porque ella viaja, y camina 15 minutos al desvió principal allí cojeé un bus que conduce a la ciudad, ella se traslada otros 15 minutos y aborda otro bus que la conduce a la ciudad donde ella trabaja  y tiene un horario de 7:30 a 5 de la tarde. Con 3 años de experiencia 

Con el crédito ella Comprara  una refrigeradora porque no la tiene y eso es una mejor calidad de vida que ira alcanzando porque el niño a veces no tiene adonde aguardar los alimentos perecederos y esto también es una mejora familiar porque son necesidades básicas.  

Comenta que tiene muchas cosas como ponerle pavimentó al piso de la casa, cerámica también  para evitar enfermedades virales para él bebe, porque pasa con mucha gripa. 

Para el hijo espera verlo crecido con un título académico, para que no le cueste mucho la vida que la pueda hacer diferente.
texts.en:
Juana is 25 years old and studied up to the third year in high school. She is a single mother of a five year-old child who attends kindergarten. She says that her life has not been easy, but her mom tried hard to get her through high school.

Juana works in a bakery while her mom takes care of her child and takes him to kindergarten, because Juana has to travel far to work. She walks 15 minutes to the main road, where she takes a bus across the city for 15 minutes, then transfers to another bus which takes her to the city where she works. She works from 7:30am to 5:00pm, and has three years of experience.

With the loan, she will buy a refrigerator, which she does not currently have. This will provide her with a better quality of life, which she is trying to achieve because now she doesn’t always have a place to store perishable food for her son. This is a basic necessity that will improve her family’s life.

She says that she has many things to improve, such as putting pavement in the floor of her house, as well as ceramic, to prevent her son from getting viral diseases, since he gets the flu a lot.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 55 years old and lives in Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children, all adults. 
Rosie manages a sari-sari (general) store that sales groceries and other consumable products. She has been in business for 10 years and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month from her business. She has requested a loan to buy groceries and other consumable goods for retail.
Rosie has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Rosie hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: To buy groceries and other consumable goods

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 30 years old and responsibly provides for his family in Mahayag.  He is a farmer who plants corn and beans.

Richard wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other items, so that he can continue to put bread on the table in his home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only that she is doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 62 and a widow, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Elisa wishes to become the supplier of fruits in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Iuliana

texts.en: Iuliana is a 39-year-old single woman with 2 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as salt, sugar, flour, boxes of noodles, and rice. She has been doing this for 5 years. Iuliana needs a loan to buy more stock. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and to support her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.en: Mercedez is a farmer that grows corn and beans. She is 52 years old, from Mahayag. She signed up for membership with PMPC for her needs of capitalization. Mercedez wants to increase sales. She has requested a loan to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other items. She wishes to continue to put bread in their home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and fertilizers

loans.name: Iver

texts.es: El Señor Iver vive y trabaja en Corani; con 19 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la agricultura hace 2 años. Siembra en terreno propio de 10 Has. en el mismo lugar produce papa, locoto y zapallo y tiene experiencia en manejo de estos cultivos, empezando desde la siembra. Actualmente requiere un crédito para la compra de abono y semillas agrícolas para la siembra porque se acerca esa época en el lugar y quiere proveerse de estos insumos, por este motivo solicita un préstamo ya que quiere mejorar su producción agrícola, lo cual le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos económicos y por tanto mejorar las condiciónes de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Iver lives and works in Corani. He is 19 years old, single, and economically independent. He has made a living farming for 2 years. He farms on his own grounds of 10 hectares. He grows potatoes, chilis, and pumpkin, and has experience handling these crops from sowing to finish. He currently needs a loan to buy fertilizer and agricultural seedsfor planting, as he will need them soon. Therefore, he is requesting this loan to improve his agricultural production, enabling him to increase his income and thus improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and agricultural seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase live-boxes and vegetable oil

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary es una mujer de 20 años de edad soltera y sin hijos.
Ella pertenece a una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, toda su vida la dedicó a la cría de ganado vacuno. Estudió y finalizó la escuela secundaria,  en el transcurso de su vida aprendió la producción de  derivados de la leche como el yogurt, el queso, la nata, etc. Ahora ella se dedica exclusivamente a la producción de quesos y sus variedades siendo su especialidad el queso menonita y el queso chaqueño. Mary quiere producir  mayor cantidad de queso para aumentar su oferta y mejorar sus ingresos y la de su familia, para eso necesita mayor producción de leche eso sólo lo obtendrá sumando más cabezas de ganado vacuno a su granja. Su negocio enfrenta desafíos como el clima árido del lugar. Mary tiene muchos sueños ella desea ser una gran empresaria contar con una marca de quesos que recorra todos los mercados lácteos y ser reconocida por su calidad y sabor.
Es por esos motivos que Mary solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno y así aumentar la producción y calidad de quesos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Mary, 20, is single and has no children.  She completed secondary school.  She lives in a farming community and has spent her whole life raising cattle.  During her life she learned to make dairy products such as yogurt, cheese, cream, and so on.  Now she earns a living exclusively making varieties of cheese, her specialty being Mennonite cheese and Chaqueño cheese.

Mary wants to produce more cheese to increase her supply and improve her income and her family's.  She needs to produce more milk for that, which she'll get only by adding more head of dairy cattle to her farm.  The challenge her business faces is the area's arid climate.

Mary has a lot of dreams.  She wants to be a great businesswoman and have a brand of cheese sold throughout the dairy market that is recognized for its quality and taste.

For those reasons, Mary's requesting a loan to buy cattle to increase the quantity and quality of her cheese for her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy cows to increase her cheese production

loans.name: María Agustina

texts.es:
María de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta 2do grado de educación básica, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos no pudo seguir con sus estudios, y decidio dedicarse al trabajo de oficios domésticos, y también al trabajo de la jarcia (que es la elaboración de hamacas) de la cual ella obtiene sus ingresos para poderle ayudar a su familia, ella es madre soltera  tiene 3 hijos y ella vive junto con sus padres en su casa.

María tiene 20 años de experiencia en lo que es el trabajo de la elaboración de hamacas, este trabajo ella lo aprendió gracias a sus padres que se lo enseñaron, ya que a través de este trabajo  obtiene sus ingresos para poderle ayudar a su familia, aparte de realizar este trabajo,  ella también se dedica a lo que es la agricultura.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar hilo para elaborar las hamacas e insumos agrícolas para fertilizar su parcela de maíz, ella comprara 5 sacos de fertilizante, 2 bolsas de semilla de maíz.

Los sueños que ella tiene es obtener de su milpa el  alimento para darle el sustento a su familia, y también poder comprar material para hacer hamacas para obtener ingresos de ese trabajo.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old and studied up to second grade at school. For financial reasons she could not continue with her education and decided to take care of the household chores and work making hammocks. It is from the hammocks that María earns an income to be able to help her family. María is a single mother. She has three children who live at home with her and her husband.

María has twenty years experience making hammocks. She learned the trade from her parents and, through this work, she earns an income to be able to support her family. In addition to this work, María works in farming.

This loan will be used to buy threads for making hammocks, and to buy farming supplies to fertilise land where she grows corn: five bags of fertiliser and two bags of corn seed.

María's dream is to grow her cornfield so as to support her family. She also wants to buy materials in order to make hammocks and earn an income from this work.

loans.use: to buy threads for making hammocks, and to buy farming supplies to fertilise land where she grows corn: five bags of fertiliser and two bags of corn seed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chair for washing customers' hair, and tools for her work.

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es: El señor Bacilio vive en la provincia de Tiraque,  su principal actividad es la producción agrícola es un persona sencilla y trabajadora, demuestra responsabilidad y tiene capacidad de gestión para administrar su actividad, de estado civil soltero pero vive en concubinato con su pareja, para la siembra y cosecha utiliza personal eventual que son del lugar, no cuenta con casa propia,  para la realización de su trabajo en el campo utiliza tracción animal para la siembra que son sus propias yuntas además el trabajo es de entorno familiar con sus propios hijos, ahora se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para compra de abono y semillas de papa  para aumentar su producción agrícola de esa manera podrá mejorar su ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Bacilio lives in the province of Tiraque, and his main business is agricultural production. He is a simple and hardworking person who demonstrates responsibility and has the ability to manage his business.  He is not married, but lives with a common-law partner.  He hires local people to help him with planting and harvesting.  He does not own his own home.  He uses his own team of oxen for his work in the fields, as well as the labor of his family members including his children.  He now needs a loan to buy manure and seed potatoes, in order to increase his production.  With this he will be able to increase his income, and provide a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and seed potatoes.

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es: Hector tiene 22 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 3 años de edad. Hector es un hombre muy trabajador quien se dedica a la prestación de servicios de albañilería y jornalero. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento  a su hogar. Hector solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro dado que desea terminar un cuarto que esta construyendo el cual por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar.
texts.en:
Hector is 22 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and his 3 year old daughter. 

Hector is a very hardworking man who works offering his services as a builder and day labourer. In this way he earns a living and supports his family and home. 

He is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of bricks, cement, sand and iron, as he wishes to finish a room that he is building, but has not yet managed to finish due to lack of economic resources.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron to finish a room.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 45 years old and married with six children.  With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Mercy's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fishing business, and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Mercy has taken a PHP 9,714 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Mercy is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her food vending, and is now requesting a PHP 7,350 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Maria Fe will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Maria Fe would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza works hard to support her family. Analiza is single, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Analiza requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Carmenia

texts.en:
Carmenia is 59 years old and a widow with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Carmenia runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell.

Carmenia has been in this business for four years, and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Carmenia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and resell bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a married woman with two children. She is 44 years old, and her children are in school.

Zarina has a personal products retail business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has been in this business for five years. 

Zarina requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more personal products to sell.

In the future, Zarina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Sabali vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 49 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Diakobougou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment et de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Nematou     (la 2eme femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 paniers de tomate et 10 paniers d’oignon chez les maraichers du village. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison et au marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Nematou   espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 6500 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women of the Sabali group live in traditional families. They are 49 years old on average, and each have three children. They all live in the town of Diakobougou, in the Segou region (fourth largest region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through neighbours, family and relations, and they conduct revenue-generating activities in the village. They sell condiments and grains for a living. In order to boost their working capital, the members of the group have decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first cycle of a solidarity loan. 
Madame Nematou (the second lady standing - from right to left in the photo) is a large retailer of condiments in the village and its surrounding areas. She aims to use her loan in order to purchase 5 baskets of tomatoes, and 10 baskets of onions from the gardeners of the village. She sells the goods for cash or credit at home, or at the market to a mixed customer base. 
Madam Nematou hopes to generate an average monthly revenue of 6,500 FCFA with this loan, which will be used for her children's needs and also to boost her business capital. She wishes to continue her collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Samoun's Group

texts.en: Samoun’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Samoun makes a living cultivating rice  and her son also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Saman's Group

texts.en: Saman’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Saman makes a living cultivating rice  with her family and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan tiene 60 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 12 años y 17 años de edad. Juan es jornalero desde hace 10 años y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del corredor en la parte frontal de la vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, polines, madera, etc.
texts.en: Juan is 60 years old.  He lives in his own home with his wife and their two children, who are 12 and 17.  Juan has worked as a laborer for 10 years to earn a living and support his household.  In order to improve his living conditions, he decided to ask for this loan through FUSAI.  He wants to invest in building a corridor at the front of his house.  For this he will need materials such as sheet metal, poles, wood, etc.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, poles, wood, etc. to build a corridor in his house.

loans.name: Sroeurn's Group

texts.en: Sroeurn’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sroeurn makes a living cultivating rice with her family and her son also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en: Pheap’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Pheap makes a living cultivating rice with her family and she also does extra work as a construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each member of the group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en: Yan’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Yan makes a living cultivating rice, raising pigs and working as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: José Sarbelio

texts.es:
José de 51 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado,  ya grande de 10 años empezó a ir a la escuela, ya que no existían cerca de donde él vivía, lo que le impido ir desde pequeño. Está casado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar con quien ha compartido 26 años su vida. Se han sabido comprender y entender, por lo hoy le dan el buen ejemplo a sus hijos. De los 5 hijos que tiene los últimos tres están estudiando, lo mayores están aparte. 

Él  se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene más de 16 años de dedicarse a la actividad productiva, fue un tío quien le enseño a trabajar, por medio de las correcciones que le hacía fue como lo hizo que fuera una persona de bien para la sociedad. También se dedica al cultivo hortalizas, por hoy tiene una plantación de 400 palitos de chile y dentro de poco sembrara pepinos. El trabajo lo tiene cerca de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie, sus hijo desde pequeños les enseña a trabajar por lo que siembra los involucra los trabajos. Su horario de trabajo es de 6 am a 11 am.

El préstamo será invertido en la preparación de la  tierra para la siembra, también comprara los insumos para los cultivos, como semilla, abono, pesticidas, pago de mano de obra y herbicidas.  Con el préstamo pagara personas quien le ayuden con los trabajos más grandes,  ya que el de las hortalizas lo maneja él con sus hijos. 

Su deseo es poder tener primero lo más necesario para sus hijos y su esposa, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad el poder comprar los insumos que necesita. La cosecha una parte la destinara para la venta y pago de la cuota del crédito y lo demás para el consumo.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old and studied as far as sixth grade. He started school at the late age of 10, because there were no schools near to where he lived, which made it impossible to go when he was little. He is married and his wife, with whom he has shared 26 years of his life, looks after the home. Of their 5 children 3 are still at school and the older ones have moved away.

José works in agriculture and has had a productive role for more than 16 years. An uncle of his taught him how to do the work, and, by teaching him to be courteous, made him into a decent member of society.

José also grows vegetables and at the moment he has 400 chilli plants and plans to plant cucumbers soon. He works near to his home and gets there on foot. He has taught his children how to work from a young age, involving them in the work when he is planting. His hours of work are from 6am to 11am.

The loan will be used to prepare the land for planting and to buy supplies for growing crops such as seeds, manure, pesticides and weedkiller and to pay for labour. He will use the loan to pay people who help him with the bigger jobs, since he manages the vegetables with his children.

He hopes firstly to have what is most necessary for his wife and children, and so he hopes to keep working for as long as God gives him life and health. The loan will help him to meet these needs by being able to by the supplies he needs. Part of the harvest will be sold and used to pay off the loan and the rest will be for their own consumption.

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting, buy supplies for growing crops such as seeds, manure, pesticides, weedkiller and pay for labour.

loans.name: Erick Fernando

texts.es: Erick, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su madre y hermano en el municipio del negrito, Yoro. El trabajó por varios años en empresa privada y hace 3 años decidió poner su propio negocio, vende productos de la canasta básica como arroz, manteca, maíz, harina, azúcar, café, carnes, refrescos, jugos, pastas, lácteos, productos de aseo etc. El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 Lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de mas productos como refrescos, jugos, pastas, carnes, harina y granos básicos para surtir su negocio y con las ganancias piensa continuar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Erick is 19 years old. He is single and lives with his mother and brother in the municipality of El Negrito, Yoro.  He worked for several years in a private company. Three years ago, he decided to set up his own business; he sells basic necessities like rice, butter, corn, flour, sugar, coffee, meats, soft drinks, juices, pastas, dairy products, cleaning products, etc. 

The loan he is requesting is for 15,000 Lempiras [HNL], and he will invest it in the purchase of more products, like soft drinks, juices, pastas, meats, flour, and staple grains to stock his store. With the profits, he is planning to continue his university education.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juices, pastas, meats, flour, and staple grains to sell

loans.name: Rugare Queens Group

texts.en:
Ruth is a member of Rugare Queens group. Rugare Queens group is a group of hard working enterprising women. Ruth stays in Rugare Township in Harare. She sells chicken offcuts in the high density area of Rugare. Ruth has been in this business of selling chicken offal and fish for more than 3 years. 

Ruth is a widow who has had to shoulder the responsibility of raising and educating four children on her own. She is grateful for the loan availed to her by Thrive Microfinance as it will give her a chance to add more variety to her business by selling other chicken cuts as well. This will enable her to increase her market share and improve her and her children’s livelihood.

loans.use: To buy more chicken and fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for costs involved in expansion of a dairy cows business.

loans.name: Kushinga Livelihood Strategies Group

texts.en:
Linda is a married homeowner with three dependents. She lives in Hatcliffe, a high density suburb in Harare and she is the one on the far left in the group photo. She is a member of Kushinga Livelihoods Strategies group (KLS) which is community and business based. The group has a rotating savings club that has been running for the past five years. KLS is a four member group of women whose businesses have potential to grow. They got their first loan from Thrive and they managed to meet all the deadlines and repaid within six months.

Initially, Linda was a cross-border trader who was into buying and selling of clothes, shoes and electrical gadgets. When she got her first loan she financed her cross-border business and used the resulting profits to venture into her new poultry business and currently she is rearing 200 birds at time. KLS group is applying for a combined loan of $2300 from Thrive and Linda will use her portion to finance her cross-border and poultry business. She is planning to stagger her 200 bird batches by three weeks to ensure a continuous supply chain to her customers. She reckons consistency in every aspect of business is a vital ingredient to success.

loans.use: To buy more day old chicks to grow for resale.

loans.name: Kankelen Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Kankelen vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier pelengana sud l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement et fruits et légumes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  8eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Aicha (1ere la femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagne wax dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  20 pièces de pagne wax à Bamako et à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, au marché  et en ambulant à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Aicha espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 60 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour aider son mari et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer le partenariat  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women of the Kankelen group all live in nuclear families. They are aged 44 years old on average and have 4 children. They all live in the South Pelengana quarter, one of the quarters of Segou (the fourth largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 
They met through neighbours, family and marriage, and through their revenue-generating businesses in the quarter. They sell clothing, fruit and vegetables. In order to boost their business capital, the members of the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their eighth loan. 
Madame Aicha (the first woman standing up - from right to left in the photo) is a large retailer of pagne wax cloths in the quarter and its surroundings. She aims to use her loan in order to buy 20 pieces of pagne wax from Bamako and Segou. She sells for cash and credit at home, at the market and via ambulant sales to a mixed customer base. 
Madame Aicha hopes to generate an average monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be used to help her husband and also to boost her business capital.  She wishes to continue the relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase pagnes (wax cloths)

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana tiene 46 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos de 16 años, 17 años, 21 años, 14 años y 12 años de edad. Ana se gana la vida mediante la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella desea construir una pila para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: arena, ladrillo, cemento, etc.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her five children aged 16, 17, 21, 14 and 12.

For a long time Ana has earned a living providing domestic services. She wants to build a sink and so she is asking FUSAI for this loan to buy the necessary materials such as sand, bricks, cement etc.

loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, cement etc. to build a sink.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
Maria es una joven emprendedora, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Actualmente estudia en un Instituto para ser una gran chef mas adelante y trabaja en un restaurante de Pizza cerca a su casa.
Es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante y quiere brindar un mejor futuro a su familia.
MAria está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá empezar a construir su cuarto en la casa de sus padres para tener mayor independencia y comodidad, con esto, mejorará su calidad de vida y seguirá esforzándose para más adelante "tener su propio restaurante".
texts.en:
María, 21, is a young entrepreneur.  She's single and lives with her family in Ica.  Currently she's studying to be a great chef in the future and working in a pizza restaurant near her house.  She very much wants to get ahead and give her family a better future.

María's grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their help she'll be able to start building her bedroom in her parents' house so she has greater independence and comfort.  She'll improve her quality of life and keep on working hard so she can have her own restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to build a bedroom in her parents' house

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 43 years old and a mother to her two children. She has been very supportive to her farmer husband as they busy themselves with their farming activities in Mahayag. 

She is very keen on every detail of their business and she sees opportunities for expanding but only if they have enough capital to support their next planned project.  She applied for a loan to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer.  Lenie hopes to sustain their business so she can continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer

loans.name: Sara Brunela

texts.es:
Sara es una joven emprendedora, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Estudió la carrera de Secretariado y actualmente está trabajando en una gran empresa. Le va muy bien porque es muy inteligente, competitiva, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación. Su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia y es por ellos que trabaja arduamente para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Sara está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comenzar con los trámites para obtener su Título profesional y de esta manera pueda postular a un cargo mejor y obtener mayores beneficios con los que podrá sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Sara, 21, is an enterprising young woman.  She's single and lives with her family in Ica.

She studied to be a secretary and current works in a big company.  It's going very well for her because she's very intelligent, competitive, and responsible, and she very much wants to improve herself.  Her greatest motivation in life is her family.  She works hard for them so she can improve their quality of life.

Sara's grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support she'll be able to start the paperwork to get her professional degree so she can apply for a better job and get better benefits with which to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to pay the costs of her professional degree

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jenalyn is 44 years old and both of her children are in school.

Jenalyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jenalyn requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to buy more corn to sell to customers.

Jenalyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jenalyn would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more corn to sell to customers.

loans.name: Meralyn

texts.en:
Meralyn is 28 years old and married, with two children who are both in school. Meralyn works very hard to provide for them.

Meralyn's business and family home were destroyed by super-typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Meralyn has taken a PHP 9,714 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Meralyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en:
Ilyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ilyn is 42 years old and all of her children are in school.

Ilyn has a repair shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment.

Ilyn has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Ladywise Group

texts.en:
Svodai (left) and her friend are the remaining members of the Ladywise group from Tynwald South, Harare. She is 35, married with 5 children of school going age and the sole provider for her parents who live in the rural areas. When she came to Thrive in 2013 she was a cross border trader importing clothes, cellphone accessories and face creams from Zambia, South Africa and Mozambique. 

With the funds she received from Thrive she managed to grow her business and repay the loan together with her group. Svodai managed to buy a residential stand during her second loan cycle as well as meeting her routine household responsibilities. She is happy with the training she received from Thrive and also the encouragement she got from her group members during their meetings. During the second loan cycle, she also diversified into selling kitchenware in Gokwe, a rural area where she travels twice a month. In this third loan cycle, a Kiva loan will assist her in increasing her capacity to meet the growing demand for kitchenware in Gokwe and in turn produce enough income with which she can build her house.

loans.use: To buy kitchenware for resale.

loans.name: Candelaria Evangelista

texts.es:
Candelaria  de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, por la escasez de dinero en la familia no pudo continuar estudiando, pero lo que a prendió es lo que hoy en día la sirve tanto. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, trabaja duro para darle sustento a los suyos ya tiene más de 15 años de dedicarse a la actividad. Solo tuvieron tres hijos, por lo que por hoy viven solos ya que todos vive cada quien en su hogar. 


Ella es ama de casa, toda su vida sea dedicado a los oficios del hogar, pero desde su hogar genera ingresos, ya que corre por su cuenta el cuidado de los animales de corral, tiene gallinas, cerdos y ganado, los que ella cuida todos los días y al tener una necesidad de dinero comenta que los vende para obtener el ingreso. Desde pequeña se crio con su madre que fue quien le enseño todo lo que sabe, no tiene otras actividades a las que se dedique, su esposo le ayuda también con todos sus quehaceres, desde que se levanta hasta que se acuesta. 


El préstamo será invertido en la compra de 3 cerdos pequeños para engórdalos cuidarlos y venderlos, el mejoramiento que el crédito hará es el poder siempre trabajar como le gusta con animales que los puede cuidar desde su casa.  

Los sueños que tiene es el poder estar siempre pendiente de su esposo,  ya que solo ellos dos viven en casa, espera siempre seguir aconsejando a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien, con la ganancia que genere de la venta de los cerdos será utilizado para el pago de la cuota y los gasto que no faltan en la casa.
texts.en: Candelaria is 40 years old.  She went to school as far as the fourth grade, but due to a lack of money in her family she was unable to continue studying.  However, what she was able to learn is very useful to her today.  Her husband has been a farmer for 15 years, and works hard to support his family.  They only had three children, and are now living alone because their children are all living in their own homes.  She has been a homemaker her whole life, but also earned income from her home by raising animals. She has chickens, pigs and cattle which she cares for every day, and when she needs money she sells one of them.  She learned everything that she knew from her mother at a young age.  She has no other occupation.  Her husband helps her with her chores, from the time that she wakes up until she goes to sleep.  The loan will be investing in buying 3 pigs to fatten, raise and sell.  It will help her by allowing her to continue doing the work that she likes with animals, which she can do from home.  Her dream is always to be with her husband, now that only the two of them are living in the house.  She hopes to continue giving advice to her children so that they will be good people.  The income that she will earn from the sale of the pigs will be used to make her loan payments and for household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 3 pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow them to reduce household spending and improve their home lighting

loans.name: Sonia Esperanza

texts.es: Sonia de 35 años de edad tiene 2 hijas de 17 y 13 años y un hijo  de 14 años de edad, siendo madre soltera se dedica a la venta de pan francés y pan dulce de forma ambulante con lo que mantiene la economía del hogar. Ella es una persona que no se deja amedrentar por las dificultades y ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos por si sola y solicita este prestamo a FUSAI para construir un cuarto para la cocina ya que como se observa en la fotografía necesita proteger esta área de su casa por lo que comprará lamina galvanizada, madera, cemento, arena y piedra.
texts.en:
Sonia, 35, has two daughters, ages 17 and 13, and a son, 14.  She's a single mother who earns a living and supports the household budget by selling French bread and pan dulce [sweet bread] as a street vendor.

She's someone who isn't daunted by her problems.  She has managed to get her children ahead on her own.

Sonia's asking FUSAI for this loan to build a room for her kitchen.  As the photograph shows, she needs to protect this part of the house.  She's going to buy galvanized metal, wood, cement, sand, and stones.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal, wood, cement, sand, and stones to build a kitchen

loans.name: Sarvarby

texts.en:
Sarvarby is a hardworking and kind woman. She is 43 years old. She is married and brings up eight children. She has a big family. 

Six years ago she began her own business of selling children's clothes because she needed money. She sells children clothes in a local market. Her daughter helps her with managing the business. 

Sarvarby is going to increase working capital and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy children's clothes for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes

loans.name: Julma

texts.en:
Julma, aged 51, is married to a farmer and blessed with four children. She has owned and managed a retail store for almost five years, earning a net income of PHP 500 daily. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to apply for a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to purchase beverages, biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil, and coffee to sell. Her net income from her business is usually spent on their children's education. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 43 years old, married and a resident of the municipality of Mahayag. Her husband earns well as a tricycle driver. But Eden didn't rest comfortably with the earnings of her husband, since her children are growing and will be entering college soon. She wants to save enough for the family. That's why she opened a sari-sari store. 

As a PMPC member, she is applying for 37,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.  In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and all of her children are in school.

She has a repair shop business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 15 years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new equipment for her shop.

In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her shop.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. She is a farmer (vegetables), age 28 years who lives with her husband and two children, her husband is a farmer too, and they work together. It is clear that Elsa works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity.   
The family currently illuminates their home with kerosene lamps because the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area.  She mentioned that she hopes to improve education of children because they will be able to do their homework with better lighting, and assisting production activities in the home and to improve living conditions for her family, Elsa is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras

loans.use: To purchase a solar energy system for her home

loans.name: Maria Bertha

texts.en:
Maria Bertha lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. She is a farmer (corn and vegetables), age 41 years who lives with her husband and four children. Her husband is a farmer too, and they work together. It is clear that Maria Bertha works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity.   

The family currently illuminates their home with kerosene lamps because the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area.  She mentioned that she hopes to improve living conditions for her family and assist production activities in the home. Maria Bertha is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras.

loans.use: To purchase a solar energy system for her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pest control, etc., to be able to continue farming.

loans.name: Vicente Rodriguez Santiago's Group

texts.en: Vicente and David live in a small community belonging to Tuxpan municipality, in Veracruz. They are all devoted fathers and economically dependent of temporal incomes as a result of their work in the field. Vicente has two kids that attend school at Fidel Herrera and he is positive that education is very important for their future and he wishes his children have better illumination to complete homework once the sun has set. He tell us that sometimes, his children can´t finish homework because of the lack of light (they only use candles now) and also he knows how this can affect their vision. He goes away all day long to attend his crops, arriving late at night every day. He wishes the family could spend more time together, extending the light hours so he can come back home and spend quality time with his children and wife.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will substitute the use of candles and firewood, in order to reduce expenses and improve the family economy

location.town: COL. FIDEL HERRERA BELTRAN, TUXPAN, Veracruz

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his own treatment

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 26-year-old married man from Deir El balah. He lives with his wife and one small daughter in a simple house. Mahdi opened a small factory for making different types of sweets. It is a good business and Mahdi has his loyal clients who love his products.
 
Mahdi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools for his sweets factory. By taking this loan, Mahdi will be able to improve his business and increase the productivity.
 
Mahdi appears in the photo while he was working

loans.use: to buy new tools for his sweets factory

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana de 40 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y su hijo, mantienen el hogar por medio de la venta de productos de canasta básica en una tienda ubicada en su casa y por medio del trabajo de su esposo, su casa está hecha de lamina pero su mayor preocupación es el techo de esta, dado que  se encuentra bastante deteriorado y en el invierno  es un verdadero problema para ellos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a  FUSAI  para invertir en la compra de lamina galvanizada, madera y polines para reparar el techo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Ana is 40 years old and lives with her partner and son. She maintains her home through selling basic food products in a store located in her house, and through her husband's work.

Her house is made of metal sheets, but her biggest worry is its ceiling. It's very deteriorated, and during the winter, it's a real problem for them. Because of this, she's seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of metal sheets, wood and mounting to repair the ceiling as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood and mounts to change the roof on her house.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar is 44 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia.

Dilbar has been busy with selling children's clothes for more than 18 years. Dilbar sells children's clothes in a local market. She sells seasonal clothes. Her daughter helps her with managing the business.

Dilbar is asking for a loan of 8,000 somoni to buy children’s clothes for the new summer season. This loan will help her to increase her working capital and maximize profits. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy children’s clothes for new summer season

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael padre de familia de 29 años de edad reside con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 2 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de pan con lo que mantiene el hogar. Su compañera de vida se encarga de la casa y el cuido del niño, su patio es de tierra y no tiene un recipiente para recolectar agua siendo esta tan vital en un hogar por lo que solicita el préstamo a FUSAI para encementar el patio y construir una pila para la recolección de agua. Con el monto solicitado comprará  grava, cemento, ladrillo y arena.
texts.en: Ismael, a father, is 29 years old and lives with his life partner and 2-year-old son. He works as a bread maker, and this helps to maintain the home. His life partner is in charge of the house and the care of their child. His patio is made of dirt and does not have a water-collection receptacle; this is something vital to the home. He asks for a loan from FUSAI in order to cover the patio with cement and to build a trough for water collection. With the amount requested, he will buy gravel, cement, bricks, and sand.

loans.use: to buy gravel, cement, bricks, and sand for the construction of a trough and to fill in the patio of the house.

loans.name: Safaraly

texts.en:
Safaraly was born in the year 1956. He is married and has 2 children. His wife is housewife. Safaraly lives with his family in a rural area.

Safaraly began his own business selling building instruments 2 years ago. Safaraly sells instruments in a local market. He develops his business little by little.

Safaraly is going to repair his living house because his living house is in bad condition. He is asking for a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy building materials for repairing his house. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing his house

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, por la necesidad en la que se vivía no pudo seguir estudiando. Su paraje se dedica a los oficios domésticos, es quien se encarga del cuidado de sus hijos pequeños y los quehaceres de la casa, tienen 2 hijos ambos estudian la niña de 13 años va a octavo y el niño a tercero. 

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene más de 25 años de dedicarse a la actividad productiva, su abuelo fue quien le enseño a valorar lo que es el trabajo, dándole como ejemplo la vida que él había tenido, donde solo trabajando y cuidando la familia podía vivir tranquilo, ya que su padre nunca se preocupó por ellos, por el tipo de actividad de la zona es que se dedican solamente a la agricultura, también tiene ganado de los que se ha hecho de una sola vaca. Manuel ha sido un hombre responsable, a criado a sus 2 hijos sin abandonarlos, el trabajo le queda a 5 km trabaja en una parcela de un cuñado, el recorrido lo hace a pie, su cuñado es el que más se involucra con él en los trabajos. El horario de trabajo es de las 5:30 am a 11 md.    

El préstamo será invertido en el mejoramiento de su vivienda, con lo que comprara teja y madera para lo que necesita hacer, la mejora que el préstamo hará es el poder tener en mejores condiciones su casa, ya que está en mal estado el techo.
  
Su objetivo es tener primero lo más necesario para la familia, que sus hijos logren lo que él no pudo lograr, que se preparen en el estudio, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is 36 years old, he studied until the ninth grade, but of necessity could not continue to study. His partner looks after the home, and takes care of their small children and the domestic tasks. They have two children who both study, a thirteen year old daughter in the eighth grade and a boy in the third.

Manuel earns his living from agriculture, he has worked in production for over 25 years. His grandfather taught him to value this work, showing him the example of the life he had lived, in which only by working and taking care of the family can one live contentedly, as his father was never concerned about them. As with the activity of the area he works only in agriculture, he also has cattle from which they have only obtained one cow.

Manuel has been a responsible man, he has brought up his two children without abandoning them. His land is 5km away, he works on a cousin’s plot of land. He walks to work, his cousin is who works with him most. The hours of work are from 5.30 am until 11.

The loan will be invested in the improvement of his house, he will buy tiles and wood for the work he needs to do. The best thing the loan will offer him is to improve the condition of his house, as the roof is in bad repair.

His aim is firstly to have the essential things for his family, that his children will attain what he was unable to achieve, that they study and can hope to always work, while God grants them health and life.

loans.use: to buy tiles and wood to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 35 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Mary Jane has restarted her fish vending business, and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Mary Jane has taken a 9,793 Philippine Pesos (PHP) housing loan through NWTF to buy materials to rebuild her family home, and to pay for construction labor.

Mary Jane is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: Marlene is 43 years old, married and the mother of four children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a food-vending business in the Philippines. Marlene has requested a PHP 6,000 loan from NWTF to buy more corn to sell. She has been in her current line of work for twenty years, and her goal for the future is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more corn to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, 37 and separated, rears her 16 year old son on her own. To sustain their daily needs and the education of her child, she has set up and manages her own store in their house.

In managing her business, she notes that her edge among competitors is her ability to sell food items that are needed by school aged children. In February 2014, Arlene availed a PhP 6,000 loan from SEED and ventured into selling quick-cooked snack items to include sandwiches and fries. The business went well and correspondingly Arlene was able to pay back her loan without any mispayments.

From this experience, Arlene said she tried studying other opportunities which would make her business earn more. She was able to identify the lack of stores selling scrap wood used for cooking and rice that would meet the demand of the neighborhood. Thus, with this new loan, she is planning to buy scrap wood, 3 sacks of rice and additional canned goods that would make her store more competitive. 

Arlene, dreams of growing her business more and becoming a wholesaler in their area. She also hopes that through this she will continuously support her son in going to school until college.

loans.use: To buy scrap wood used for cooking, rice, and canned goods for her store.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 28 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Moses has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells poultry feed. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more poultry feed to sell, and will help Moses to generate greater profits and to improve on the family’s standard of living. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business and become a big supplier in the whole town. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more poultry feed to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 49 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is widowed and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past two years, Grace has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells agro chemical items. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more agro chemicals for sale and will help Grace to generate greater profits and more income to improve her family's standard of living. Grace hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a bigger agro chemical shop. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more agro chemicals to sell

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin is a 28-year-old married man from Deir el Balah. He is a father of one little daughter. Yasin has a meat store that has been opened the past year. He sells fresh and frozen meat according to the demand. 

Yasin took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more meat for his store for Ramadan and Eid season. By taking this loan, Yasin will be able to increase his sales and improve the family living conditions.

Yasin appears in the photo in his meat store.

loans.use: to buy more meat for his store for Ramadan and Eid season

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 49 años de edad vive solo en casa de un familiar, el posee una tienda desde hace 21 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa,  Miguel solicita un crédito para invertir más en su negocio comprando sopas, granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, etc. para obtener mejores ingresos y asi poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Miguel is 49 years old and lives alone in a family member's house. For the past 21 years, he has owned a store located in the home; he has many clients, due to the variety of products that he carries. Miguel asks for a loan to invest more in his business by purchasing soups, basic grains, sweets, sodas, etc. to have better earnings and more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy soups, basic grains, sweets, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en:
Shahlo is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and 3 children in North Tajikistan in a house which is in bad condition. 2 years ago Shahlo began her own business selling women’s clothes and shoes. Shahlo develops her business little by little. She has a selling place in a local market.

Shahlo and her husband try to offer their children comfortable living conditions. Her husband is a hair dresser.

Shahlo is going to repair her house and in this way to make the family's living conditions better. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc., for repairing her house

loans.name: Ogtay

texts.en: Ogtay is 39 years old. He and his wife have been married for 13 years and have two children who are going to secondary school. Ogtay is living in the Abseron region with his family. He has been in a manufacturing business for 12 years. Ogtay has a shoe workshop, where he makes some types of shoes for men. He uses quality leather material in his work, and for that he has a lot of customers. Today Ogtay needs a loan in amount of 1,200 AZN for the repair his broken apparatus. He says he is thankful to Kiva organization for help and support.

loans.use: to pay for repair of his broken apparatus.

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru:
Рачабгул проживает в районе Восеъ города Куляб. Ей 57 лет. Она замужем. Рачабгул более 25 лет занимается животноводством. Раньше она разводила скот в родительском доме, а сейчас у себя дома. Вот уже четыре года как она занялась купле - продажей крупнорогатого скота. Она поняла, что это дело очень прибыльное и к тому же у нее есть опыт, которым нужно воспользоваться в деле. 
Рачабгул берет кредит для закупа несколько телят и бычка. Она будет очень рада вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Rajabgul lives in the city of Kulyab in the Vose region. She is 57 and married and has been working in animal husbandry for more than 25 years. She used to raise cattle at her parents' home and now does her work at her own home. She has been buying and selling cattle specifically for four years already, a business that is very profitable and in which she has the necessary experience. Rajabgul is taking out a loan to buy a few calves and steers. She will be very happy for your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposo, ella cuenta con experiencia en la actividad que desarrolla la es cultivo de maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que vende logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, Leonor solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para seguir con sus cultivos y tener junto con su esposo un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Leonor is 51 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She has experience in the development and cultivation of corn and sorghum. She sells her products around the area; with what she sells, she is able to maintain her home. Leonor asks for a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, anti-infestation solutions, herbicides, etc. and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph. She can continue with her crops and have, along with her husband, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, anti-infestation solutions, herbicides, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 49 years old, married and had three children. She is a retail store owner and gets income from selling grocery items. Her income goes for meals, bills at home and for revolving capital in the business.

She wanted to buy more stock of groceries, so that is why she is now asking for an additional loan of 10,000 PHP to buy sardines, biscuits, sugar, soap and shampoo to sell. It will help improve sales and income as well. Someday, with good funds, she will continue to provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy sardines, biscuits, sugar, soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Monica has been working hard to manage her veterinary drug shop, which sells animal drugs. 

To help expand her business, Monica has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more veterinary drugs and more items that are used in the business to sell, and will help Monica to generate greater profits and improve the family's welfare. Monica hopes that in the future, she will be able to have a better and healthier family. 

Monica is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Monica who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to purchase more veterinary drugs and other items used in the business

loans.name: Yair Elias

texts.es:
Yair es un joven emprendedor, tiene 22 años de edad, vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Tiene un pequeño hijo quien es su mayor motivación para salir adelante y por quien se esfuerza al máximo para poder brindarle un futuro mejor.
Desde hace varios años trabaja en una empresa de ferretería y le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajador, siempre laborando con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación porque quiere darle lo mejor a su hijo.
Yair está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprarse una moto para poder trasladarse de su casa a su trabajo. De esta manera podrá salir adelante y seguir luchando por su familia.
texts.en:
Yair is a young entrepreneur. He is 22 years old and lives in Ica with his family.

He has a young son who is his greatest motivation for getting ahead and for whom he exerts himself to the maximum to be able to offer him a better future.

For a number of years he has worked in a hardware business, and it is going very well for him because he is very responsible and hard-working, always working with great effort and dedication because he wants to give the best to his son.

Yair is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have offered him, he will be able to buy himself a motorcycle to be able to go from his house to his work. In this way he will be able to advance and continue working for his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for personal use.

loans.name: Zipporah
