texts.en: Zipporah is 25 years old, married, and blessed with one child. She earns a living operating a retail store where she sells assorted household goods. She has been in this business for two years, and earns a monthly income of Kshs. 10,000. This is Zipporah's first loan from VisionFund Kenya, and she will use it to buy more items to sell such as sugar, salt, detergent, and cooking oil. She plans to use her profits to expand her business further and educate her child.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, detergent, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Ma. Jose

texts.en:
Ma. Jose is a married woman, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Jose is 46 years old and all of her children are in school.

Ma. Jose has a motorcycle repair business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy additional equipment for her shop.

Ma. Jose has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase baby blankets and baby towels for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear for her business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a 27-year-old Ugandan widow who is the mother of three children. She earns a living as a farmer who grows maize alongside other crops on a small scale. She supplements her income by processing sugar cane for nearby farmers. She has applied for a loan for Ugx. 1,000,000 to buy a motor for her cane-processing machine, and plans to pay back the loan with the additional profits she earns. Her plans for the future are to educate all her children and acquire more land. Her major challenges are changing weather and a poor road network

loans.use: to buy an motor for a sugar cane-processing machine.

loans.name: Maria Belen Elizabeth

texts.en:
Maria Belen has finished building the room for the boys and finished her kitchen. She is now requesting a loan to install proper windows and doors to the new bedroom. The boys, young Juan Pablo who appears in the photo and Manuel a fast growing teenager, sleep and play in their new room but due to the lack of door and windows, they use a bed sheet to have privacy and shelter from the rain.
This credit will help Maria Belen fulfill her longtime dream and finally complete her house with all the necessary installations to give to her family a proper shelter and a home that reflects the love she feels for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building a room for her kids

loans.name: Denia Marilin

texts.es:
Denia de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta básica en la escuela de su comunidad, luego sus estudios de bachillerato en el pueblo, se fue a la universidad, estudio tres años licenciatura en inglés, por falta de recursos económicos no pudo continuar ya que la fuente de ingreso principal desmejoro, lo que la obligo a abandonar su sueño. Su pareja es técnico en reparación de computadoras, teléfonos y maneja un cyber café desde ya desde varios años, hijos no tiene.

Como fuente de ingreso principal ella maneja un servicio de transferencia de dinero, también vende bebida enlatada y golosinas, tiene dos años de vender en el mismo local donde está el cyber de su pareja, siempre le gusto el comercio por lo que decidió poner un puesto de servicio aprovechando la clientela que tiene su pareja, no tiene más actividades a las que se dedique, antes se dedicaba a vender en un cafetín de una escuela en el pueblo. No recorre ninguna distancia,  ya que el negocio lo tiene en la casa de habitación, el horario de atención es de las 9 am a 7 pm.

El crédito será invertido en la compra de productos para la venta, entre ellos están; sodas, golosinas,  etc. La mejora que el préstamo es el poder iniciar un negocio que a futuro le puede traer muy buenos ingresos, la necesidad satisfecha será el poder tener capital de trabajo para continuar  su sueño de tener un buen negocio.

Sus sueños a futuro son poder tener un buen negocio, y con esto generar ingresos al hogar, también prepararse económicamente para cuando decidan tener sus hijos.
texts.en: Denia is 24 years old.  She completed primary school in her community, and later went to high school in town.  She attended university and completed three years of an English degree, but then was unable to continue when her source of income was lost, forcing her to abandon her dream.  Her partner is a technician who repairs computers and phones, and has operated a cyber café for several years.  They have no children. She now earns her primary income from a money transfer business, and also sells canned drinks and candy.  She has been selling in the same location for two years, which is the same place as her partner's cyber café.  She has always liked sales work, so she decided to open a store, taking advantage of her partner's existing customers.  She has no other jobs.  She used to work selling in a school cafeteria in her town.  She does not travel to work, because her business is in her home.  She works from 9 a.m. until 7 p.m.  The loan will be used to buy products to sell, including soft drinks, candy, etc.  The loan will help her by allowing her to start a business that will produce good income in the future, by meeting her need for working capital, in order to continue with her dream of having a good business. Her dream for the future is to have a good business and to use it to earn income for her household.  She would also like to prepare herself financially for when she decides to have children.

loans.use: to  buy soft drinks, candy, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel de 34 años de edad, trabaja en una panadería desde hace 5 años, esta acompañado y habita con su compañera de vida y con un hijo de un año. Manuel necesita construir un lavadero con pila, para almacenar agua, su compañera de vida lo apoya con la venta de antojitos típicos en su cantón y  de esta forma mantienen la economía del hogar. Manuel está solicitando un préstamo a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, grava y ladrillo y así solventar su necesidad de tener donde recoger agua para sus necesidades básicas.
texts.en: Manuel is 34 years old and has worked in a bakery for 5 years.  He lives with his life partner and their one-year-old child.  Manuel needs to build a wash house with a water storage tank, in order to store water.  His partner helps him sell traditional snacks in their district, in order to support their household.  Manuel is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, and bricks.  This will allow him to have a way of storing water for his basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, bricks, and sand, to build a wash house and a water storage tank.

loans.name: Rayzen

texts.en: Rayzen is an 18-year-old student in one of the universities in Ozamiz City. She lives in Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her parents. Her father is a farmer and her mother works for a private company. Rayzen is very dedicated to her studies, and gets lots of support from her parents, of course. She has used previous loans to pay her school fees and is requesting a new loan to pay her tuition fees for this semester. She hopes to finish her studies and find a job in the near future.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for this semester.

loans.name: Elisa Madai

texts.es: Elisa está solicitando este préstamo para construir un lavadero, una pila y un cuarto para la cocina. Ella y su compañero de vida han procreado tres hijos: una niña de 5 años y 2 niños uno de 8 y uno de 6 años  de edad. Para ella y esposo es importante tener donde almacenar agua, pues por ahora solo cuentan con unos barriles como se aprecia en la fotografía, al igual que el cuarto de la cocina que requiere construir. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan dulce para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, es por ello que solicita un préstamo a FUSAI para la compra de cemento, arena, lamina, madera y ladrillo.
texts.en: Eliza is applying for this loan to construct a washroom, a trough, and a room for cooking. She and her life companion have three children, a daughter, age 5, and two sons, one who is 8 and one who is 6. For her and her husband, it is important to have a place to store water, since they now have only the barrels that appear in the photograph, as well as the room for the kitchen, which needs construction. She makes and sells sweet bread to help her husband with the household expenses. It is for these reasons that she is applying to FUSAI for a loan, to purchase cement, sand, metal sheets, wood, and brick.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, metal sheeting, wood, and bricks to construct a washroom with a trough and a room for cooking.

loans.name: Vasila

texts.en: Vasila is married. She is 40 years old, single and living with her parents and brother’s family. Vasila loves her nephew and niece so much and in the near future, she wants to get married and have children. Vasila is an IDP-Internally Displaced Person from Gubadli city and now lives in Abseron region with her lovely and large family. She has a greenhouse where she grows tomatoes. Vasila has been in this business for six years. Today she needs 2,100 Azerbaijan new manat to fertilize her plants. She says great thanks to the Kiva organization for support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and paint to renovate his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear for her business.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es: Benito de 60 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años al cultivo de maíz, con lo que obtiene de las ventas que realiza en los diferentes mercados logra cubrir gran parte de los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, Don Benito esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder seguir con sus siembras y así tener junto con su compañera de vida una mejor estabilidad económica sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Benito is 60 years old and for several years he has worked to grow corn; from what he earns from his sales in different markets, he is able to cover the majority of his housing costs. His lives in his own house with his life partner. Don Benito is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, mulch, anti-infestation solutions, etc. and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph. He will be able to continue with his plantings and he and his partner, therefore, will have better economic stability without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, mulch, anti-infestation solutions, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 46-year-old woman. She is married to Antonius, a 50-year-old man who is working at a private company. They are blessed with four children namely Beatriks, 22, a college student; Damianus, 20, a college student,  year 2; Benediktus, 9, in the 4th grade of elementary school and Graciana, 7, in the 2nd grade of elementary school. Maria is a hardworking woman. She has been running a kiosk business for years to support her family's income. She sells daily basis needs such as cooking oil, sugar, instant noodles, coffee, shampoo, soap, etc. Currently, she needs to add more stock but unfortunately, she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, she has applied for an individual loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on more stock for her kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her kiosk.

loans.name: Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 60 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos y reside en una comunidad que pertenece al municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Toda su vida ha trabajado la agricultura junto a su esposo y familia. Ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva café, maíz y hortalizas como es el rábano, repollo, chile, zanahoria y otros. Produce desde hace más de 15 años y la vende en el mercado local de la zona. Ha solicitado 7,000 lempiras en forma grupal para comprar fertilizantes, insumos e insecticidas para darle asistencia al cultivo de café y hortalizas. Su plan es tecnificar sus cultivos para obtener ingresos y que su familia tenga buena educación. El grupo se llama Buena Vista, integrado por 6 miembros, que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura de granos básicos y hortalizas. El préstamo grupal es por 30,000 lempiras para brindar asistencia a sus cultivos. En la foto esta Cristóbal a la izquierda, sigue Martin, José, Carlos, José santos y doña María.
texts.en:
Doña María is sixty years old, married and has three children. She lives in a community that belongs to the municipality of San Pedro Sula, Cortes, Nicaragua. She has worked all her life in agriculture, along with her husband and family. She has some land where she grows coffee, corn and vegetables, such as radishes, cabbage, chili, carrots and others. She has been farming for more than 15 years and she sells her produce in the local market of the area. She has requested a loan of 7000 lempiras as part of a group to buy fertilizers, insecticides and other products to help with the growing of coffee and vegetables. Her plan is to modernize her farming in order to obtain income so that her family can have a good education. 

The group is called Buena Vista, made up of six members who live in the same community and make their living in raising basic grains and vegetables. The group loan of 30,000 lempiras will give them help with their crops. In the photo are Cristobal (at the left), followed by Martin, Jose, Carlos, Jose Santos and doña María.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and other farming products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his farming to dairy cattle

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. She is a farmer (corn and vegetables), age 33 years who lives with her three children, her husband is a constructor. It is clear that Natividad works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity.  Her children walk daily over 30 minutes to go to school and after school they help with home activities.      

The family currently illuminates their home with kerosene lamps because the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area.  She mentioned that she hopes this solar energy system will improve education of her children because they will be able to do their homework with better lighting, and improve living conditions for her family. Natividad is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras.

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system for his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system for his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his dairy farm business to more than one cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for biodigesters for resale

loans.name: Santos

texts.en:
Santos lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is a farmer (poptatoes), age 22 years who lives and takes care of his mother. It is clear that Santos works hard to maintain his mom and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity.
They currently illuminate their home with kerosene lamps because the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area. It also puts in risk his mom’s health because the kerosene lamps are turned on with a match and present a big risk of a fire.  He mentioned that with this solar energy system, he hopes improve his farm because this will help him wake up and start working earlier. Santos is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras.

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system for his home

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.en:
Gilberto is a 32- year-old man and he is married to Reina Regina, a friendly lady of 28 years old. Their boys are Irvine (10) and Neftali (5). They live Oaxaca, Mexico.

Gilberto and family arrived to their community eight years ago looking for a better future. He works in the painting area of a company that repairs vehicles; representing the only economic support of the family.

Living in a small house like this is not comfortable for Gilberto and Regina. Besides the overcrowding conditions, the family solves those problems that come when the rainy season and winter arrive: leaks, wind and cold. Unfortunately the roof and the structure of the house are in bad conditions.

Gilberto wants a new house to provide his family a better quality of life and to finally have a place for everything and everything in its place. His dream is to have all he needs to achieve this goal and he invites more families in need to join the program of Habitat for Humanity Mexico.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a house.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 27- year-old housewife and her husband Rogelio is 28 years old. They are parents of a 5-year old boy named Carlos Daniel. They share their home with Julieta´s father and brother, Adan and Teófilo respectively. 
The family lives in a very small house made of metal sheets in Oaxaca, Mexico. In the municipality they live and according to government information sources, 227 houses (representing 14.3% of the total houses) have just one room and 226 houses (representing 16.8% of the total houses) have dirt floor.
Rogelio works in a grocery store as a driver, Adan is 69 years old and he sells popsicles and ice-creams in the city. Julieta prepares and sells “tortas” (a kind of Mexican sandwiches) outside a local school in order to have extra incomes. 

Teófilo is 22 years old and works in the city doing different activities related to graphic design.

Due the bad conditions of the house (leaky roof, one bedroom shared among all, extreme cold when its winter and extreme heat when it´s summer, one bathroom located outside the house), Julieta´s dream is to own a better house where they can live happier and peaceful. In the end, owning a new house means the Carlos Daniel´s legacy.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a house.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida Honduras. He is a farmer (corn and beans), and animal husbandry, age 67 years who lives with his wife and two children.  It is clear that Marcelino works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity

The family currently illuminates their home with kerosene lamps because the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area.  He mentioned that with the solar energy system they can improve education of children because they will be able to do their homework with better lighting, assist production activities in the home and improve living conditions for his family. Benito is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras.

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system for his home

loans.name: Leda

texts.en: Leda is 52 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like noodles, soft drinks and other groceries. Leda has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years, and also earns an income from a cafeteria. Leda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like noodles, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more items like sugar, noodles, shampoo and other groceries for her general store business.

Nancy successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Nancy's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like sugar, noodles, shampoo and other groceries.

loans.name: Elica Paula

texts.en:
Elica has finished building the new room and bathroom for her family. Now, she is asking for a credit to install proper floor in these new rooms as well as materials to install a proper cement ceiling to replace the unsafe piece of tin that covers the old part of the house.
Elica is thrilled to have this opportunity of requesting a new loan and finish what she calls a lifetime dream.

loans.use: to install floor in the new built rooms and proper celling

loans.name: Deus

texts.en: Deus is a 40-year-old Ugandan resident of Kyarushesha. He is married to Allen and they have four children. Deus is a farmer who grows crops like maize and bananas, and he has been doing this since 2009 as his major source of income. He has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX for hiring labor to carry out pruning on his banana plantation. His plan for the future is to acquire more land for farming. However, he faces challenges of bad weather. He describes himself as a hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: to hire labor for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha has successfully paid the credit she used to finish building her dream home. She is now asking for a credit to buy the materials needed to install windows, doors and a cement floor on the rest of the house. She has invested not only time but a lot of effort and hard work in her dream home. This last credit and effort will give her the opportunity to complete what she has been dreaming ever since she laid the first rock of the foundation.

Martha is excited to give her children a great example of determination and perseverance. She knows that example is the best parenting method and being able to show her kids that single mothers can fulfill their dreams is a lifetime achievement.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building her house

loans.name: Ciro

texts.en:
With the past credit, Ciro was able to add a bathroom and living room to his home. These additions gave him and his extended family a healthy day of living and more space to gather. More importantly these additions gave them a more suitable home that reflects the love he feels for his wife, children and grandchildren. Ciro is thankful for the opportunity of a new credit because now he is looking to add windows and doors to the house so his grandchildren can have a more safe place to live in, but also replace the current tin and asbestos roof with a proper cement roof. Ciro is eager to make these changes because he knows that these additions will help improve and safeguard the health of his family. 

Ciro looks forward to completing his house and feels great appreciation for this opportunity. He has no other way of financing the materials he needs since no bank or institution will give him credit because of his informal job.

loans.use: to pay for materials to replace the roof and install windows and doors

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina has finished paying for a credit that allowed her to build a complete bathroom and a cement roof to her house. Josefina is asking for another credit to replace the roof for a cement roof in the rest of the house and finish the walls of two rooms. With this new credit Josefina will be able to finish her house to which she has invested effort, work time and all her savings. This new roof will give her a proper shelter and finishing the walls will help keep the house warm during winters and cold during those hot summer days. 
Josefina is thankful for this opportunity and recognizes that with these credits, she will finish her house in a fraction of the time that it would take her without this help.

loans.use: to add cement roof to the house and finish walls

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor and his family live in Oaxaca, Mexico. He is a 29- year-old maintenance worker and in his free time does carpentry. His wife of 28 years old is Antonieta; she does different activities in order to have extra incomes: is a domestic worker and when she finishes her turn, sells corncobs prepared with mayonnaise, cheese and chili.  

Due to their weak economic situation they haven’t had the opportunity to own a better house. Since they arrived to the community (8 years ago) they built this house. Time and weather conditions have caused housing deterioration making their home uncomfortable and unhealthy to live in. Their children Nestor (6 years old) and Emmanuel (3 years old) love to go to school and want to have a room to do their homework. Unfortunately they get sick because the house is not a good shelter.

Nestor wants an adequate house to live with his family in a healthy and clean environment and he wants to achieve this goal. 
Besides the dream of having a new home, Nestor wants to buy tools and in the future establish a carpentry workshop.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Tranquilino

texts.en:
Tranquilino is a 30- year-old family man and his 28-year-old wife is Eva. Their kids are: Miguel (11), Evelyn (10), Pablo (4) and a 3-month-old baby girl. They live in the central valley of Oaxaca, Mexico. 
Tranquilino works in a surveying company and Eva is a housewife. She takes care of the baby girl while the kids go to school; she loves to cook and clean the house.

For Tranquilino and Eva, living in a small house made of metal sheet is desperate because they have to share the only room with the kids and this room is the bedroom and the kitchen. Tranquilino wants a house made of bricks to have more comfort and the most important thing: a safe house in which his family can live happy and the kids enjoy their own rooms. 

“We are parents and as good parents we are looking to protect our children, we want to provide them a house and help them in all the possible ways. Our dream is to leave them a legacy, not only a house but values; we want to encourage them to be better citizens. My family hopes to make our dream come true”.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABALI ont en moyenne  39ans, 4enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO II l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SABALI sont à leur 8ème  prêt solidaire.FATOUMATA,1ère femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter1 carton de biscuits, 10 paires de chaussures,10 poupées et 10 jouets d’enfant. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The Sabali group is composed of women averaging 39 years of age, with four children. They all live in traditional extended families in  Santoro II, a district of San, Segou (the fourth administrative region of Mali).
They know each other as relatives and work buying and reselling miscellaneous items.

After having duly repaid their prior loans, the group members are on their eighth solidarity loan. Fatoumata, the first one from left to right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy one box of cookies, 10 pairs of shoes, 10 dolls and 10 toys. She stocks up locally from wholesalers. She sells to a mixed clientele, for cash, and often on credit. She plans to earn an average monthly income of 10,000 West African francs, which will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and school fees, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items [for resale].

loans.name: Kimyojon

texts.en: Kimyojon is a widow. She is a hardworking and kind woman who is bringing up five children. Kimyojon has been busy selling food items in a food shop for more than 13 years. She sells all kind of food items such as bread, rolls, candies, meat, sausages, fruits, and vegetables. Her son helps her with managing the business. Kimyojon tries to offer fresh, high quality items to her customers.  She is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy food items. She is going to increase working capital and maximize profit. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy food items for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks and flagstones to renovate his house from the inside.

loans.name: Anorkhon

texts.en:
Anorkhon was born in the year 1950. She is a kind woman and the responsible mother of 4 children. Her husband is a pensioner.

14 years ago Anorkhon began her own pharmacy business because she needed the money. Anorkhon has a medical education. She sells a variety of medicines. Anorkhon’s son helps her with managing the business. Her pharmacy is located in a local hospital.

Anorkhon is going to buy a locker and fridge for her pharmacy, so she is asking for a loan of 7,000 somoni to buy a fridge and locker. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fridge and locker for her pharmacy

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 51-year-old Ugandan, married to Juliet, and they have four children ages 21, 18, 14 and 10. They are residents in a remote area. He is a farmer who grows crops like maize on a large scale, but he is also a teacher at a secondary school. Charles has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to pay for labor to harvest his maize, and also to weed his banana plantation. His plan for the future is to educate all his children; he however, faces challenges of bad weather in his activities.

loans.use: to hire laborers to harvest his maize and to weed his plantation.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en:
Rachelle is 44 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rachelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.  She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and school supplies. 

In the future Rachelle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ang

texts.en:
Ang, 42 years old, lives in a rural area of Rokhak Kiri District, Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has seven children in total and two among them are married.

To make a living, Ang and her husband are working so hard on their small farm land. They grow rice and sell the product to the local dealer. Until now, it is almost 25 years that she has been involved in this career.

Ang would like to get a loan from HKL, the first loan for her, to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Ang thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar es un joven emprendedor, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero, y vive en San Vicente junto a su familia.
Desde hace algún tiempo trabaja en el Hospital como personal de servicio y mantenimiento. Le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
Cesar está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar algunos materiales para iniciar con sus clases de baile que dirige, de esta manera obtendrá ingresos adicionales que podrá ahorrar y más adelante cumplir su gran sueño: "Abrir un restaurante".
texts.en:
Cesar is an enterprising young man who is 23 years old. He is single and lives in San Vicente together with his family.

For some time, he has worked in a hospital as a service and maintenance staff member. It is going very well for him, because he is a very responsible person, and he has a strong desire to get ahead in life. 

Cesar is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support provided to him, he will be able to buy some materials to start the dance classes he is teaching. In this way, he will obtain additional income which he will be able to save up, so that later he can achieve his greatest dream: "Opening a restaurant."

loans.use: to buy materials to teach dance classes.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her food vending business and is now requesting a 9,800 PHP housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Rosie will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 36-year-old male Ugandan married to Scovia, with whom he has 4 children aged between 4 and 14.

His main source of income is farming, where he grows crops like maize and other crops like beans. He is also a cattle keeper. He has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy agricultural produce since the season is now on. He hopes to pay after making profits.

His hopes for the future are he wants to acquire more land for grazing so that he can supplement his income, and to build a good residential house. However, he faces challenges of bad weather and a poor road network. He is determined to move out of poverty in the very near future if he keeps getting a financial boost in form of loans.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans

loans.name: Linda Vanda

texts.en:
Linda is a 42-year-old married woman with two children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Linda needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler, a large display fridge, a small chest freezer and soft drinks. 

She plans to use her profits to expand her business and help with her family’s weekly expenses. Linda has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler, a large display fridge, a small chest freezer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sayohatjon

texts.en: Sayohatjon is a young and hardworking woman. She is 22 years old. She is married and is bringing up two children. Her children are little. Sayohatjon’s husband is a master of repairing houses. She is an entrepreneur. She has been busy selling men’s underwear for more than four years. She sells her goods in a local market. Sayohatjon was helping her mother at first. Then she began her own business deal. Now, her mother helps her managing the business. Sayohatjon is going to increase her working capital and in this way develop her business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy men’s underwear. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy men’s underwear

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 28 years old, married and has five children. In order to sustain her family's needs, she sells fish for income. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy more fish (milk fish, catfish) to sell. It will help maintain good sales, and she will gain a good income from it. 

She hopes to save funds for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 30 years old and is married to Danis, who is a business man and supports his family with additional income. They are blessed with two school going children who are four years and two years old.

She has been selling both new and used clothes for the past five years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She has applied for a loan of KES 15,000 to buy more stock of new clothes to sell to her customers.

Lilian will use the anticipated income to provide for the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Yosef

texts.en:
Yosef is a 40-year-old man and is married to Johana, a 36-year-old woman. From their marriage, they are blessed with three children, namely Stefanus, 17, in the third grade of senior high school; Leonard, 11, in the first grade of junior high school and Bernadus, 10, in the sixth grade of primary school.

Yosef has a business welding specialized steel and iron. He has been running his welding business since 1997.

Currently, he is working on a new store building project. He employs five laborers in this project. However, he has to pay his laborers' wages every two weeks while the owner of the building is late to pay him. Therefore, he then applied for an individual loan of IDR 6,000,000 at TLM to assist him in paying the wages.

loans.use: to pay his laborers' wages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy other computers for his store in order to resell to his customers.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 33 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Vivian and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Vivian is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Vivian has been a NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her agriculture business.

With your help, Vivian can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her food vending business and is now requesting a PHP 9,950 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Rhodora will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Rhodora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is widowed and has three children, with one of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Madina has been working hard to manage her grocery shop, which sells rice, millet flour and charcoal stoves.

To help expand her business, Madina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more items such as rice, millet flour, fruits, vegetables, and charcoal stoves to sell, and will help her to generate greater profits and improve on her family's standard of living. Madina hopes that in the future she will be able to have a brighter future.

Madina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Madina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more items such as rice, millet flour, fruits, vegetables, and charcoal stoves to sell

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo con 34 años de edad  desea invertir en la conexión del servicio de energía eléctrica dado que hasta la facha no cuenta con dicho servicio. Él  habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 20 años de edad y su hijo de 18 años de edad. Pablo  es jornalero y de esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación de la energía eléctrica y así dar mejores condiciones de desarrollo a su familia.
texts.en: Pablo is 34 years old. He hopes to invest in connecting electrical service since he does not currently have this service. Pablo lives in his own house with his life partner, their 20 year old daughter, and their 18 year old son. Pablo is a laborer, and in this way he supports his home. With the hope of improving his living conditions, Pablo is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in installing electricity, and in that way, to be able to give his family improved living conditions.

loans.use: to install electricity.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 33 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Janice is borrowing 19,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Janice has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mona Sana'a Group

texts.en:
Mona Sana'a is a group which comprises four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Mona is the leader of the group. She is a 31-year-old married woman. She is an educated woman with an elementary education. She works as a housewife, and she has a lot of work inside her house. Mona's house lacks many home appliances, and she can't afford them. Inside the kitchen of her house, her oven is very old and she needs a new one in order to make good breads, cakes, and other delicious food. Unfortunately, she doesn't have a new oven in order to prepare that delicious bread. This most negatively affects drinks and food. For this reason, Mona is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new oven to prepare delicious breads and cakes.

Mona looks forward to furnishing all her house with new and stylish furniture.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven to prepare delicious breads and cakes.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 49 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is in school.

Melanie and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Melanie is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,757 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Melanie has been a NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Melanie can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is 52 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Angel's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Angel has restarted her food vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Angel has taken a PHP 9,565 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Angel is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ama Akofa

texts.fr:
Akofa vit à Cassablanca et a 56 ans. Elle tient depuis  2004 un commerce des produits alimentaires dans son quartier. 
Elle s'approvisionne 2 fois par mois au marché de Lomé et a un transporteur afin d'éviter le vol de marchandise.
Akofa souhaite renforcer son activité en augmentant son stock par l’achat de 5 cartons de lait PEAK, 6 cartons de pâte alimentaire et 4  bidons d’huile végétale.
texts.en:
Akofa is 56 years old and lives in Cassablanca. Since 2004, she has been running a food business in her neighbourhood. 

Akofa buys her supplies twice a month at a Lomé market and has a transporter to ensure her goods do not get stolen.

Akofa wants to strengthen her business by increasing her stock. She plans to buy five boxes of Peak milk, six boxes of pasta and four cans of oil.

loans.use: to buy five boxes of Peak milk, six boxes of pasta and four cans of oil.

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Yeredon  est composé de 6 femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce du bois de chauffage, des habits, des produits cosmétiques et du savon. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ami  (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du bois de chauffage. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 chargement du bois de chauffage en gros dans les villages environnant de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Lafiabougou à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Ami  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Yeredon is composed of six married women for the most part in monogamous households. The women average 42 years old and five children each, all living in Kanadjiguila, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through community ties. The group members have small-scale businesses involving firewood, clothing, cosmetic products, and soap.

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Ami (standing at the far left in the photo) is famous for selling firewood. She intends to use her loan to purchase a load of firewood wholesale from the villages surrounding Bamako. Her sales are made at the retail level to mostly women customers in Lafiabougou.

With this loan, Ms. Ami hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business. Her goal is to purchase a plot of residential land through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase firewood

loans.name: Jantoyerela  E Group

texts.fr:
Les 3 membres du groupe JANTOYERELA  E sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à NIANTANSO un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur huitième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec monsieur ABOU débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme JANTOYERELA  E. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter 8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 15 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente , payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’une part de payer son prêt et son interêt d’autre part de contribuer dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The three members of the Jantoyerela E group are married men who on average are 35 years old with four children, mostly living in traditional families in Niantanso, a village in the circle of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eighth maize-growing loan cycle with the institution, and all previous loans have been fully repaid.

The selected crop is maize featuring Mr. Abou, standing in the middle in the photo of this Jantoyerela E group of men. He intends to use the loan to buy eight 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, 15 cans of different kinds of herbicide, and pay for tilling to maintain two hectares (about 5 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit. He expects to achieve an average profit of 145,000 CFA francs per growing season.

This profit will enable him to pay off part of the loan and interest, and on the other hand help with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide,and pay for tilling

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkan est  majoritairement  composé de femmes  polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 31ans et 2enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Minkoungo l’un des quartiers de Bamako  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, vêtements, ustensiles et  produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bintou, 1ère debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo, a une grande réputation dans la vente des draps et rideaux. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  10 draps et 10 rideaux en gros au grand  marché de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au marché de Minkoungo à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Bintou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 65 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, elle a pour objectif de pérenniser son activité dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Benkan group is comprised primarily of polygamous women. On average, they are 31 years old and have two children. They all live in Minkoungo, an area of Bamako. They know one another through neighbors. 

The group members sell clothing, utensils, and cosmetic products. With the goal of growing their business, they decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their second group loan. 

Madame Bintou, first on the left from left to right, is well known for her sheet and curtain sales. She will use her loan to buy 10 sheets and 10 curtains for wholesale prices in the Bamako market. She will resell these for retail prices in the Minkoungo market to a clientele comprised mainly of women. 

With this loan, Madame Bintou hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 65,000 FCFA that she'll use to reinvest in her business. Like the other group members, she would like to strengthen her business through her relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: buy sheets and curtains.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les huit (08) membres du groupe Danaya ont en moyenne 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Lafiabougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, du sable, du jus, de savons et de produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ami (femme assise en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habits (pagnes wax). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 40 pièces de pagnes wax en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à Lafiabougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Ami compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Most of them married in monogamous marriages, the eight members of the group Danaya average 38 years of age and three children each, all living in Lafiabougou, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses at the Lafiabougou market. The group members have small-scale businesses involving clothing, sand, juice drinks, soaps, and cosmetic products. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Ami (sitting second from the right in the photo) is a major vendor of clothing of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She intends to use her loan to purchase 40 lengths of Wax ‘pagne’ cloth wholesale at the big market. In Lafiabougou and by hawking, her sales are made at the retail level to mostly women customers.

With this loan, Ms. Ami hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and for meeting sundry needs at home.

loans.use: to purchase Wax 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Badeyakadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe BADEYAKADI 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à SANIENA un village dans la commune de FINKOLO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame DJENEBA assise à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BADEYAKADI 6. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the Badeyakadi 6 group are married women. On average, they are 34 years old and have three children. Most of them live in traditional families in Saniena, a village in the town of Finkolo, Sikasso Cercle, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see their farming activities through the rainy season. This is their eighth farming loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Their previous loans have been repaid. 

They grow peanuts with Madame Djeneba, who is seated at left in this photo of  Badeyakadi 6. With her loan, she will pay for two 50 kg bags of fertilizer, two containers of herbicide, and plowing to maintain one hectare of land. 

After the harvest, she sells her crops in Sikasso for cash and credit to a clientele of men and women. She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 160,000 FCFA per season. These profits will allow her to pay her loan and interest, and to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing.

loans.name: Karen Maribel

texts.es:
Karen es una joven emprendedora, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Subtanjalla junto a su familia.
Estudió la carrera profesional de Farmacia y desde hace más de 2 años ejerce su profesión en una cadena de Boticas, le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta, respetuosa y amable con los clientes.
Karen está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá remodelar su vivienda como comprar calaminas y clavos para fabricar el techo de su vivienda ya que no cuenta con un techo. Así su familia sentirá mayor comodidad viviendo en una casa mucho más segura y ella seguirá esforzándose para crecer profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Karen is a young entrepreneur, she is 21 years old, single and lives in Subtanjalla alongside her family. She majored in pharmaceutics and it has been more than 2 years since she has been practicing her profession in a drugstore chain. She is doing very well because she is very responsible, hardworking, honest, respectful, and kind to the customers. 

Karen is thankful to the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have given her, she will be able to remodel her home and purchase metal roofing and nails to make a roof for her home because it does not have one. That way, her family will have greater comfort living in a home that is more secure, and she will keep making an effort to grow professionally.

loans.use: Remodel her home (to purchase metal roofing and nails)

loans.name: Floduard

texts.en:
Floduard is 30 years old. This loan will help in the construction of the warehouse for their maize that is waiting to be sold. This construction will help the entire farmers to have a secure store for their produce in the future. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing which is significantly increasing their yield or production, during the post-harvest processes are more suffering poorness as they have to wait the buyer to pay them.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of the warehouse for maize produce

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nenita is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Nenita's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fishing business and is committed to regain what Nenita lost. Nenita is taking out a PHP 9,714.20 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Nenita has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 58 years old and single without any dependents. Gladys works hard selling groceries and firewood. She sells at an open space at her residence in Teshie.

Gladys requested a loan of GHS 1800 through ID Ghana to purchase more groceries and firewood to sell to customers. Gladys has borrowed and repaid five loans from ID Ghana before this loan. She successfully paid back her previous loans, and has now requested an additional loan to further build her business. 

Gladys aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and firewood to sell to customers.

loans.name: Djija Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djija est composé de 8 femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygames.  Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djelibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (friperies), de savons et de légumes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Biba (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (friperies). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 balles de friperies en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Djelibougou et à une clientèle mixte. Madame Biba espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Djija group is composed of eight women, the majority of whom are in polygamous marriages. They are, on average, 35 years old and have an average of four children each. They all live in Djelibougou, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and know each other through their neighborhood ties. The group members sell second-hand clothing, soap, and vegetables. To increase their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan. 

Biba (the woman seated on the far right of the photo) has a great reputation in the clothing-sales business. She will use her loan to buy three bales of used clothing wholesale in Médine. She will resell the clothing retail in Djelibougou to a mixed clientele. With this loan, Biba hopes to earn an average monthly income of 90,000 FCFA, which she will reinvest in her business. With this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, her goal is to buy a lot for residential use.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 22 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace varios años al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda a su familia en los gastos del hogar, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, veneno, abono, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y así obtener mejores ingresos para seguir ayudando a su familia sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client is 22 years of age and lives in her own house with her family group. She has been dedicated for various years to cultivating corn and sorghum. She sells these products in the different markets that one encounters near her place of residence. From selling these harvested crops, she obtains the income to cover family and household expenses.

The client is soliciting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, manure, etc., and to pay for improving the land shown in the photograph and, thus, obtaining better income in order to continue helping her family without any limits whatsoever.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, manure, etc., and to invest in improving the land.

loans.name: Jeunes Eglise De Fissel Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit appelé « Jeunes Église de Fissel » rassemble des jeunes catholiques qui appartiennent à la même paroisse. Leurs objectifs étant de vivre leur foi en tant que jeunes tout en essayant de faire quelque chose dans leur vie. 
Leur président,à gauche de la photo, s’active dans l’embouche bovine et le commerce, il a une expérience de 5 ans dans ce domaine. Il est célibataire et vit encore chez ses parents. Il participe néanmoins à la dépense quotidienne de la famille.
Son projet le plus important pour lui serait de faire des études de comptabilité et d’ouvrir un grand magasin de vente de produits divers.
texts.en: The "Jeunes Eglise de Fissel" loan group is a group of young Catholics who belong to the same parish. Their objective is to live their faith as young people while trying to do something with their lives. Their president, who is sitting on the left of the photo, has a cattle raising activity and is a trader; he has five years of experience in this field. He is single and still lives with his parents. He does, however, contribute to the family's daily expenses. His main intention is to study accounting and to open a large shop selling a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening and reselling.

loans.name: L'aide De Dieu Group

texts.fr:
Mr  HAMIDOU représente le groupe L’AIDE DE DIEU. Marié, il est père de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 02 vont à l’école et il a 06 personnes a sa charge.
Mr fait l’agro pastoral depuis plus 30ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son village. 
Il veut s’acheter 02 moutons pour engrosser et revendre, 03kg de sésames, 09kg de maïs et 01 sac d’engrais pour semer.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut scolariser ses enfants et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.  Il ambitionne agrandir son activité et acheter des parcelles construire pour leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Mr Hamidou represents the group L'Aide de Dieu. He is married and is the father of five children. The oldest is 14 years old and the youngest is two. Two of them attend school and he has six dependents.
 
He has been involved in pastoral farming for over 30 years. He resupplies in his village.

He wants to buy two sheep to be fattened and resold; three kilos of sesame, nine kilos of maize and one bag of fertilizer for sowing.
 
With his profits he wants to educate his children and take better care of his family. He aims to expand his business and buy building plots for his children.

loans.use: buy two sheep to fatten and resell, 3 kilos of sesame, 9 kilos of maize and 1 bag of fertilizer to be sown.

loans.name: Verena

texts.en:
Verena is 38 years old. She will use her Kiva loan to cover labour costs during rice production. With the profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labour costs during rice production.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 26 years old. He is married with two children. He will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production. They need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from hIS farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy tills their rice land together with her husband. She is 36 years old and lives in Mahayag. Juvy grows corn and palay rice and it is the primary source of their living. With a family to feed, Juvy takes care of her farming activities. Recently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer. Juvy wishes to purchase another parcel of land to cultivate.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Les Freres Unis Group

texts.fr:
Mr  YABRE représente le groupe LES FRERES UNIS. Marié, il est père de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 07mois. 03 vont à l’école et il a 06 personnes a sa charge.
Mr fait l’agro pastoral depuis plus 30ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son village. 
Il veut s’acheter 04 moutons pour engrosser et revendre et 03 sacs d’engrais pour la semence.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut renforcer son activité.  Il ambitionne agrandir son activité, faire aussi du commerce détail et s’occuper mieux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Yabré represents the Les Frères Unis group. He is married and the father of five children. The oldest is 15 years old and the youngest is seven months. Three of them go to school and he has six dependents.

He has been involved in pastoral farming for over 30 years. He resupplies in his village. 

He wants to buy four sheep to fatten and resell, and three bags of fertilizer for the seeds.
 
With his profits, he wants to strengthen his business. He aims to expand his activity, do some retail trading and take better care of his family.

loans.use: buy four sheep to fatten and resell, and three bags of fertilizer for the seeds.

loans.name: Rigoberto Antonio

texts.es: Rigoberto de 53 años de edad el es un hombre confiable, trabajador y muy responsable el se dedica desde hace varios años a realizar viajes en su camión a todas las colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, mucha gente lo busca por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, Rigoberto está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo para poder continuar con su trabajo y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 53 years old; he is a trustful man, hardworking, and very responsible. He makes a living, for several years now, making trips in his truck to all the colonies that are near his place of residency. A lot of people look out for him because he is responsible when it comes to driving. 

Rigoberto is requesting a loan to purchase tires and give maintenance to his vehicle to be able to keep working and giving his family the best quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase tires and give maintenance to his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and insecticides.

loans.name: Sydonie

texts.en:
Sydonie, aged 41, is a Cameroonian who is divorced with four children: the oldest, aged 15, is in secondary school while the youngest is two years old. She has been in her food selling business for over four years which makes her very experienced and stable. 

Sydonie's business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers and also due to the lack of restaurants. Therefore, many people choose to eat what she is selling. This loan will be used to buy plantains and fresh roast corn to sell which will increase her turnover.

loans.use: to buy plantains and fresh roast corn to sell

loans.name: Phebols

texts.en:
Phebols is a 33 year old, married woman with four children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Phebols's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. She is taking out a PHP 9,985.70 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Phebols has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Phebols would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Usman A

texts.en:
Usman A is a 35-year-old farmer from Gwanki.  As a Babban Gona member, Usman A, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Usman A can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 
The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Usman A is ambitious and is aiming to reap 100 bags per hectare this season. He is hopeful because he plans to use this loan to access improved seeds with very high yield potential. When asked about the future, Usman A said:  “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Zahardini, Hassana, and Usaina. Ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.”  With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs that could double his yield

loans.name: Sampson

texts.en:
Sampson is married and a father of three. He is dedicated to the well-being of his family. For this reason, he decided to open his own business selling rice, beans and gari to generate additional income that would help to cover her family's expenses. Sampson works from 8 p.m.to 5 p.m. 

He is in need of capital to buy rice and beans to sell to customers. This loan will help him to buy enough rice and beans so that he can serve a wider spectrum of customers. Sampson's goal is to improve his service, attract more customers, and increase his sales and income. His dream is to continue growing his business so that his financial situation becomes more stable and he is able to pay off his debts from his loans. In this way, he will also be able to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy enough rice and beans so that he can serve a wider spectrum of customers.

loans.name: Bakuwa Saratu

texts.en: Bakuwa Saratu is a 57-year-old farmer from R/Tabo. As a Babban Gona member, Bakuwa Saratu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Bakuwa Saratu can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Bakuwa Saratu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Bakuwa Saratu said, “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children Nuhu, Victoria, and Haruna and in five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs

loans.name: Zangu

texts.en: Zangi is a farmer from Gwanki.  As a Babban Gona member, Zangi is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Zangi can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Zangi is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season due to the high-quality inputs he will access with this loan. When asked how he plans to spend the money he will make from selling his maize,  he said: “I plan to use the money  to educate my children Nasiru, Mujahidu, and  Safiya. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs

loans.name: Marina Concepcion

texts.es: Marina de 54 años de edad es trabajadora y responsable, ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, jugos, refrescos y agua su negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar muy transitado por esa razón posee mucha clientela, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Marina esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marina, 54 years old, is hardworking and responsible, she makes a living selling soft drinks, juices, soda, and water. Her business is located in a very busy place, which is the reason she has a lot of customers. She lives in her own house with relatives. 

Marina is requesting a loan to purchase more wholesale products to be able to keep going with her job, given that it is her only source of income, and that way to have a better quality of life alongside her family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, juices, sodas and water at wholesale

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is a farmer from Mahayag. She is 52 years old and always looks out for the welfare of her family. Helena plants corn and palay rice and values her farming activities as her primary source of income. In her pursuit to increase her sales, Helena availed another loan from PMPC. She has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other items. In the future, Helena wants to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru: Гулрухсор родилась в 1991 году. Она порядочная и трудолюбивая женщина. Гулрухсор замужем. Ее муж водитель. Они вместе живут на Севере Таджикистана. Гулрухсор несколько месяцев назад начала свой бизнес скотоводством. Она хочет развивать свой бизнес и увеличить свой доход. Гулрухсор с такой целью обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она теперь нуждается финансовой поддержке. Гулрухсор запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
