Gulruhsor was born in 1991. She is a conscientious and hard-working woman. Gulruhsor is marrried. Her husband is a driver. They live together in the north of Tajikistan. Several months ago, Gulruhsor launched her own cattle business. She would like to develop her business and increase her income. With this goal in mind, she has completed the Reach for Success course organized by the Businesswomen's Association and received a certificate. 
Now she needs financial support. Gulruhsor is applying for a loan in the amount of 1,500 TJS to buy cattle. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle for launching her new business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 54 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rosalinda has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Rosalinda has taken a PHP 9,757.10 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Rosalinda is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Verna Liza

texts.en:
Verna Liza is 27 years old, married, and has two children. 

Verna Liza and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Verna Liza is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,828.50 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Verna Liza has been with NWTF since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Verna Liza can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 52 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Virginia has restarted her fishing business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Virginia has taken a PHP 9,950 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Virginia is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 42-year-old lady living in Rawalpindi. She has four children. She has a small business of reselling fruits in her community. She has been supplying fruits to the local community for eight years. She has built a goodwill through her hard work and good business in her community. Currently, she wants to increase her income by selling a larger quantity. Therefore, she wants some financing to help her purchase fruits and then resell it at a higher price to earn profits. For this purpose, she has requested a loan from Brac Pakistan, a Kiva partner, to help her purchase fruits for reselling purposes.

loans.use: to buy fruits to resell.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 23-year-old, single man from Attell, a small village near Tulkarm. He lives with his family in a small house. Mahmoud wanted to open his own business and improve the family conditions, so he decided to open a store for selling mobile phones. It is a good business and Mahmoud has good experience in the maintenance.

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more inventory for his mobile store to resell. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to increase his sales and also improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for his mobile store to resell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his poultry business, which sells chickens. 

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken feed and birds to increase business sales, and will help Emmanuel to generate greater profits and buy eggs to sell. Emmanuel hopes that in the future he will be able to have a better standard of living with his family. 

Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed and birds to increase  business sales.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: Phea is 44 years old, married woman and makes baskets for sale. Her husband is a 45-year-old salt seller. They live with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. One of the children works as a worker and another is a student. All of them can earn approximately $11 per day. Now she would like to apply for a loan of $500 to cover the expenses for her child’s wedding. With this loan, she will be able to give her child a Khmer traditional wedding. In the future, she hopes that she will have a new house with a fence around it.

loans.use: To cover her child's wedding expenses

loans.name: Maribel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maribel comenzó a trabajar en su propio salón de belleza con la motivación de sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos y darles la oportunidad de tener una vida digna y cómoda.
Esta dedicada mujer trabaja todos los días desde las 9:00 am hasta las 7:00 pm. Aprendio este oficio a través de cursos que realizo en diferentes academias.
Siempre sintió gusto y curiosidad por ser independiente y generar sus propios ingresos, por eso fue que inicio con este proyecto y hasta ahora ha podido recoger muy buenos frutos de su trabajo.
Su mayor sueño es tener el salón de belleza más reconocido del municipio de Cerete.
Ella solicita un préstamo para aplicar un poco de capital a su empresa y hacerla un poco mas fuerte comprando insumos como shampoos, tratamientos, cremas para masajes, entre otros. Con estos elementos podrá continuar con su labor y poco a poco podrá alcanzar su tan anhelado sueño.
texts.en: Maribel started to work in her own beauty shop with the motivation of getting her 3 children ahead and providing them with a comfortable and dignified life. This dedicated woman works from 9am until 7 pm every day. She learned the trade through courses that she took in different academies. She has always had the desire and curiosity to work independently and generate her own money. So she started this project and up to now she has gotten good returns from her labor. Her main dream is to have the best known salon in the Municipality of Cerete.  She is requesting a loan to inject a little capital into her company and make it stronger buying supplies like shampoo, hair treatments, massage creams, amongst others. With these products she can continue to work and little by little realize her much longed for dream.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es una persona muy entusiasta y responsable, es soltero, tiene 40 años de edad, actualmente tiene 5 hijos; vive junto a su familia en Sololá.
El se dedica a la agricultura específicamente cultivo de cebolla y frijol; este digno trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad donde vive. Se dedica a ello porque lo ha aprendido de sus padres y con ello genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia. Tiene 12 años dedicándose a la agricultura. 
Juan está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de fertilizante y semilla.
Su mayor sueño es remodelar su vivienda y asi brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Juan is an enthusiastic and responsible person. He is single, 40 years old, and has 5 children. He lives together with his family in Sololá. He works in farming, specifically he grows onions and beans. He performs this worthy work in the community where he lives. He works in this because he learned it from his parents, and with it, he generates the necessary income for the support of his family. Juan is requesting a loan of Q 4,000.00 for the purchase of fertilizer and seed. His great dream is to remodel his home and so afford his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: La Selva Primera Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad alejada en el estado de Oaxaca, las personas se dedican la agricultura o ganadería, algunos adultos de la selva hablan el mazateco, su lengua materna. Otra característica especial del lugar es la vegetación y los cerros que la rodean, en la localidad hay un capilla donde cada fin de semana hay misa, una escuela primaria, un preescolar y una telesecundaria, algunos alumnos asisten a la preparatoria en otras comunidades.

“La Selva Primera” es un grupo de préstamo integrado por 7 mujeres trabajadoras, cada una de ellas se dedica a una actividad económica productiva diferente: Susana- Venta De Frutas, Lea- Venta De Calzado Por Catalogo, Andrea- Venta De Calzado Por Catálogo, Maria- Cria Y Venta De Cerdo, Ramona- Venta De Antojitos, Jacinta- Venta cosméticos por catálogo y Felicitas- papelería y venta de anotojitos.

Felicitas  es también integrante del grupo y desde hace 6 años ha establecido en su hogar una pequeña papelería y los fines de semana vende antojitos. El hacerse cargo de su mamá es algo que le gusta demasiado. Ha solicitado un préstamo con el fin de ampliar su papelería, es por eso que comprará papel, anaqueles, libretas ,colores, sacapuntas,juegos de geometría, tóner para la copiadora, hojas blancas, pegamento, plastilina, lápiz, lapiceros, par de esta manera ofrecer un mejor surtido a sus clientes y no se vean en la necesidad de viajar una hora en autobús para realizar la compra de alguno de estos artículos. Con las ganancias obtenidas remodelará el local para futuramente poner una refresquería y de esta manera generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
In a community outlying the state of Oaxaca, the people devote themselves to agriculture or livestock.  Some of the adults from the jungle speak Mazateco, their maternal language.  Other special characteristics of this place are the vegetation and the hills that are around it.  In this place there is a chapel, where there is mass every weekend, a primary school, a preschool, and a high school through satellite television.  Some students attend high school in other communities.

“La Selva Primera" is a communal bank comprised of seven hard-working women.  Each one of them works at a different productive financial activity.  Susana- Sells fruit, Lea- Sells shoes by catalog, Andrea- Sells shoes by catalog,  Maria- Raises and sells pigs, Ramona- Sells snacks, Jacinta- Sells cosmetics by catalog, and Felicitas- Sells stationery items and snacks.

Felicitas is also a member of the group.  Six years ago she established a small stationery business in her home.  On the weekends she sells snacks.  Taking care of her mother is something that she really likes.

She has requested a loan in order to expand her stationery business.  In order to do so she will buy paper, shelves, notebooks, crayons, pencil sharpeners, geometry sets, toner for copiers, white pages, glue, clay, pencils, and pens.  This way she will have better stock to offer her customers, and they will not have to travel an hour by bus to buy some of these items.  With the income that she gets she will remodel the place so that in the future she can put up a refreshment stand and generate more income this way.

loans.use: to buy stock for her stationery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools to build houses.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, está casado, tiene la edad de 48 años y vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos como abonos, plaguicidas y foliares para la asistencia de sus siembras de frijol y maíz, el se dedica desde hace varios años atrás a estos cultivos y espera este año le vaya bien. El tiene como meta aumentar la producción cosechable y generar más ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y tener un futuro más estable. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gerardo, 48, is married and lives with his wife, who is his biggest priority.

With the loan he's going to buy inputs such as soil amendments, pesticide, and foliar fertilizer for his bean and corn crops.  He has worked these crops for several years, and he hopes this year goes well for him.  His goal is to increase his crop production and generate more income for his family's well-being and to have a more stable future.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He had not previously had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to help with the corn and bean crop

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, está planeando surtir nuevamente su venta de ropa con productos que sus clientes buscan día a día, comprara faldas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas, blusas, pijamas y ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños/as. Espera satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes y mantener su preferencia en el mercado.
El capital de trabajo que se le facilito anteriormente le sirvió para seguir manteniendo su negocio funcionando con lo que ha tenido ingresos que necesita para brindar mejor alimentación, educación y salud a su familia. Logro cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en: Marta is planning to stock her business selling clothing with products that her clients look for day to day. She will buy skirts, dresses, pants, shirts, blouses, pajamas and underwear for women. men and children. She hopes to satisfy the tastes of her customers and maintain their loyalty in  the market. The working capital that she got before helped her to keep her business functional and she generated income to provide better food, education and health for her family. She managed to pay off her debts.

loans.use: to buy skirts, dresses, pants, shirts, blouses, pajamas and underwear.

loans.name: Jose Bernardo

texts.es:
José, invirtió el préstamo anterior en mercadería para surtir la tienda con lo que ha tenido efectos positivos, entre los cuales menciona las mejoras en su vivienda, una mejor economía, cancelación de sus deudas y cuenta con nuevos clientes.
Con la visión de continuar trabajando y teniendo los ingresos que necesita para subsistir se decidió por solicitar un nuevo crédito que utilizara para comprar jugos, sodas, jugos, galletas, pan, dulces golosinas, huevos, aceite, jabón y granos básicos.
texts.en:
José invested the previous loan in merchandise for stocking his store, which has had positive results for him, such as improvements to his home and finances, the settling of his debts, and new clients.

With the view of continuing to work and obtaining the income he needs to live on, he decided to request a new loan, which he will use to buy juice, soft drinks, biscuits, bread, sweets, eggs, oil, soap, and staple grains.

loans.use: to buy juice, soft drinks, biscuits, bread, sweets, eggs, oil, soap, and staple grains

loans.name: Samuel Antonio

texts.es:
Samuel es un joven emprendedor de 21 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está soltero y no tiene hijos, él vive junto con su mamá a quien le ayuda en lo necesario, y además en casa vive un hermano de Samuel.


Samuel se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que era pequeño, específicamente realiza el cultivo de pipianes, el terreno donde donde cultiva se encuentra a 20 minutos caminando desde su casa, los cuales recorre junto con sus tíos desde primeras horas de la mañana y termina de trabajar hasta en la tarde.


Él necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos como plaguicidas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, aperos agrícolas, etc.


Samuel sueña con llegar a extender sus cultivos y de esta manera crecer económicamente y en experiencia. También sueña con llegar a tener una buena familia y ser reconocido en su comunidad como una persona de bien.

Es hombre, pero no puede cambiarle el sexo.
texts.en:
Samuel, aged 21, is a young entrepreneur. He studied as far as sixth grade and is single with no children. He lives with his mum and helps with whatever she needs. He also has a brother living at home. 

Samuel has worked in agriculture since he was little, and in particular he grows "pipianes" [a type of squash]. The land he farms is a twenty minute walk from his house. He walks there with his uncles in the early hours of the morning and doesn't finish work until the afternoon.

He needs the loan to buy supplies such as pesticides, fertilizers, weedkiller, farming tools etc. 

Samuel's dream is to be able to expand his crops and so grow financially and increase his experience. He also hopes one day to have a decent family and to be recognised in his community as a decent person.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as pesticides, fertilizers, weedkiller, farming tools etc.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es: Brenda tiene 19 años de edad, viven el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, es soltera vive con sus papás, Brenda tiene una tienda de abarrotes, desde hace 12 años sus padres instalaron la tienda aprovechando el lugar donde vive que es de mucha afluencia de persona y es muy transitado por vehículos, ahora ella es quien la atiende y desde pequeña ha estado ayudando a sus papás, Brenda también tiene una venta de tortillas y son socias con su mamá, Brenda necesita un crédito por un monto de Q. 9,000.00 para invertir en la tienda de abarrotes (azúcar, frijol, maíz, leche y otros), Brenda quiere ampliar la tienda y tenerla bien surtida para poder atender las necesidades de la personas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Brenda is 19 years old and lives in the Sololá municipality in the department of the same name. Brenda is single and lives with her parents. Brenda has a had a grocery store that her parents opened 12 years ago. They set it up, taking advantage of the fact that the people who live in Brenda's local area are very affluent, and that the area has a lot of passing traffic. 

Since she was young, Brenda has been helping her parents. Brenda also sells tortillas, in a business partnership with her mum. Brenda needs this loan of 9000 Qetzal in order to invest in groceries (by buying sugar, beans, corn, milk and more). Brenda wants to expand her shop and have it well stocked in order to tend to the needs of those in the community.

loans.use: to buy and sell groceries.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel es un pequeño caficultor de 58 años de edad. Posee una finca con 2.47 hectáreas de café, el cual trabaja desde hace 20 años. Además de producir café, también se ha dedicado a la producción de granos básicos, cítricos y musáceos; con las que ha logrado mantener una finca con diversidad en su oferta agrícola. 

En este ciclo, él está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos para el mantenimiento de su café, y garantizar una nutrición saludable de sus cafetos. Su meta, es tener una mejor cosecha este año, para tener mayores ingresos que le permitan dar a su familia mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 58, is a small coffee farmer.  He has a farm with 2.47 hectares of coffee.  He has been working it for 20 years.  In addition to producing coffee, he also produces basic grains, citrus, and bananas.  With these crops he has managed to keep his farm diversified in its agricultural offerings.

In this cycle he is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy supplies for the maintenance of his coffee and to guarantee healthy nutrition to his coffee plants.  His goal is to have a better harvest this year in order to have greater income.  This will allow him to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the maintenance of his coffee crop.

loans.name: Las Victorias Group

texts.en:
“Las Victorias” means “The Victorious Ones,” and this is the name that 10 women have chosen  to call their Friendship Bridge Trust Bank. The group is located in a rural area of Quetzaltenango in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. This is an area known as “La Tierra de Campeones,” or “The Land of Champions,” as the people fight to develop themselves and their community.

Because of her outstanding loan history, Bertha was chosen to participate in the advanced technical training program of Friendship Bridge. She has learned a great deal about making delicious jams, jellies, pies and cakes for her popular confectioner’s shop. Berta also continues to make typical Guatemalan food to sell. She is requesting a new loan that she will use to purchase flour and other ingredients for her cakes; fruit for her jams; and corn, beans, sugar and spices for her traditional Guatemalan recipes. Bertha is highly motivated to succeed and see her four children complete their education.

Understanding how to manage loans is essential to the success of Berta and the ladies in the “Las Victorias” Trust Bank. Each month, they acquire new tools and knowledge about effective business practices (customer service, pricing, marketing, budgeting, accounting) as well as ways to improve their standard of living (health, hygiene, nutrition). The effective combination of education and loans is labeled “Microcredit Plus” by Friendship Bridge. The ultimate goal is for women to empower themselves and eliminate poverty.

Bertha and the victorious ladies in the Trust Bank are most grateful to be realizing their dreams, empowering themselves as well as their families and eliminating poverty. Kiva investors are valuable partners in this effort. Thank you.

loans.use: To purchase flour and other ingredients for her cakes; fruit for her jams; and corn, beans, sugar and spices for her traditional Guatemalan recipes

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.en:
San Lucas Tolimán is an indigenous town located on southeastern shore of Lake Atitlán in Guatemala. The lake was described by Aldous Huxley as “one of the most beautiful in the world.” The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres en Acción,” or “Women in Action,” group was formed here by eight determined women. The ladies have various small commercial businesses that they are sustaining and expanding. Some of these businesses include a pizza restaurant and a beauty supply store as well as a beauty salon.

Evelin is the 38-year-old, charismatic president of the Trust Bank. She is married with three children. She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for her beauty salon, including sets of make up, hair dyes and other items. She wants to meet the desires of her clients and expand her business. Evelin is determined to be successful in every way.

The women of the Trust Bank are greatly empowered by the educational component of their monthly meetings with a Friendshp Bridge Trust Bank Officer. Their families are aided by the information that the ladies receive on nutrition, health, hygiene and the use of medicinal plants. Their businesses grow as they learn about effective business management practices including budgeting, accounting, customer service, marketing and pricing. Their self-esteem is enhanced as they learn about women’s rights. “Microcredit Plus” is what Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and loans. 

Evelin, along with her friends in the “Women in Action” Trust Bank, shares that the group is appreciative to Kiva investors for funding their loans. They are committed to fully repaying the loans on time. We look forward to reporting on their progress. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her beauty salon, including sets of make up, hair dyes and other items

loans.name: Central De Cachilaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CENTRAL CACHILAYA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, costura de busos, venta de pescado, venta de queso, servicio de construcción.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de busos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo que trabajaba en este negocio muchos años atrás, es por ello que decidieron continuar con el mismo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumento de capital (compra telas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “CENTRAL CACHILAYA” communal group will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Centro Focal de Copacaana, is comprised of eight members and is run by a board of officers of which Verónica is the president. The businesses that the group members carry out are varied including weaving blankets, sewing sports clothing, selling fish, selling cheese, and a construction service.

The credit that they will take out will benefit the small business owners including Verónica.  She says that this is the first time that she joined Pro Mujer, at the invitation of a massive promotion carried out by the institution. Currently, she has a business selling sports clothing. She says that she learned this business from her husband who has worked in this business for many years, it is for this reason that she decided to continue with the same.

That credit that she is now getting is to increase her capital to purchase fabric in bulk that she will get from the wholesale merchants in the city of El Alto, later after making the products she will sell them in her retail space. This type of work permits her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has one child. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the life insurance offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase fabric in bulk

loans.name: Ermencia Belizaria

texts.es: Ermencia está separada de su esposo, ella tiene que sacar adelante sola a sus hijos, Ermencia se dedica a la crianza de animales y este crédito lo va invertir en la compra de  terneros para aumentar su negocio, también se dedica al trabajo en el campo, Ermencia es una mujer trabajadora y comenta que le va bien en la actividad de la ganadería, Ermencia espera que su negocio mejore y que no le haga falta el dinero para mantener a sus hijos por los que lucha día a día.
texts.en:
Ermencia is separated from her husband. She has to move forward alone with her children. Ermencia makes a living by raising animals and this loan will help her to invest in the purchase of land to expand her business. She also makes a living by working in the countryside.

Ermencia is a hardworking woman and comments that her ranching business is going well for her. Ermencia hopes that her business improves and that she has enough money to support her children, for whom she fights daily.

loans.use: to purchase land.

loans.name: Sokol

texts.en:
An amount of 250,000 Albanian Lek will help Sokol to buy a dairy cow.

Sokol is a 43-year-old married man with three children who are 12, 14 and 18 years old. He pursues agriculture/fishing in order to feed his family. He lives in a coastal village, so he has the opportunity to catch natural fish. In addition to fishing, he usually plants beans, onions, and animal fodder and sells them dried. The raw dairy he gets from the current cows, he sells to a nearby dairy farm. All in all, he has his action together and is organized, according to him. However, he wants to expand his livestock because he sees that it is very profitable. This is the reason that he is requesting your help.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Estefany

texts.es:
Estefany es una joven emprendedora, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive en San Juan de Miraflores junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchos deseos de superación. Actualmente estudia la carrera profesional de Administración en un Instituto y desde hace 2 años se dedica al negocio de  venta de ropa. A su corta edad se ha convertido en una exitosa empresaria porque es muy responsable, trabajadora e innovadora.
Estefany está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería por temporada de invierno para poder surtir el negocio y obtener mayores ingresos. De esta manera su negocio crecerá notablemente y ella seguirá luchando para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Estefany is an enterprising 20-year-old young woman. She is single and lives in San Juan de Miraflores with her family.

She has a great desire to get ahead in life. She is currently studying towards a degree in Administration at an educational institution, and she has been selling clothes for two years. Although she is young, she has become a successful business owner because she is very responsible, hard-working, and innovative. 

Estefany is grateful to Kiva lenders because with the support they have given her she will be able to buy merchandise for the winter season so she can stock her business and obtain greater earnings. In this way, her business will grow considerably and she will continue fighting to get ahead in life with her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the winter season for her clothing store

loans.name: El Mirador De Cconchaccalla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL MIRADOR DE CCONCHACALLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Jeronimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina ella es conviviente y tiene 31 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes, ovejas y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes, ovejas y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes,ovejas y gallinas.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “EL MIRADOR DE CCONCHACALLA”. This bank is located in San Jeronimo district, part of Cusco province and Cusco department.

This member is Justina. She is in a common-law marriage, is 31 years old, and has 1 child. She works selling and raising animals. She raises guinea pigs, sheep and hens. She raises and fattens them and later sells them at different fairs. With this small business, she has gotten her child ahead. Her dream is to have a retail space where she can sell her guinea pigs and hens. Justina asks for the loan to purchase guinea pigs, sheep and hens, and feed for the guinea pigs, sheep and hens.

The other members work in agriculture, a cereal sales business, a grocery store, and a selling animals.

The member is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this means and promises to make her payments in the amounts and time scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs, sheep and hens and feed for the guinea pigs, sheep and hens.

loans.name: Abasi

texts.en:
Abasi is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with one of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Abasi has been working hard to manage his business selling maize flour. 

To help expand his business, Abasi has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize flour to sell and will help Abasi to generate greater profits and add more types of produce, like beans, to sell. Abasi hopes that he will be able to improve his family's standard of living in the future.

Abasi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves microentrepreneurs like Abasi, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy baking ingredients like flour, wheat, fruit, and natural flavors.

loans.name: Pearson D Group

texts.en:
Ningzavung, a featured member of the group Pearson D shown with her hand raised, considers education for her children the first priority. She has hopes for her children in the near future by giving them education. The solar loan will help the family after dawn, since there is irregularity in the power supply in their area. The shortage of power hampers the study timing of her children after dawn, which leads to poor results in their exams. Taking into account her children’s education, she wants to provide a better facility for her children’s education by providing them with solar lighting, which she will purchase with the loan so that her children will do better in their studies. It will also help her in performing her household chores swiftly after sunset.

Ningzavung, a mother of four, sustains her family by selling dried fish and smoked meat while her husband earns through driving passengers in an auto-rickshaw making a monthly income of approximately 13,000 INR. There are two school-going children in the family.

The group was formed by women with similar interests to get the solar loan.

loans.use: To buy a mini solar for house lighting system

loans.name: Ermelinda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ermelinda, es casada, vive con su esposo de 39 años, también tiene bajo su responsabilidad a su madre de 63 años de edad, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero, desde hace dos años administra una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad, no tiene un horario fijo para trabajar, el oficio lo aprendió dentro de su familia.
Con el préstamo surtirá la tienda con los productos que sean necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, comprara maíz, frijoles, arroz, harina, dulces, especias, bebidas, azúcar, sal, etc., espera ofrecer mejores oferta que la competencia, atraer nuevos clientes, aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
Su sueño es tener un negocio con más rentabilidad que le permita ser autosuficiente y brindar a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario y una salud adecuada a su madre.
texts.en:
Ermelina is married. She lives with her 39-year-old husband. She also looks after her 63-year-old mother. She does not have outside economic help. For two years, she has been running a general store. She does not have fixed working hours. She learnt this trade from her family.

She will use the loan to stock her store with the necessary products to satisfy the needs of her customers. She will buy maize, beans, rice, flour, sweets, spices, drinks, sugar, salt, and other items. She hopes to offer better products than her competition, attract new customers, and increase her sales and profits.

Her dream is to have a more profitable business which will allow her to be self-sufficient, offer her family better food and clothing, and keep her mother in good health.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, rice, flour, sweets, spices, drinks, sugar, salt, and other items

loans.name: Corazones De Turi  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Corazones de Turi está formado por 9 socias y 1 socio que luchan por obtener mejores días para sus familias, viven en la comunidad Corazón de Turi que pertenece a la parroquia de Turi que se encuentra al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, limita al norte, con la ciudad de Cuenca, al este, la parroquia  Valle, al sur, la parroquia Tarqui y al oeste, la parroquia Baños. El centro parroquial, se ubica a 200 m. de altura con respecto a la ciudad de Cuenca, es un balcón, donde concurren los cuencanos, turistas nacionales y extranjeros a recrearse con el hermoso panorama. La iglesia parroquial y la loma de Hitocruz son otros lugares muy atractivos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Jenny, es una mujer muy trabajadora que hace 3 años es parte activa del grupo de crédito Corazones de Turi, le gusta esta forma de créditos por la amistad y solidaridad que existe entre todas sus compañeras y en cada reunión comparten gratos momentos. 
La Señora Jenny tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años, su primer hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo labora como maestro de la construcción, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros.
Doña Jernny se dedica a la cría de pollos, ganado y cerdos, también a la agricultura que es para su casa y para la venta, desde hace 6 mese se dedica a entregar volantes en la calle de una prestigiosa empresa. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cerdos y  alimento para animales. Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The credit group, Corazones de Turi, is comprised of nine female members and one male member who fight to obtain better days for their families. They live in the community Corazón de Turi which belongs to the parish Turi, which is located to the South of the city of Cuenca. It is bordered to the North by the city of Cuenca, to the East by the parish Valle, to the South by the parish Tarqui and to the West by the parish Baños. The parish center is located 200 meters above the city of Cuenca. It's a balcony where people from Cuenca, national tourists and foreigners meet to rejuvenate in the beautiful panorama. The parish church and the knoll of Hitocruz are other very attractive areas.

One of the members of this group is Jenny. She's a very hardworking woman who has been an active part of the credit group Corazones de Turi for the past three years. She likes this form of loan because of the friendship and solidarity that exists among all of the partners. At every meeting they share fond moments.

Jenny is 25 years old, married, and the fruit of her conjugal union is that she has conceived two sons who are five and three years old. Her eldest son is studying in a little school in the town. Her husband works as a master of construction. She doesn't have her own house so she lives with her in-laws.

Jenny makes a living by raising chickens, cattle, pigs and crops for her household and for sale. For the past six months she has made a living by handing out flyers in the street for a prestigious business. The money from her loan will go toward the purchase of chickens, pigs and animal feed. Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: Buy chickens, pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Santos Estela

texts.es:
Santos, está brindando su apoyo incondicional a su compañero de vida para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, esto lo hace con las ganancias que genera al continuar trabajando en la venta de mariscos, mismo que funciona con la ayuda de la inversión del crédito anterior.
Nuevamente requiere de capital para comprar pescado, camarones, conchas y otros moluscos, así ofrecer productos frescos y de mayor calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Santos is giving unconditional support to her partner to meet the basic needs of his family. She does this with the profits she generates from selling shellfish, which she continues to do thanks to the help of the previous loan.

She needs capital again to buy fish, prawns, conches, and other molluscs so she can offer fresh and better-quality products to her clients.

loans.use: to buy fish, prawns, conches, and other molluscs

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es:
Benedicto, es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en alquiler en una casa que se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario. El trabaja de ayudante de cerrajero  y gana un jornal diario.
El crédito lo requiere para incrementar el numero de herramientas de cerrajería que posee

El sueño de Benedicto es tener su propio taller de cerrajería dar trabajo a varias personas.
texts.en:
Benedicto is single and has no children. He lives in a rented house, which is located in the city of El Alto. 

He studied up to secondary school. He works as a locksmith’s assistant and earns a daily wage. The loan he needs is for increasing the number of locksmiths' tools he owns. 

Benedicto’s dream is to have his own locksmiths' workshop and give work to several people.

loans.use: to increase the number of locksmiths' tools he owns

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 33 years old, married and supports three people who are adults. He still does not have children yet. He has been baking cakes to sell to his customers with a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He has applied for a loan of KES 50,000, which he will use to to buy more cake ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar and Blue Band margarine for making cakes.

He will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family's basic needs. He desires to grow his business and open a big bakery in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more cake ingredients

loans.name: Dúo Durasnales Group

texts.es: Dúo Durasnales, representado por doña Elsa Alejandra, tiene dos hijos que estudian, doña Elsa tiene una tienda de venta de consumo diario como, golosinas y granos básicos, arroz, frijol, maíz también gaseosas, jugos. También venden los fines de semana tamales y hacen tortillas pero el negocio lo tienen junto con su mama quien ya es mayor de edad, su tienda la tiene desde hace cinco años. Doña Elsa desea ayudar a sus hijos y darles estudio ya que ella no pudo terminar los mismos y verlos en una mejor condición,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la venta.
texts.en:
“Durasnales” Group

This group is represented by Doña Elsa Alejandra. She has two children who are studying. Doña Elsa has a store where she sells everyday consumer products such as snack foods, basic grains, rice, beans, corn, as well as sodas and juices. On the weekends, she also sells tamales and tortillas. She manages her business with her elderly mother. Elsa has managed her store for five years.

She wants to help her children and provide for their studies since she was not able to finish her education. Elsa also wants to see her children in better conditions. She is requesting a loan in order to buy food products to sell.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Luis Adrian

texts.es:
Luis es un joven trabajador, tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Nazca junto a su familia.
Desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de periódicos y revistas en un puesto que tiene y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, emprendedora, honesta y sobre todo porque siempre se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia.
Luis está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar mercadería para el negocio como carros de colección y rompecabezas de dinosaurios, con esto obtendrá mayores ingresos y seguirá esforzándose para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a hardworking young man. He is 30 years old, single, and lives with his family in Nazca.

For several years, Luis has been selling newspapers and magazines from a stand that he owns. He is doing very well because he is a responsible, enterprising, and honest person. Above all else, he is constantly striving to help his family move forward.

Luis is a grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the support they have provided. He will be able to buy merchandise for his business, such as collectible toy cars and dinosaur puzzles. This will help him generate more income. Luis continues to strive toward improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise that he can sell from his news stand.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
She is married and a mother of three children, all below the age of 15. They live in a four-bedroom house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced so many difficulties in life including sickness, accidents, maltreatment from her in-laws, the death of her family members who were supportive of her, poverty in her general family and being unable to provide for her family's needs.

With this new loan she requested, she will rent farmland, employ people to work the farms and invest in the marketing of vegetable oil. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has a good side for the marketing of her oil and the demand for food crops is high. She has been in farming for a long time. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate prices and they will not have to travel long distances to the market for purchases. 

Concerning the profit made from this loan, she will expand her farm size, pay her children's school fees, save to undertake bigger investments and provide medication for her family. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and the training the members receive on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed

loans.use: To buy farm seedlings, rent farm land, and buy vegetable oil to sell

loans.name: Hector De Jesus

texts.es: Héctor es un experimentado y luchador hombre de 65 años de edad que quien a pesar de su edad no se queda quieto y trabaja incasablemente pro tener una mejor vida y sentirse útil y a gusto consigo mismo, se dedica a la venta de mercancía, como ropa y accesorios los cuales distribuye en los pueblos pues no tiene un local prefiere ir e interactuar directamente con las personas y venderlas una idea, con estos ingresos y forma de trabajar se siente útil y aportante para su familia pues su carisma y su gran experiencia son aspectos muy fuertes para el éxito de su negocio. Solicita un crédito para la compra de más mercancía para continuar con sus laborales y ofertar a más personas. Su sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando y conseguir más activos para tener una buena vida
texts.en:
Héctor is an experienced and determined man who is 65 years old. Despite his age, he remains active and works tirelessly to have a better life. Héctor feels useful and at ease with himself. He sells merchandise, such as clothes and accessories, by distributing from town to town since he does not have a shop. Héctor prefers to interact directly with people and sell them an idea. With the income he earns from his work, Héctor feels useful since he is able to support his family. His charisma and wealth of experience are strong factors that determine the success of his business.

Héctor is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise so that he can continue his work and offer goods to more people. His dream is to be healthy so that he can continue working. By remaining active, he will have a good life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise that he can distribute from town to town.

loans.name: Chienkonpang I Group

texts.en:
This is Chiengkonpang (I) Group led by Kholly. She is the featured profile member pictured with her hand raised. She lives in Churachandpur in the Northeastern state of India. 

This family needs a solar lighting system since there is irregularity and shortage of power supply in the area, which limits the study hours of the children after sunset. With the installation of a solar system, the children will have longer hours to study in the evening conveniently under the light. It will also help the mother in performing household chores in the evening.

The family has three children, including a 15-year-old boy, a 10-year-old girl and a 3-year-old boy. Considering their competency in education, their mother, Kholly, needs a loan so that her children are given better facilities to study. She believes that the solar home lighting will make a better study environment for the children – studying in low light can have a bad impact on children’s eyes. Since lighting products are bright, they will provide conducive luminescence for reading.

The rest of the group members also need solar for their respective income-generating activities. The group members' activities can be classified as variety store, pan shop, weaving and garment shop.

loans.use: To buy a 45 watt mini solar home lighting system to install in the room for her children to study for longer hours past sunset.

loans.name: Raquelina

texts.es:
Raquelina de 27 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado de nivel académico,  está acompañada el esposo trabaja de albañil.  En esta relación Raquelina ha procreado 3 hijos dos de ellos están en la escuela,  con Raquelina solo vive el esposo y los hijos.

Raquelina tiene un negocio de calzado en frente del mercado, este negocio lo tiene ya desde hace seis meses este oficio se lo enseño  una amiga que tiene negocio de calzado, entonces ella decidió poner su propio negocio; ella viaja en bus en una distancia de 30 minutos que se tardan, pero también Raquelina tiene el negocio de pollos de engorde esto lo tiene en su casa y se lo enseño la madre,  ya que ella tenía este negocio pero la mamá se enfermó y quedaron unos pollos bien pequeños entonces ella los cuido y así fue como le gusto este negocio desde ya hace un año esto lo genera bastantes ingresos a ella y a la familia. 

El préstamo que está solicitando lo necesita para comprar más calzado de hombre, niños y mujer,  que por la época que vienen las fiestas patronales del lugar se vende más, esto le va ayudar más porque así  generara más ingreso y surtirá mas el negocio para que tengan una mejor estabilidad económica

El sueño de  Raquelina  es poder tener una zapatería muy grande, poder tener un local propio en una casa grande y darle trabajo a las personas que hoy en día necesitan trabajar y ella ese es el sueño poder darle trabajo a las personas y tener una muy buena zapatería que la visiten muchos compradores y reconocida.
texts.en:
Raquelina is 27 years old and has a ninth-grade education. She is married, and her husband works in construction. From this relationship, Raquelina has had three children, two of whom are in school. Only her husband and the kids live with Raquelina.

Raquelina has a footwear business across from the market. She has had this business for six months. A friend who has a shoe store taught her the business, so she decided to set up her own shop. She travels for about 30 minutes by bus. Raquelina also has a business raising chickens in her house. Her mother taught her that business, as she had the business, but then fell ill. She still had some very small chickens, so Raquelina took care of them, and that was how she came to enjoy this business. For the last year, this has generated a quite a bit of income for her and the family.

She needs the loan that she is requesting in order to buy more men's, children's, and women's footwear, because sales increase during the upcoming patron saint festivals in her area. This is going to help her because then she will generate more income and stock up the business in order to have better financial stability.

Raquelina's dream is to be able to have a very big shoe store, to be able to have her own commercial space in a large house, and to give jobs to the people who need to work these days. This is her dream, to be able to give work to people and to have a very good, well-known shoe store visited by many shoppers.

loans.use: to buy more men's, children's, and women's footwear, because sales increase during the upcoming patron saint festivals in her area.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
She is married and a mother of two children. They live in a two-bedroom house in the Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced so many challenges in life including the death of her family members who were supportive of her, sickness, accidents, poverty that causes her to be unable to provide for her family and debts she is unable to meet.
.
With this new loan she requested, she will employ people to clear and work her farms and she will use part of it to buy seedlings for planting cocoa, yams and beans. She will also buy manure for her vegetables. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has a good side for farming, the land belongs to her, there is a good means of transportation and she has been doing it for a long period of time. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate prices and the will no longer have to travel to the market for purchases. 

Concerning the profit made from this loan, she will expand her farming size, pay her children's school fees, save to undertake a bigger investment and provide medication for her family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and the training that the members receive on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed

loans.use: To pay for farm clearing and to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Verginis

texts.en:
She is married and blessed with four children. They live in a four-bedroom house in the Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced so many difficulties in life including the death of her family members, sickness in her family, an accident that almost took away one of her brothers, and general poverty in her family that caused them to quit school at tender ages.

With the new loan she requested, she will pay for the weeding of her farm, buy fertilizer, buy two piglets, and feed for the piglets. She will use part of the loan as transportation cost for the crops from the farm to the market. She believes her business will succeed because her farm is just by the river that provides water for spreading the crops. She has regular customers that buy her crops from the farm at times and because she has been farming for a long time. With this business activity, the community will benefit from the moderate prices she will offer on the crops. The population will not suffer malnutrition again and the distance to buy food will be reduced.
 
With the profit made from this loan, she will expand her farming business, pay her children's school fees and save. She will also provide medication for her family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates, the convenient repayment intervals and the training that the members receive in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, feed and piglets and pay for labor

loans.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es:
José es un productor de 31 años de edad y caficultor desde hace 10 años. Padre de tres menores; a los que cría junto a su esposa, y a quienes transmite su entrega y dedicación a la caficultura; pero también la importancia de estudiar para tener una educación que les ayude a desarrollarse en el ámbito laboral.

Con el cumplimiento de las recomendaciones técnicas que recibe de parte del equipo técnico que lo apoya, ha logrado que su cosecha se incremente hasta en un 20% año con año. Su  meta es continuar mejorando, por lo que para este ciclo está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar los insumos necesarios para mejorar la nutrición de su cafetal, y avanzar en dirección a la meta que se ha propuesto.

Su sueño es contar con una finca de café de primer mundo, logrando una alta calidad que le permita introducirse en el mercado de las bebidas gourmet.
texts.en:
Jose, a 31-year-old, has been a coffee producer and farmer for the last 10 years. He is the father of three children, who he raises with his wife, and to whom he passes on his devotion and dedication to coffee growing; but he also impresses upon them the importance of studying to earn an education that will help them develop in the workplace.

Having followed  the technical advice he gets from the technical team that supports him, Jose has managed to increase his harvest by up to 20% from year to year. 

His goal is to continue the improvements, so for this cycle he is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary inputs to improve the nutrition of his coffee plants, and advance towards the goal he has set.

His dream is to have a modern first-world coffee farm, and achieve the high quality that would allow him to break into the gourmet-drink market.

loans.use: buy the necessary inputs to improve the nutrition of his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Edwin Armado

texts.es:
Edwin de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a hacer los oficios del hogar,  también es la que se encarga del cuidado de los niños, también hace bordados y los vende con esto contribuye a los gastos del hogar. Tienen dos hijos el mayor tiene 13 años está haciendo quinto grado, la niña aun no asiste a la escuela, junto a ellos vive un sobrino de la esposa de él.

Edwin se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a la actividad productiva, su padre por medio de las correcciones que le hacía fue como lo hizo que fuera una persona de bien para la sociedad, él es un líder en la comunidad anda en todo los proyectos que se realizan en la comunidad, por el tipo de actividad de la zona es que se dedican solamente a la agricultura. El trabajo lo tiene cerca de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie, nadie más se dedica a la actividad, y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 10:00 am.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para pagar a personas que le ayuden con la siembra, compra de semilla, pesticidas, herbicidas, pago del alquiler del terreno en donde cultivara y para pagar un dinero que debe. 

Desea tener primero lo más necesario para la familia, que sus hijos estudien y se preparen, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida.
texts.en:
Edwin is 35 years old, and studied through 8th grade. He is in a relationship, and his partner takes care of the household chores. She also has the charge of caring for the children, as well as makes hats and sells them; with this she contributes to the household expenses. They have two children; the oldest is 13 and in 5th grade while the girl does not yet attend school; also, one of her nephews lives with them.

Edwin works in agriculture, and has over 20 years of experience with this activity; his father, through his guidance and upbringing, was how he was made to be a good person in society. He is a leader in the community and looks after all the projects that he does in the community, as his type of activity in the region is solely agriculture. He has the work near his house, which he gets to on foot; no one else works with him, and his working hours are 6:00 am to 10:00 am.

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to pay those that help him with sowing, to buy seed, pesticides, and herbicides, to pay rent on the land he cultivates and to pay down his debt.

He greatest wish is to have the necessities for his family, and that his children study and work hard; for this he hopes to always work hard at the same time that God grants him health and life.

loans.use: to pay people who help with sowing; to buy seeds, pesticides, herbicides; to pay the rent on the cultivated land, and to pay debt.

loans.name: Yenin

texts.en: Yenin and his wife own a small hardware store in Congo Town Monrovia. They are looking to expand into SE4ALL products to help meet the energy and efficiency needs of his community.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther heads the Logan Town Marketing association.  This women's group is into micro-financing (suss) to women members, granting small loans for business. Money collected by the group is given to a member of the group to improve their business. The group has 35 members currently and has been in operation for eight years. The profits from selling clean cookstoves and small solar home systems will allow them to grow their lending institution and to give more women loans and increase the amounts of individual loans.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Kupakwashe Group

texts.en:
Stella is a member of the Kupakwashe Group. She lives in Mbare, a high density suburb of Harare known for high crime rates. Stella is an elderly widow who is in the business of baking and selling pies. In the picture she is with her team of bakers. The other eight members of the group are into selling groceries, grains and clothing.
Stella and her group mates help women in their community to empower themselves by giving them cooking lessons free of charge. During these lessons the women are taught how to bake pies and cakes as well as cooking other traditional foods. The group has raised money and bought an industrial stove which they use during the cooking lessons. They also rent a room in which they conduct the trainings. These women then go on to sell the food they cook in order to earn a living.
The Kupakwashe group needs a combined loan of $4650 from Kiva to finance their individual businesses and also to buy more industrial stoves as the one they have limits the number of women they can help at a time.

loans.use: To buy more industrial stoves to expand her bakery business.

loans.name: Dempster

texts.en: Dempster is a husband and father of five wonderful children, two girls and three boys.  He runs a small electrical supply store at Rehab Road junction. He hopes selling SE4ALL products like clean cookstoves and small solar homes systems will be very profitable and add to his business success. The Kiva loan allows him to obtain this SE4ALL product inventory and and make a profit, allowing him to easily repay his loan.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Fatorma M.

texts.en: Fatorma has a small shop at Stephen Tolbert Estate junction selling electrical goods. He is hoping to improve his business and expand into a larger space.  Selling SE4ALL products will allow them to meet the energy and efficiency needs of the customers in their community.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica runs Global Electronics, a small business electrical supply business in Paynesville. Monica wants to add SE4ALL products like clean cookstoves and solar home systems to her product line to make more profits and meet her communities demand for energy and energy efficiency products.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build an alternative energy resource (biogas plant).

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky, 54 years of age, lives with her husband and grandson in a relocation site after their house was demolished in Metro Manila.

Vicky's husband works as a construction worker but because of age has been receiving fewer job offers nowadays. With a grandson to support and to earn their keep in the relocation site, Vicky opened a small store in front of their house selling various items to include provisions, meat products, and scrap wood used for cooking. 

In March, she attended an Orientation Seminar in SEED and was able to avail a loan of PhP 7,000 which she used to increase her stocks of provisions to include canned goods, laundry detergents and meat which are all in demand in the area. Having repaid the loan, Vicky applied for a second loan amounting to PhP 12,000 and was consequently approved. 

With this new loan, Vicky plans to buy a freezer where she can keep longer shelf life fresh and frozen meat products that she can stock and sell in bigger volume. The increase in their family's income helps Vicky to send her grandson to school.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for fresh and frozen meat products she is selling.

loans.name: Durazno 1 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the leader of the Durazno 1 Team, the team is integrated by twelve women that will invest their loans in agricultural, manufacture of baskets and textile activities. 11 women are from the Ethnicity Ixil Maya, and 1 is from the Ethnicity Quiché Maya. In average each member of the group has 4 children.
Ana is 53 years old, she is from the Ethnicity Ixil Maya. She suffered great problems, limitations and risks during the war in Guatemala, which forced her to run away from their village with her family. Ana is mother of 7 children, two of them died in the mountain during the war due to a very poor diet.
Through the credit she hope to reach her expectations to give a better future to her family. She will use the credit to purchase wicker and manufacture baskets. Her loan is of Q 2,400 ($ 306.12), she expects to get a monthly income of Q 600 ($76.53).
She considers that the credit is a great opportunity, given the scarce opportunities available to her and the community to improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase wicker and manufacture baskets

loans.name: Durazno 2 Group

texts.en:
Catarina is the leader of the Durazno 2 Group, it is is integrated by 15 women that will invest their loans in agricultural, manufacture of baskets and textiles. 12 women are from the Ethnicity Ixil Maya and 3 from the Ethnicity Quiché Maya. In average each member of the group has 5 children.
Catarina is 59 years old, she is mother of 10 children, is from the Ethnicity Ixil Maya. Catarina lived the war between the Guatemala Guerrilla and the Guatemalan Army. During this period she run away from the war, leaving behind her house and her village, she had to live in the mountains where 5 of her children died due to poor feeding.
She is grateful with the people that will finance the Group Loan, she will invest her credit in buying poultry, pigs and wicker for the manufacturing of baskets.
Her loan is of Q 1,200 ($ 153.06), she expects to get a monthly income of Q 300 ($ 38.27).

loans.use: To invest her credit in buying poultry, pigs, and wicker for the manufacturing of baskets

loans.name: Superstars Group

texts.en:
Georgina, 33, is the chairperson of the Superstars group. She is married and has 3 children. Georgina is in the business of selling groceries and she has been doing that for three years. Her major problem was having enough stock and variety for her customers to choose from. Being in the grocery business, she saw the need to offer a wider range of products. 

Georgina is therefore pleased to have been given a loan with Thrive which will enable her to grow her business.  She also greatly appreciates the trainings she received at Thrive because she now has an understanding of why her business was facing continuous problems. To her, the financial trainings equipped her with the knowledge to know and understand her business more and track its growth or failure. With the loan given to her by Thrive, Georgina wishes to add more stock to her business and with the trainings she received she can manage her business well through savings and keeping daily records of her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Tyko

texts.en: Tyko runs a small business in Paynesville selling electrical equipment and household supplies and is looking to expand into SE4ALL products to help meet the energy and efficiency needs of his community.  This husband and father of two boys and one girl has been in business for over five years and hopes selling clean cookstoves and small solar home systems will be very profitable and will allow him to easily repay his Kiva Loan.

loans.use: to pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia  es soltera pero tiene dos hijos, ella vive en El alto en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad Celia trabaja como vivandera, es decir, cocina y vende platos tradicionales bolivianos como sopa de maní, sopa chairo, jakonta, etc. Celia necesita un prestamo para comprar una maquina que le permita hacer pollo broaster que tienen buena aceptación entre los bolivianos Celia es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Celia is single but has two daughters. She lives in an adobe house that she owns. Celia works preparing and selling traditional Bolivian meals, such as peanut soup, "chairo" soup (a thick, country soup), "jakonta" (a meat stew) and more. Celia needs a loan in order to buy a machine that will allow her to make battered chicken, which is popular with Bolivian people. Celia is the only one earning an income in her household and so needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a machine for making battered chicken.

loans.name: Orfa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Orfa vive en el municipio de La Estrella, Antioquia, desde allí trabaja en su propia tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su propia casa. Es un negocio pequeño pero con mucho potencial gracias a la buena labor de Orfa quien atiende a sus clientes de una manera amable y siempre con una sonrisa.
Alterna esta actividad con trabajos domésticos en otras viviendas, esto lo hace con el afán de buscar ingresos para sostener a su familia.
Ella desea dedicarse en pleno a su tienda y desea darle un impulso bastante grande, por esta razón solicita un apoyo para la compra de una vitrina, una estantería y surtido de productos de la canasta familiar.
Con estos elementos podrá tener una oferta de productos mucho más amplia.
Siempre ha sentido gran gusto por el trabajo independiente y seguramente cumplirá con todos sus sueños.
texts.en:
Orfa lives in the municipality of La Estrella, in the Antioquia department. There she works in her grocery store, which she runs out of her home. This is a small business but it has a lot of potential thanks to Orfa's hard work tending to customers in a friendly manner, and always with a smile.

As well as working in the shop, Orfa takes care of the domestic chores in other people's home. She does this in order to earn an income to support her family.

Orfa wants to spend all of her time looking after her shop, and wants to give it a big push forward. As a result she is applying for a loan in order to buy a display case, a stand, and stock (staple goods).

With these items, Orfa can offer many more items.

Orfa has always liked working independently and will surely achieve all of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a display case, a stand, and stock .

loans.name: Jaime Jose

texts.es:
Jaime es un joven de 26 años que junto a su esposa se dedica a la caficultura en una comunidad rural ubicada al norte de Nicaragua. Para el manejo de sus cafetales recibe asistencia técnica de parte del equipo de la organización a la cual está afiliado.

Para este ciclo, él está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos que le permitan mejorar la nutrición de sus plantas de café y lograr una buena cosecha en este ciclo.

El espíritu visionario e innovador de este joven, le ha permitido ir mejorando los resultados en la calidad y precio de su cosecha, logrando de esta forma mejorar los ingresos económicos de su familia. 

Su sueño es ir aumentar el área de su finca y de café y tener mayores ingresos para ir mejorando las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is 26 years old and, alongside his wife, makes a living growing coffee in a rural community in the north of Nicaragua. Jaime receives technical help from the coffee cooperative, of which he is a member.

This loan cycle, Jaime is applying for financial support in order to buy fertilisers and manure that will allow him to look after his coffee plants and have a good harvest.

This young man's enterprising and innovating spirit has allowed him to improve the quality and price of his harvest. By doing this he has been able to increase his family's income.

Jaime's dream is to expand his farm and coffee crops, and to earn a higher income in order to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and manure that will allow him to look after his coffee plants.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
René es un hombre de 53 años de edad soltero y sin hijos.
Su vida la comparte con sus dos hermanos menores, en los cuales invierte pagándoles sus estudios superiores, su hermano del medio estudia mecánica automotriz y el menor chapa y pintura, juntos piensan formar una empresa familiar especializada en el comercio y arreglo automotriz.
René se ocupa de la búsqueda y comercio de automotores, muchas veces los autos que compra tienen fallas mecánicas y sus hermanos se ocupan de arreglarlos o llevarlos a un taller a que los reparen. Ahora los dos hermanos estudian para ocuparse por ellos mismos del arreglo y mantenimiento. René acaba de comprar un auto para su reparación y futura venta, con los gastos que realiza en los estudios de sus hermanos no tiene el suficiente dinero para comprar los repuestos que hacen falta para gran parte del motor.
Es por ese motivo que René solicita un préstamo para la compra de un motor nuevo de auto y con los beneficios pagar el estudio de sus dos hermanos.
texts.en:
René is 53 years old, single and has no children.

He shares his life with his two younger brothers. He invests in their further education. His first younger brother is studying to be a mechanic, while the youngest works with metal and painting. Together the brothers want to create a family business selling and fixing cars.

René is busy looking for and trading cars. On many occasions the cars that he buys have mechanical faults, and his brothers fix them or take them to a mechanic. Now both of René's brothers are studying so that they can fix and maintain the cars themselves. René has just bought a car to fix and later sell. With the expense of his brothers' studies, René does not have enough money to buy the spare parts for the car.

And so René is applying for a loan in order to buy an engine and to use the profits to pay for his two brothers' education.

loans.use: to buy an engine and use profits to pay for his two brothers' education.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger, es un pequeño productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua, que se dedica a la caficultura desde hace más de 8 años. Cuenta con las certificaciones de Comercio Justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E Practices, como resultado del buen manejo de su finca. 

Para mejorar la nutrición de sus plantas en este ciclo, él está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes necesarios, y lograr una buena cosecha, y con ello mayores ingresos para su familia.

Su sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, para ello trabaja cada día con mucho entusiasmo, seguro de que irá creciendo y en un futuro a través de su finca podrá recibir mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Roger is a small producer from the northern part of Nicaragua, who has worked growing coffee for over 8 years. He has certifications in Fair Trade, UTZ and C.A.F.E Practices as a result of managing his farm well.

In order to improve the nutrition of his plants in this loan cycle, he is asking for finance to buy the necessary manure and fertilisers. This will achieve a good harvest and thereby a good income for his family. His dream is to improve his family's and his own living conditions, and in order to achieve this he works daily with great enthusiasm, confident that he will continue to grow and that in the future he will be able to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy necessary manure and fertilisers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy natural health products.

loans.name: Aide

texts.es: Aide es soltera pero tiene un hijo, ella vive en la comunidad de Arajllanga junto a sus padres Aide se dedica ala compra de ganado y quiere un credito para comprar más cabezas de ganado Aide tiene experiencia en este campo por lo que no se corre ningun riesgo en ayudarla Aide ha aprendido muy bien de sus padres y actualmente ella es el sustento de la familia por lo que se recomienda ayudarla
texts.en: Aide is single but has one son. She lives with her parents in the community of Arajllanga. She works buying livestock, and wants a loan to buy more cattle. She has experience in this sector, so it is not risky to help her. She has learnt well from her parents, and is currently the breadwinner of the family, which is why it is recommended to provide her with help in this way.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Yudis Omar

texts.es:
Yudis, vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos; solamente él trabaja para tener recursos económicos con los que costea los gastos de su familia,  se dedica a vender ropa para dama, caballero y niños/as, lo hace de manera ambulante por la zona donde reside, es un oficio que aprendió de sus padres, ya  que ellos se dedican a realizar dicha actividad, no tiene un horario establecido.
Utilizar el préstamo para comprar camisas, vestidos, pantalones, trajes, ropa interior, blusas y faldas, para salir a vender y ampliar sus recorridos en busca de nuevos clientes, espera tener mayores ventas y ganancias.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más rentable para continuar teniendo ingresos para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Yudis lives with his partner and their children. He is the only one in the family who works. To cover the household expenses, he sells clothes for women, men, and children. He does this door to door in the area where he lives. He learned this work from his parents as they did the same thing. He doesn't have a set timetable. 
He will use the loan to buy shirts, dresses, pants, suits, underwear, blouses, and skirts to go out and sell and to increase his rounds in search of new customers - he hopes to have bigger sales and profits. 
His dream is to have a more profitable business so he can keep making income to meet his obligations.

loans.use: to buy shirts, dresses, pants, suits, underwear, blouses, and skirts.

loans.name: Wilmer Uriel

texts.es:
Wilmer es un pequeño cafetalero del norte de Nicaragua. Desde los 19 años se dedica a la producción de café como principal actividad económica, actualmente, con tres años de experiencia ha logrado integrarse al proceso de certificación de Comercio Justo, y apuesta a la mejora continúa para lograr mejorar la productividad de su finca. 

Este joven emprendedor logró culminar sus estudios secundario y es padre de dos menores por los cuales se esfuerza cada día para darle mejores condiciones económicas.
